story:
Yes, Amazeballs™ are actually a thing now. #sorrynotsorry

Putting ice cubes in your favourite spirits like scotch or vodka, destroys all the work the distillers put into perfecting their craft, processes and recipes. Ice can introduce elements into your spirits like chlorine, sodium, fluoride and other things added to tap water via municipal water treatment facilities.

So how can you enjoy your favourite spirits chilled while not altering their taste or watering them down? 

Our flagship product: The Amazeballs™ Gift Pack

The answer is Amazeballs™ -- premium stainless steel beverage chillers designed to do exactly that! They are constructed from #304 stainless steel - this is a food safe grade stainless steel that is used in things like cutlery and surgical tools. The two stainless steel hemispheres are welded together, with a small area left open. Then the stainless steel shell is filled with a food safe grade freezer gel - not unlike the freezer gel you find in a freezer/ice pack. The opening is then welded shut that the shell is polished to a gorgeous mirrored finish.

How to use Amazeballs™

Why do you want Amazeballs™ instead of "Drink Stones"?

Because drink stones, traditionally made from granite or soapstone, just do not work as well. The thermal capacity of stainless steel, in combination with the freezer gel core is far superior to that of what is basically a rock.  In fact we put Amazeballs™ head-to-head with a leading brand of drink stones and found that not only did Amazeballs™ chill the spirits quicker, they chilled them much better, and kept them colder for longer. The spherical shape also gives Amazeballs™ an advantage as there is more surface area for energy transfer.

Chill Test

Why I need your help.

Amazeballs™ has really been off to a good start for me - I have worked really hard at getting the product into some major retailers very quickly by cold calling and putting myself in front of the right people. That is the good news for me. The bad news is that as a small independent supplier who is dealing with major retail chains, cash flow is an issue. From the time I pay my manufacturer to the time I get paid from my vendors, I am looking at a 100-120+ day gap in cash flow.

What I'll be using the money I raise for.

As a company of one person, who lives off my draw from the company, at times it is proving very hard for me to make ends meet and fulfill some of the larger purchase orders. I'm here to raise capital so that I can pre-order and inventory Amazeballs so that I have some on hand for my vendors at quick turnaround and get me into a position of being cash flow positive - the dream for all entrepreneurs!!

How did I come up with Amazeballs™

The short story is that I worked ass backwards! I was always aware that the word was very very popular. As a marketing and branding guy, I just really felt it was a strong word, so I decided to make it a brand and find a product that would fit the name! For the complete long story of how Amazeballs™ came to be, check out my article on Medium: How I Monetized The Word Amazeballs™


All included in each gift pack.

Thanks for taking the time to check out my campaign! I hope you think Amazeballs™ are amazeballs! And if you do - be sure to pledge and share!

CHEERS!

- Dan Fallak
story_txt:
Yes, Amazeballs™ are actually a thing now. #sorrynotsorryPutting ice cubes in your favourite spirits like scotch or vodka, destroys all the work the distillers put into perfecting their craft, processes and recipes. Ice can introduce elements into your spirits like chlorine, sodium, fluoride and other things added to tap water via municipal water treatment facilities.
So how can you enjoy your favourite spirits chilled while not altering their taste or watering them down? Our flagship product: The Amazeballs™ Gift PackThe answer is Amazeballs™ -- premium stainless steel beverage chillers designed to do exactly that! They are constructed from #304 stainless steel - this is a food safe grade stainless steel that is used in things like cutlery and surgical tools. The two stainless steel hemispheres are welded together, with a small area left open. Then the stainless steel shell is filled with a food safe grade freezer gel - not unlike the freezer gel you find in a freezer/ice pack. The opening is then welded shut that the shell is polished to a gorgeous mirrored finish.
How to use Amazeballs™
Why do you want Amazeballs™ instead of "Drink Stones"?Because drink stones, traditionally made from granite or soapstone, just do not work as well. The thermal capacity of stainless steel, in combination with the freezer gel core is far superior to that of what is basically a rock.  In fact we put Amazeballs™ head-to-head with a leading brand of drink stones and found that not only did Amazeballs™ chill the spirits quicker, they chilled them much better, and kept them colder for longer. The spherical shape also gives Amazeballs™ an advantage as there is more surface area for energy transfer.
Chill Test

That is the good news for me. The bad news is that as a small independent supplier who is dealing with major retail chains, cash flow is an issue. From the time I pay my manufacturer to the time I get paid from my vendors, I am looking at a 100-120+ day gap in cash flow.

I'm here to raise capital so that I can pre-order and inventory Amazeballs so that I have some on hand for my vendors at quick turnaround and get me into a position of being cash flow positive - the dream for all entrepreneurs!!
How did I come up with Amazeballs™The short story is that I worked ass backwards! I was always aware that the word was very very popular. As a marketing and branding guy, I just really felt it was a strong word, so I decided to make it a brand and find a product that would fit the name! For the complete long story of how Amazeballs™ came to be, check out my article on Medium: How I Monetized The Word Amazeballs™

story: Serbennia needs to raise $3,000 for expenses related to her solo travel photography exhibition. These include the cost of matting and framing her photography, book publishing, posters, assorted cards, promotional and advertisement materials, booth rental space and travel to weekly Art Festivals and Exhibitions in Ohio.

These include the cost of matting and framing her photography, book publishing, posters, assorted cards, promotional and advertisement materials, booth rental space and travel to weekly Art Festivals and Exhibitions in Ohio.

story:
Not Your Average Punk

My name is Steve Ardo and I am a freelance graphic designer and illustrator based in Buffalo, NY. I graduated from the University at Buffalo in 2012 with a Bachelor of Fine Arts and a concentration in graphic design. For over 2 years I’ve been heavily involved with the “do it yourself” (DIY) art and music communities in the city where I’ve been working with local bands, record labels, and grassroots individuals that organize shows. What started out as hand-drawn flyer and handbill advertisements for basement shows has evolved into album art, T-shirt designs, collateral, and branding for DIY musicians both locally and across the country.

I am very lucky to be a visible part of the DIY scenes in Buffalo, but also very proud that I’m a part of a community of people that are accepting of everyone no matter their age, race, creed, gender identity, or sexual orientation. My hard work has given me somewhat decent exposure, but more importantly it has gave me a direction in my life I desperately lacked. My passion to help others gave my life purpose, and in turn, has become a full-time job in itself cranking out illustrations and designs. It gives me great joy that my skills are put to use by bands and musicians to help them grow and reach entirely new audiences through a visual medium. Along the way I’ve had a chance to work with some really talented musicians and build some great friendships with them. My past work has included a T-shirt illustration for San Francisco-based rapper Satellite High for a single of his (“The Bus is Late”) that was featured on the podcast Welcome To Night Vale, album art for the Denver-based, folk-punk group Creation Order Xtinction, a tour poster illustration for punk band On The Cinder along with art for a song soon-to-be released on their Bandcamp page, the back cover design for the ska-punk trio Seven Thirty Seven’s “A Little Bit of Impatience” CD release, and also merchandise plus mascot illustrations for Accidentals. In these 2+ years I have hand-drawn over 24 flyers for shows in the Buffalo area that are comprised primarily of print advertisements for basement punk shows, but also include a poster for the 2014-2015 New Year’s Eve show at Nietzsche’s. On top of that I’ve been adopted into the Aluminum Records family, a not-for-profit label that releases all of its music on a pay-what-you-want/donation-based system online, as one of their artists and designers.

I identify as a DIY artist, but the truth is that I’m part of a much greater community that works together and supports one another. This means working with limited budgets, time constraints, and with just the resources that are available within arm’s reach. Often this means not getting paid a lot of money and struggling to make end’s meet, but the genuine appreciation when I deliver the final product is worth it and keeps pushing me forward. To compensate, I’ve started creating merchandise out of my artwork to sell at art markets and at basement shows, but I’m still in the early stages of trying to get back on my feet. I figured out a means to be self-employed, but I don’t have the extra resources I need to get the ball truly rolling. It’s hard to save up money when I’m still trying to recover from almost 6½ long years of being homeless. You see, I did graduate from college and earn a BFA, but I was homeless for 4½ years while I attended school and my reward after completing it was a little over 2 years more of not having a permanent address. That long nightmare came to an end in July of 2014 when I finally had an opportunity to move into an apartment, but that didn’t solve all my problems. I have a $800 student loan monthly payment from my private lenders, and because of that never-changing number for the next 15 or so years it would be extremely difficult to pool extra money into updating anything I own or be able to “save up” like the majority of other people. With my federal loans it would be a total of $1,100 a month, but since they are currently on an income-based repayment plan I (temporarily) don’t have to worry about them. The grand total of all of my student loans is over $100,000. This frightening amount is with loans alone and not including other luxuries like paying rent and utilities that most people take for granted. Before you question why I chose to pursue my degree I encourage you to again read my backstory. The reason why I owe so much back is because my situation is unique; the overwhelmingly massive anxiety and depression due to the death of my father and the physical force my stepfather used against me (that directly lead to my homelessness) prolonged my stay at the University at Buffalo. With no other place to live I had to rely on dorms for a place to stay, and private loans were the only way I could afford to continue attending school. I don’t regret going to college to get my BFA. I overcame so many obstacles and mental illness barriers just to graduate, but I kept pushing myself further because I knew that I could do it. I wanted a brighter future for myself, and to make that happen I needed to have a degree. So even while I live my daily life with this heavy burden and with everything I have been through (and the people I’ve lost), I still have dedicated over 2 years of my life helping others visualize their messages and musical passions through my art.

(Please note: This is not a plea for you to pay off my student loans, nor am I asking for pity with what I’ve endured. My past experiences have shaped me into a strong-willed and determined individual, but they do not define who I am today. All I need is a chance to start my own business so I can be financially independent and shape my own future.)

I’m asking for help because no matter how hard I fight it, I finally realized that I can’t do it all by myself. Your contribution not only helps create something that supports fellow DIY-ers, but it also helps out someone who hasn’t had the same opportunities or advantages that his other peers have had. I might have been dealt an unfair hand from the get-go, but I’ve used my experiences to grow stronger as a person and to never give up despite the harsh trials. From what I’ve learned from these past few years and the wonderful community I’ve become apart of is that “do it yourself” doesn’t mean going at it alone.

Requests & Rewards

My plan for this campaign is simple: I’m building a small business that focuses around the freelance work I’ve already been doing along with continuing to make and sell my own merchandise. This mainly requires technological upgrades, online resources, and acquiring materials that are years overdue and necessary to move forward. Some of what the money will go towards is updating my current software (I’m running Adobe CS5 on a late 2007 MacBook), building a website, and creating an online store. Hardware is integral to creating a business as well. Flyer-making relies a lot on having access to both a scanner and a printer, and I’m currently outfitted with just a scanner that is on its last legs. I silkscreen my own T-shirts by hand and need to be able to buy them in bulk. I am fortunate enough to be able to use the resources available at a local 501(c)3 nonprofit organization I volunteered at for over 2½ years to print them, but a future goal is to have my own studio space so I can be entirely self-sufficient. Also in the works is selling T-shirts in local shops on consignment with a line of youth sizes being planned for the near-future. I’m looking to purchase a button maker along with the parts needed to create my own pins. New markers, pencils, and drawing supplies are desperately needed too. Packaging and shipping supplies are also included within the goal after I set up an account with Uline or a similar company. A portion of the money raised will go towards shipping the rewards through the U.S. Postal Service. I am trying to remain active within area art markets as a vendor, so some money will be put aside as well for a new vehicle to replace mine that finally died after 5 long years of dedicated service. I need a vehicle so I can actually transport my wares to and from festivals and events both locally and outside of the area. Anything beyond the goal amount will be used to make this startup a little bit more manageable by being applied to helping ease off my crippling student loans.

Now for the good stuff! The perks will consist of T-shirts, prints, zines, and more featuring my own illustrations. Except for the stickers and posters which I outsource for printing, everything I make for musicians and for my own use is all created by hand in-house. Own some Steve Ardo merchandise before all the other local punks! Perk levels may contain a combination of the following rewards...

Stickers!

Crack and peel stickers in various sizes using illustrations from past flyers and some original designs. “Rad-o-saurus Rex”, which is printed with a UV vinyl coating, will be the primary sticker available in both the Buffalo (hand)Bills and Local Punk levels. The other designs are gloss-coated and will only be available in the Local Punk package.

“Buffalo (hand)Bills” Zines!

Two 5.5" x 8.5" zines that serve as a collection of a year’s worth of hand-drawn flyers and handbills for punk shows in Buffalo. “Volume I” (2013) contains just the titles of the flyers while “Volume II” (2014) details the stories behind the designs as well as what the shows were about. Please note that the zines do contain mild profanity and alcohol references, they were created for punk shows after all! 

“Party Monster” Giclée Poster!

Based on the flyer for On The Cinder’s first tour of Summer 2014, James T. Gilbert (aka the “Party Monster”) has since became a favorite of the public and appears on T-shirts, pins, and stickers. These 11" x 17" posters are on 14 pt., gloss cover stock.

Brand New “Follow Your Heart!” T-Shirt

A re-imagined version of a drawing I made for Hallwalls Contemporary Arts Center’s “A Mid-Winter’s Draw” fundraiser back in February, this cute guy will be printed on 100% Pre-Shrunk Ringspun (fitted) T-shirts in turquoise from Delta Apparel in unisex adult sizes. “Follow your heart” is the motto of The Flower House, a music venue where we organized basement shows, but more importantly as a temporary home. It is a place of loving friends who became another family and took me in for 2 months when I was struggling with poverty and homelessness, but had nowhere else to go. The meaning behind this philosophy is to choose your own path in life with no regrets while doing what makes you truly happy. Only you can decide what that might be, no one else can do that.

Our Impact

My job is to help musicians create a visual representation of their dreams and messages, but the meaning behind being a DIY artist is much deeper than that. Regardless of the challenges that lie before us, we keep pushing forward because it is genuinely what we love. Through my long journey I could never have imagined ever being part of a community that worked so hard to selflessly help one another, and so it is with great pride that I do everything I can to support these amazing people through my art. It might looks like a simple T-shirt or flyer for just another punk show to some people, but to these dedicated individuals what I create means the world to them. It’s a mutual appreciation I never dreamed could exist, but I’m reminded of it every time I walk into a show and am immediately embraced by about 50 or so of my friends. My potential to succeed has always been there just waiting to explode, but I need the right tools and resources to make this a profession where I can truly work on a level playing field. Helping those in need has always been my passion, so now is the time to make that dream a viable reality.

Risks & Challenges

Anyone trying to start a business will face obstacles and problems to solve no matter how ambitious the idea, that’s just how reality works. Obtaining the funding is just the start, obviously. I have the drive and determination, but I would need the knowledge and wisdom on how to operate my business both properly and successfully. Luckily, New York State offers a free service to guide individuals looking to start their own businesses. The Small Business Development Center’s Buffalo office is about a 15 minute walk from my apartment, and I am already familiar with the staff. I approached them in late 2014 about initially starting this project, but the lack of adequate funds made it impossible to get anything off the ground. Educating myself with everything from copyrighting to tax law is just as important as actually making my art.

Being self-sufficient has always been a personal goal of mine, so I’ve always found it hard to ask others for help. The biggest risk, personally, is acquiring the necessary funding so that I can start this project as soon as possible. The goal I’m working for is basically everything I have been working on for the past 2+ years. None of that will change and musicians will always need artwork, but this is just a chance for this to grow into something much more. I’m extremely experienced as an illustrator and graphic designer, but I’m also experienced with what it means to work hard to survive. No matter what happens, I’m determined to continue to make my art and hone my craft.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand more than most that sometimes you want to help someone else but you need to prioritize taking care of yourself. If you can’t donate, then please share this page on social media and tell others about what I’m trying to accomplish. For an openly-gay punk artist rapidly closing in on 30, there’s been a lot of obstacles and hardships in my life I’ve had to endure. From homelessness to coming out to the deaths of those most important to me, I have a lot of stories about my life I want to share. This project is vital because I’m finally taking a stand and making something out of my life, no matter what trials may come. I’m no longer content with just surviving, I am intent on carving my own path.

story:
The story

Hello friends. My name is Reinis. I'm not an artist myself, but like i mentioned, i got the most talented friends that are passionate for what they do. As explained in the video-story, i had a great friend and even greater artist that was forced to move to UK, to simply make a living working at 8/5 factory work. That was the point I had to draw the line. I promised myself that as a entrepreneur, i will find a way to not let that happen ever again.

That was the point where Perfect Gift project idea was born. I came up with a platform, that will let these artists make living doing what they love, meanwhile providing people worldwide a perfect gifting experience and the best gift ideas.

At this point we don't have the funds to launch the project - web development and maintenance costs, first inventory and shipping cost covering and simply a place to start this from, so we are coming for your support offering a gift in return, that will be at least 50% the market price!

Our aim

We are hoping to reach 5,000$, that will cover the web development, domen and hosting costs, first inventory purchase, cover the shipping costs and give us a little capital for the company itself.

In return we will go from a simple thanks for the contribution to a complex and valuable one to many faced hand drawn graphite or painted portraits of yours, that we will ship out worldwide!

If we fail to reach our goal, we will still do our best to make it happen, at the level we will be able to afford.

Our works and market

Here are some of our works, to get the first idea. Similar works on the market cost from 300 to 2000 USD. We want to give the same quality for at least half the price!


The Impact

Perfect Gift project was made to help out my fellow artists, that couldn't work in their specific area and do what they love, but that was the point where I realized that I could not only help them, but help boost many young artists, meantime providing people with a place, where they could really get ideas and even purchase the products that would make a perfect gift for any occasion. For starters we're going to offer only hand drawn graphite portraits and paintings, but we hope to expand it to many art forms and perfect gift ideas themselves, so that we could involve many craftsmen, young artists e.t.c.

Risks & Challenges

Since we were able to make this business work even before any level of advertising and online site, just from mouth to mouth, we could really take this to next level with your support.

We (us and you perks) aren't really risking anything here. The only investments are the web development and first-time stocks, so we guarantee you will be getting best quality hand drawn art shipped to you, for at least 50% cheaper, that the cheapest on the market.

Other similar offers on the market cost 300-2000 USD and unlike us and they are most likeley not interested in a greater cause than making money.

Other Ways You Can Help

Feel free to spread the good cause, use Idiegogo share tools to share us on social media, also like and share us on our Facebook page  and Instagram www.facebook.com/perfectgiftproject
www.instagram.com/perfectgiftproject

story:
About 40 years ago an amazing punch was created by Adeline M. King.  The beverage  was originally sold to friends and family in the Liberian (Monrovia, Liberia) community for special events and family functions.  Growing up, the punch was the best kept secret with a precious few aware of how to actually make it.  Adeline King passed away on June 19, 2007, leaving behind 2 daughters and many grandchildren.  On December 27, 20ll, after being unemployed for 2 years, I, Adima E. Aniteye, a granddaugther of Adeline M. King decided to bottle my grandmother's famous punch.  I named the company A.M. King LLC after my grandmother and the product, "Queen Victoria's Island Punch" after my mother, Remie Victoria Williams-Aniteye, who was born on the same day that Queen Victoria of England was baptized!

(From Left to right : Remie Victoria Williams-Aniteye, Adima Eugenia Aniteye, Adeline Mariah King)


Seeing a place in a vast market for this unique beverage was all the incentive that was required to introduce this special blend to the public.  I cleaned out the garage at my parent's house, perfected the blend, and started bottling.   I went about spreading the word by taking sample bottles where ever I went; to work, to parties, to neighbors, etc. and I eventually started to sell through Farmer's Markets in the Northern Virginia area. 

In 2013, Queen Victoria's Island Punch became one of the products chosen for the Virginia Department of Agriculture's Program, "Virginia's Finest", giving it the stamp of a approval as a quality product! This program has also opened up many doors for me, including meeting Virginia's Governor Terry McAuliffe who supports Virginia's Finest 100%!



Selling in a cluster of cities like, Alexandria, Springfield, Woodbridge, and Manassas the product has gained recognition in my community. Through my interactions at the market, I created 2 additional flavors to complete the product line up, which I named based off of the English monarchy.  The current 3 flavor blends available for purchase are as follows:

The Queen--Grapefruit, pineapple, apple, and orange
The Duchess--Lemon, pineapple, apple, and orange
The Baroness--Pomegranate, pineapple, lemon, lime, and agave


The flavors are listed from sweetest to tartest in order to accommodate the taste buds of many, young and old!


What We Need & What You Get

Though this beverage is made for anyone to consume, one of the best ways to enjoy these beverages are with spirits.  At this stage I am ready to add alcohol to the original flavor, The Queen, and the spirit of choice is rum.  

I will be opening a distillery in order to make a rum based bottled beverage as well as distilling my own brand of rum.  

Aside from the actual distillation process, this is easier said than done.  As I work on getting the distillery up and running, I will be outsourcing the rum in the mean time in order to launch a line of punch with the rum included called Q.V.I.R Punch.  This is where you come in!


I will need $12,000 to complete this process in order to get the product on the shelves by the end of the summer while perfecting my rum recipe.  The breakdown of funds is as follows:


Acquiring rum in bulk--$3000
Labels--$1300
Bottles--$3000
Ingredients for juices--$1500
Practice still--$800
First distillation ingredients--$900
Campaign fees and perks--$1500

If I am not able to acquire this amount, what I do obtain will go towards the rum in bulk, bottles, and labels in order to pitch to the Alcohol Beverage Control (ABC) board in the beginning of April.  ABC is the only outlet for spirits in the Commonwealth of Virginia.

For your contribution, we have some exciting perks for you as you join our team in a very special way!!

Personalized Social Media "Thank yous"
Queen Victoria Vino Protector
Queen Victoria Shot glasses
Queen Victoria T-Shirts
Queen Victoria Grace Lunch Cooler
Queen Victoria's Rum Cake
Bottles of juice (any flavor of your choice)
Bottles of Q.V.I.R punch
Bottles of Q.V.I.R pure spirit out of the first distillation
Honorary Plaque on the walls of Queen Victoria's Distillery
Links to your business on Queen Victoria's website

The Impact

Currently, I am moving the operation to a commercial facility.  The move is financially taxing and any remaining funds are going toward keeping the normal operations going as the company takes on overhead expenses.  In order to launch the new product, your contribution will allow us to go to the next level and distribute more of the product, which it would not be able to do without your help.

This growth will also allow me to create jobs as well as break into a very exclusive industry, ironically, with the help of the public.  There are currently no distilleries in Virginia that are solely female owned so we would definitely be breaking a few glass ceilings!


Any investment is a great opportunity for us to launch Q.V.I.R Punch, and extend our love of a great drink to many more!

Risks & Challenges

Incorporating alcohol into the product and company is proving to be quite a challenge.  Very few make it through the process and it seems like the industry has a secret network of those who are "making it".  As one of the few minority, female run distilleries in the country (if any), it has been difficult to find someone blazing this trail with me.  I am asking you to believe in bringing back the idea of "just a good drink".  Carefully crafted cocktails and spirits are controlled by the "big guys" and with such grueling state and federal regulations the "little guys" find it hard to maneuver through the process, but with a crowd behind us.......I'm not worried.  Your investment will allow me to focus on creating a quality light, white, rum right here in the United States that will be competitive with that of the West Indies.


About Me


As a pre-medical student at The College of William & Mary, I gained extensive experience in chemistry, specifically the process of distillation.  Years later, I became a bartender in Washington DC where my knowledge of spirits and blends was greatly expanded. 

After living in Miami, Florida for a year and working at Epic Hotel/restaurant I gained even more knowledge of distilled spirits, particularly rum, not knowing at the time how it would impact my decisions on my business almost 5 years later!

With these attributes in my background, I thought, why not just distill and make the rum myself?

My grandmother taught me well, in addition to my education, work experience, and just life in general, I am able to overcome any obstacle and get this company to where it needs to be, and with your help.....WE can do it that much quicker, and make history at the same time!

Other Ways You Can Help

Any help you can give us while we grow our product line of Queen Victoria goodies, whether that is by sharing the campaign on social media, talking about it, or contributing monetary funds would be greatly appreciated and rewarded!! Cheers!

story:
Game Changer

If you thought a toy baseball with holes was fun, wait 'til you try one with a tail!  Shuttle Baseball was born in a garage, raised in a school gym, and is about to graduate into mainstream America as the next "BIG" idea in outdoor family fun. 

  • We've sold thousands of these balls to PE teachers all across the USA and Canada.  It's gotten out of control.  Folks in Korea and Japan are asking us to bring the ball overseas. 
  • Baseball is a universal pastime.  Back in the day, it is literally how America passed the time.  Shuttle Baseball makes the perfect gift for birthdays, holidays, or an impulse item just because.  
  • To give some idea of the momentum we've built, we currently rank #5 on the list of most popular class activities on PE Universe's social network.  The reason it is so popular is because Shuttle Baseball is the worlds fastest and only indoor/outdoor recreational baseball game that can be played safely at school. 

What the Money is Going Towards

  • All of the money is going towards product development.  We are going to build the best ball imaginable using the best materials, best techniques, and bring it to market at the lowest cost possible.     
  • Almost all new product concepts go through an extensive research and development process.  Several prototypes will need to be made and tested before any money is invested in tooling/factory molds.     

Why You Should Help Us      

  • Recent studies show that the average kid in America spends 5.5 hours consuming electronic forms of entertainment.  This is part of the reason why America has a child obesity epidemic.  Our aim is to create a new world in which parents of today's 3-6 yr old get raised and form wonderful and positive memories playing a fun and safe game of baseball with their parents, siblings, and friends.      
  • Wiffle Ball is probably one of the few toys that has lasted over six decades in popularity.  It has faced all sorts of competition, from Junkball, to Blitzball, to Screwball.  They all attempt to do the same thing - make hitting harder.  We flipped the script.  We know that the only way to make our mark is to change everything you ever thought you knew about backyard baseball. 
  • A toy baseball with a tail is a new and never before seen concept.  That works.  Kids love it.  Parents love it.  Teachers love it.  Baseball experts love it.  It was born of the desire to make the toughest sport of all simple, safe and fun, for anyone, anywhere.  The most fun you can have playing baseball is blasting a huge HR over your opponent's head.  Striking out is an ugly feeling!           

Risks and Challenges  

  • Competition.  A big corporate toy company will likely do a "parallel development" project and bypass our patent.  It happens all the time.  The only way to combat this is to establish a loyal fan base from Day 1.  If we don't succeed in getting the seed capital we need, we will have to sacrifice the overall look-and-feel of our final retail version.  This may have a negative impact on our brand's potential popularity.   
  • It will be challenging to meet our mid-summer 2015 expected ship dates.  While this campaign is running, we are on the phone or on email communicating with our manufacturing partners, distributors, and consultants.  There are a lot of moving pieces and if someone doesn't pull their weight or perform their duties on time and on budget, it could derail the project for who knows how long.  Rest assured.  We have recruited the best people to help us work this the right way.  Loyal, highly-imaginative, hard-working individuals that won't let a little thing like the Pacific Ocean and different time zones get in the way of a job well-done.

Help Spread the Word

  • Running a successful crowd funding campaign is like running a full-time job.  We're busy hitting up our contacts on Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, and other social media. 
  • Use the "Share" Facebook button located directly below the intro video and re-post our URL to your own timeline or on a friend's timeline (such as parents with young kids 3 and up, PE teachers or summer camp volunteers, etc.).    
  • Be excited.  It'll be so cool to know that you helped bring a product to life that deserves a chance to be great.  In the words of the crew at Dude Perfect, it's time for us to "Go Big" and make our dream become reality.  
  • Like us on Facebook and Twitter.  We'll keep you updated on interesting events and relevant press releases, news articles, and other exciting happenings. 
  • Be sure to review our "Perks" section.  We tried to accommodate every budget and make your donation a WIN-WIN for both of us.

story:
Short Summary

We are the University of Wisconsin-Whitewater Enactus and we have partnered with the World Resource Group to provide funding to 12 high school students in Linaca, Honduras. These 12 students will use the funding to start a self-sustaining hydroponic farming business.

What is Hydroponics? Check out the link below!

http://www.simplyhydro.com/whatis.htm

#LaVidaVerde

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $10,000. This money will help the 12 students fund their entrepreneurial dreams as well as make an impact on the school and community. The breakdown of budget for the funding is as follows : 

                  Megatunnel Greenhouse                             $4000

                  Internal Structures/Shelving                     $2000

                  Irrigation System                                            $1250

                  Inputs (fertilizers, mineral solutions)      $2000

                  Tools                                                                    $750

                                                                                                                    

                   Total                                                                    $10,000

As with any donation, a feeling of exuberance will be had, but we also want to show you our gratitude by providing you with perks tied to how much you donate.  These perks range from a simple thank you, a trip down to Honduras and other tokens of appreciation from the students and community of Honduras! 


*Look at everything we can create with $10,000. Imagine what we could do with even more than $10,000. Once we have reached our goal, any additionally raised funds will go towards future Enactus projects and partnerships.

* If we do not make the goal of $10,000 the students will still receive the raised funds as we pursue other funding initiatives.

  #LaVidaVerde

The Impact



"Coming together is a beginning. Keeping together is progress. Working together is success." --Henry Ford

 #LaVidaVerde

Risks & Challenges

Challenges are inevitable however, through teamwork, innovation, and collaboration with our partnerships we feel we have all of the tools to overcome any challenges that come our way.

"Alone we can do so little, together we can do so much." -- Helen Keller

 #LaVidaVerde

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are tough and money gets tight, we understand, but you can still help! Share this campaign with anyone and everyone you know. This will help us reach our goals more than you could even imagine!

World Resource  Group: www.facebook.com/World-Resources-Group-11274394...

Social Media Support: #LaVidaVerde

                   Total                                                                    $10,000
As with any donation, a feeling of exuberance will be had, but we also want to show you our gratitude by providing you with perks tied to how much you donate.  These perks range from a simple thank you, a trip down to Honduras and other tokens of appreciation from the students and community of Honduras! 
*Look at everything we can create with $10,000. Imagine what we could do with even more than $10,000. Once we have reached our goal, any additionally raised funds will go towards future Enactus projects and partnerships.
* If we do not make the goal of $10,000 the students will still receive the raised funds as we pursue other funding initiatives.
  #LaVidaVerde

The Impact






 "Coming together is a beginning. Keeping together is progress. Working together is success." --Henry Ford
 #LaVidaVerde
    Risks & Challenges Challenges are inevitable however, through teamwork, innovation, and collaboration with our partnerships we feel we have all of the tools to overcome any challenges that come our way.
"Alone we can do so little, together we can do so much." -- Helen Keller
 #LaVidaVerde
    Other Ways You Can Help Times are tough and money gets tight, we understand, but you can still help! Share this campaign with anyone and everyone you know. This will help us reach our goals more than you could even imagine!
World Resource  Group: www.facebook.com/World-Resources-Group-11274394...
Social Media Support: #LaVidaVerde

story:
About Goldcoin

Goldcoin (GLD) is a popular digital currency that allows consumers to make online purchases with little to no fee. Goldcoin confirms faster than Bitcoin and has a unique 51% attack defense to protect its users.

There is no central authority, no president, or CEO - just a passionate group of hard working dedicated professionals striving to build a better currency.

New Client

The upcoming client will make Goldcoin the first mineable cryptocurrency built on Java, the first altcoin to rewrite the Bitcoin codebase, and the first to support multiple cryptocurrencies. Our developers have been hard at work over the past year coding a new wallet that will allow users of other cryptocurrencies to keep their coins in a single secure wallet.

"In terms of wallet functionality, modularity, security, and sheer performance, the Goldcoin wallet will be unrivaled. Block download times will also be decreased considerably thanks to on-the-fly compression and multi-threaded download capability." ~ Akumaburn

Remittance Markets

We also think Goldcoin is the perfect solution for the international remittance market and have planned a series of conferences around the globe to get the ball rolling. In the near future, we hope that Goldcoin can become a household name to billions of the underprivileged and unbanked.


100% Open Source

We know that we can't do everything by ourselves. That's why Goldcoin is open source. When the alpha version is released next month we'll need help in creating new plugins and skilled coders to assist our lead developer in testing various functions and features.


Risks & Challenges

“The biggest risk is not taking any risk... In a world that’s changing really quickly, the only strategy that is guaranteed to fail is not taking risks.” ~ Mark Zuckerberg

After finding the standard Bitcoin codebase not suitable as a cryptocurrency foundation, our developers set out to create something bigger, something better, something that would change the bitcoin landscape. But they can't do it alone, we need your help.

Attracting and maintaining community interest and talent is the single greatest obstacle for any open-source project. We need to attract young and eager software developers that will contribute to our project and help us to expand our team of software engineers.

We intend to use the proceeds from this campaign to buy GLD on the open market and move those coins into a secure development fund that will allow us to finance new talent, offer bounties for tasks needed, and compensate junior developers.

It won't be easy, but with your help we can make Goldcoin the future of digital currency. With a name that means "value" to billions worldwide, you can always bet on Gold!

story:
This Mother’s Day, Hope Haven is celebrating women across the world in a very special way. We have been opened for three short years, and are currently educating 220 children. We are also providing jobs for over one hundred adults in this community each day, giving hope to families for a brighter future. Through education and job opportunity, Hope Haven is empowering the Murindi community to move beyond the past, break the cycle of poverty, and rise up economically, intellectually, and spiritually as an educated people.

Poverty is the norm, and work is scarce in Murindi, so parents find it difficult to pay the school fees charged by Hope Haven, of between $5 -$10 each month, for their child. (The true cost of education at Hope Haven is $120 additional each month.) At Hope Haven, mothers are empowered through jobs and education as well. They make up most of the jobs in construction, permaculture and sustaining the campus. This income changes the dynamics in the home as well as paying for education.

A mother’s greatest blessing is her children, so this campaign is dedicated to raising $50,000 to send more than thirty children in the community to school for a whole year. The education that these students will receive is quality. The lead curriculum is from McGraw-Hill, which works in concert with a modern computer lab, and phenomenal teachers. Hope Haven understands that education is the key to future success in Rwanda. 

For this campaign, Hope Haven has partnered with Rwandan artist, Pacifique Niyonsenga to create a mural to honor mothers everywhere! The mural design will depict women in unity across the globe, and for each donation made, donors can submit a name of a special woman in their life to be featured alongside the mural! This beautiful mural will live in Hope Haven’s primary education building. Your mom, and other special women in your life, can be a part of this mural, remembered forever and prayed for by the Hope Haven students.


We want every woman in your life honored this Mother’s Day! 

Your special mother, grandmother, aunts, sisters, and any mom that has rocked your world should be honored on the walls of Hope Haven! This includes remembering women in your life who have passed away and you’d like to give in memory of.Mothers Helping Mothers is about hope. 

Your Donation

Your donation will give hope to a mother in Rwanda that her child will receive an education! The money you donate will reserve a spot for your mother’s name, or any other special woman in your life, alongside the mural, while giving to The Hope Haven Educational Fund. Feel free to honor all of the women in your life that are special to you. You will also receive a special card that you can email to your honoree(s) on Mother’s Day or print out to give them personally. 

After making a donation, leave a private comment with us that includes the NAME of your honoree and her EMAIL. 

All names that are honored will live permanently on the Hope Haven campus with beautiful artwork by Pacifique Niyonsenga. The Hope Haven Educational Fund goes 100% to educating our students… providing teachers, curriculum, and daily meals. The fundraising goal for Mothers Helping Mothers is $50,000, which will send more than thirty additional students to school for a full year.

For donation suggestions, here’s a look at some numbers:

  • $60 pays for a student’s tuition for half a month, including daily meals.
  • $120 pays for a student’s tuition for a month, including daily meals.
  • $1,500 sends a student to The Hope Haven School for a full year, including daily meals.

All donations are tax-deductible and greatly appreciated.

It is because of your donations that more children in Murindi can receive an education that will transform their life, their family, and the future of their country.

Mural Artwork

Take a look at Pacifique Niyonsenga’s mock-up of the mural for this Mother’s Day campaign! Scroll through our gallery to see Pacifique's progress on the piece as he prepares to add honoree's names to the artwork!

Education is Key

After the genocide in 1994, Rwanda was turned upside-down. The country’s instability led to a demolished economy. Major steps are being taken by the Rwandan government to rehabilitate the nation’s economy by multiplying sustainable jobs within the country and striving to export goods.

Today Rwanda has one of the fastest growing economies in Africa. The economic growth has significantly reduced the percentage of the population living in poverty and this is only the beginning of the government's 20 year plan. To sustain the current progress, there must be good education available for the people of Rwanda. This is where we are making a difference.

By donating to this campaign, you are directly helping to educate the next generation in Rwanda, enhance the standard of living for a community, encourage the economic growth and facilitate overall stability for the future of Rwanda by providing educated and technologically-fluent children with skills appropriate for future employment. Hope Haven uses a McGraw-Hill curriculum, computers provided by donations and a software grant from Microsoft. Learning to use technology will result in students having the skills necessary for working in the modern world and becoming part of the global community by broadening their horizons. Curriculum is taught in both English and the local language, Kinya-Rwandan. Hope Haven is providing an incredible campus for students to receive an education they never imagined.

A Bit About Murindi

Because Murindi is one of the poorest communities in Rwanda, living conditions are at a bare minimum level. Before Hope Haven came, Murindi was lacking what we would all consider basics, such as easy access to fresh water. Currently, there is under 1% of the population in Murindi who have water coming directly into their homes. Murindi is on the outlying area of Kigali, the capital, but there is a huge difference in living standards. Much of our community has never ventured into Kigali. Without education, there is no hope for bringing this community forward into the modernization of their country. Before Hope Haven, there was no school in this community. Education, in many forms and at different age levels, is our priority.

Additional Ways You Can Help

Everyone can contribute something which does help in a big ways!

  • Get the word out about Hope Haven Rwanda on social media and check us out on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook! Social media is a powerful tool that can spread this campaign like wildfire. Please join us in sharing the campaign and updates while it runs through May 10!

  • Share this Indiegogo page with everyone you know! You know lots of people that we don’t, and I’m sure their moms would love to be featured! Spread the love! Check out our easy share links at the top- Maybe you know someone that wants to help us meet our funding goals!

  • Tell everyone to tell everyone! Ask your friends to spread the word the same way we are asking you to! Some places to start: schools, sorority/fraternity members, sports teams, church, dentist… Let everyone know about what is happening in Rwanda!

  • Can't make a donation now? Link your Amazon account to Amazon Smile and with every purchase you make, a percentage is given to Hope Haven! It's super easy to set up and costs nothing extra... Just visit http://smile.amazon.com, search for Hope Haven Charitable Trust, select it as your charity, and keep buying from Amazon!!

  • Pray pray pray!!!

Check out Hopehavenrwanda.org to learn more about us! You can subscribe to our online newsletter on our site to receive updates on what’s happening at Hope Haven!

Scroll through our gallery of photos and videos! Tab is at the top!

story:
The Squidlle platform not only integrates ALL of your social networks into one simple news feed, it enables you to finally get rid of the seemingly infinite ads, useless posts and crazy, unwanted ramblings of the internet. 

Squidlle also makes managing all of your accounts, posts and media effortless, instead of jumping from one service to another. Squidlle gives you control of your social media experience.

We believe you should control your social media experience, and not some algorithm or advertiser. With your help this will happen!

    

 We already have 37 planned integrations            

 and many more to come!

We intend to integrate the following social networks into our platform. 

Social: Google+, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Vkontakte, Odnoklassniki, Myspace, hi5, Twoo (Netlog)

Communication: Skype, Viber, WhatsApp, Telegram

Blogs: LiveJournal, Foursquare, Blogger, Wordpress

Music: SoundCloud, Last.fm, MixCloud, RDio, 8Tracks, Spotify

Video: YouTube, Vimeo, DailyMotion, Vine

User exchange: CouchSurfing, LinkedIn

Images: Tumblr, Pinterest, We Heart It, Flickr, Picasa

Design:  deviantART, Behance.net, dribbble.com

If you have any suggestions about other social services you would like to see in Squidlle feel free to write in comments or on our email: info@squidlle.com


Squidlle Prototype                              

When we launch our Prototype in June it will be really easy to start utilizing Squidlle in only 3 steps: 

  1. Simply Sign Up or Connect to the Squidlle Platform!
  2. Add all of your Social Networks, Blogs, Music and Video Services, Images and Design Websites, and User Exchange Resources.
  3. Easily browse and customize your feed from all of your connected networks, chat with your friends, listen to your music playlists, and post any status or article on the networks you want - all from Squidlle.

Features                                              

Connect all your social networks.

Create combined news feed for all connected accounts.

Hide all content you don't want to see via mute option. 

Filter your news feed by content type or networks. 

Post from multiple accounts at the same time.

No More Commercial Ads. 

Save unfinished posts in drafts.

Mark posts or articles you like for reading later. 

Collect videos, music and images from any social networks.

Group friends, pages or posts in custom lists. 

Connect different accounts for the same social network. 

Login via Facebook, Twitter or other social network(s).  

Customizable interface for your profile. 

Custom Gestures (on mobile) or HotKeys (on web).

Direct message, or an event with system push notifications.

Sync your settings across all of your devices.

Faster content loading for mobile devices.  

Share outside of social services via SMS, Air Drop, Email and others.  

Client Support 24/7.  


Pricing Plans                                       

API                                                         

We plan on launching an API so Squidlle can be integrated into any website or application. We will be adding to the list of integrations with Squidlle during the campaign. If you wish to integrate Squidlle into your app or website in the future contact us at info@squidlle.com.

Perks                                                    


FAQ: Frequently Asked Questions    

Why Should You Support Us?

You’ll be part of putting control of social media  where it belongs - in your hands. With your support we will make the online world a better place.

What Will We Do With The Money?

Every cent will go into creation, optimization and bringing this product to market. Our primary goal is to achieve the first step and to bring Squidlle to the first users as soon as possible. After we get the product up and running, we will be working with volunteer beta testers and early supporters to make sure the end product works flawlessly and effortlessly.

You can see in the diagram below how are we planning to use the funds:

For completing every step of our goal we need to reach a certain funding level.

  • Step 1 (Current) - Reaching $10.000 for Engine and Web Client creation
  • Step 2 - Reaching $20.000 for Server API creation
  • Step 3 - Reaching $30.000 for iOS Client creation
  • Step 4 - Reaching $40.000 for Android Client creation
  • Step 5 - Reaching $50.000 for Windows Phone Client creation
  • Step 6 - Reaching $150,000 for Advertising and bringing product to the Market

Timeline: Exactly how long do we      

plan on taking?



The Journey Behind Squidlle             

The Squidlle project started because of a dirty social media feed. I was sick of seeing my feed filling up with political propaganda and other unpleasant things, so I contacted a few friends, who, not surprisingly had the same feelings of frustration, and decided to do something about it. 

After many tired nights slaving over whiteboards and piles of paper drawings, Squidlle started to take shape. We realized that Social Media was out of control, and had come up with the first ideas for developing a platform to fix it.

                                       


First, we created a basic design concept. Making sure that it would be simple while keeping usability in mind.



After several variations of the original concept we began incorporating the features we had brainstormed, while keeping it as fit and user friendly as possible.

We tried several architecture models for the platform and decided on the best one for the highest productivity. 

Then we began developing a way to make this into a reality without selling the product to people who would just turn it into another out-of-control platform.

That lead us here to Indiegogo. We know that this is the best way to make Squidlle a reality. It has been a very fun journey up until now, and we hope to keep going further to bring this product to the market. We can't do it without your help, will you join us in making a better online experience?

Who are we?

We’re an independent company that believes in innovation through collaboration. What makes us completely different than any other company is you are dealing with a group of people just like you. We are enthusiasts that want to improve our technologies and help build real products better for the user, and not for the sake of scaling a platform. Will you help us bring Squidlle to life?



Contact Us                                


Email:  info@squidlle.com


  Website       Facebook     Twitter  

  Google+       Instagram    VK

Step 1 (Current) - Reaching $10.000 for Engine and Web Client creation


Step 2 - Reaching $20.000 for Server API creation

Step 3 - Reaching $30.000 for iOS Client creation

Step 4 - Reaching $40.000 for Android Client creation

Step 5 - Reaching $50.000 for Windows Phone Client creation

Step 6 - Reaching $150,000 for Advertising and bringing product to the Market





Timeline: Exactly how long do we      


plan on taking?









The Journey Behind Squidlle             




The Squidlle project started because of a dirty social media feed. I was sick of seeing my feed filling up with political propaganda and other unpleasant things, so I contacted a few friends, who, not surprisingly had the same feelings of frustration, and decided to do something about it. 




After many tired nights slaving over whiteboards and piles of paper drawings, Squidlle started to take shape. We realized that Social Media was out of control, and had come up with the first ideas for developing a platform to fix it.


                                        
First, we created a basic design concept. Making sure that it would be simple while keeping usability in mind.







After several variations of the original concept we began incorporating the features we had brainstormed, while keeping it as fit and user friendly as possible.



We tried several architecture models for the platform and decided on the best one for the highest productivity. 



Then we began developing a way to make this into a reality without selling the product to people who would just turn it into another out-of-control platform.
That lead us here to Indiegogo. We know that this is the best way to make Squidlle a reality. It has been a very fun journey up until now, and we hope to keep going further to bring this product to the market. We can't do it without your help, will you join us in making a better online experience?

Who are we?
We’re an independent company that believes in innovation through collaboration. What makes us completely different than any other company is you are dealing with a group of people just like you. We are enthusiasts that want to improve our technologies and help build real products better for the user, and not for the sake of scaling a platform. Will you help us bring Squidlle to life?

















Contact Us                                




Email:  info@squidlle.com



  Website       Facebook     Twitter  
  Google+       Instagram    VK

story:
The Campaign

Hi my name is Vernon, I am making this campaign to help my friend and his family. Over the holiday season my friend Rohan was in a car accident. Thankfully he was not hurt, the car however had to be written off. His family is now in desperate need of a car so his mom can drive to work, but at present they can not afford to buy a used vehicle. My goal is to help Rohan and his family raise $3000, so that his family can buy a used car, so that his mom is able to get to work and help support her family.

Donations

We appreciate anything you can spare. I know a lot of Rohan's friends are in the theatre community and that money is tight, but even $5 will go along way.If you can afford $20 or $50, we would be very grateful for your help. In return know that you are helping a family who is in need right now.

All donations go straight to the family.

story:
Short Summary

Bandwagon Brewpub was born on December 8, 2009, when 5 longtime friends decided to pool their resources and open the only brewpub in Ithaca NY.  Armed with a love of great food and beer, we have focused efforts on serving locally sourced food and brewing as many different beers as we can, on our tiny 10 gallon Sabco Brew System.  Since then we have worked with dozens of local farms, breweries, wineries and distilleries throughout the Finger Lakes, to provide our community with a unique experience.  

While we love our subterranean space in downtown Ithaca, we realized that we would like a larger gathering space for the Bandwagon community to congregate, brew beer, and grow ingredients for our food and beer.  For over a year we have been renovating a beautiful 1850s barn, which sits on about 6 acres. This is the Bandwagon Farm and Brewery! Located about 20 minutes north of Downtown Ithaca nestled between Cayuga and Seneca Lakes in Interlaken NY, we are working on creating a space that can encompass brewing, farming, and even some music.

What We Need & What You Get

After 6 years of blood, sweat and tears we are within 6 months of reaching our ultimate goal of having a Farm and Brewery.  We have operated our brewpub with a sense of community that supports other small businesses in the Finger Lakes, and hope to expand our network as we grow.  At this time we are extended in our efforts, both physically and financially.  It is because of this that we graciously ask you to support us in reaching our goal of raising $40,000 to complete our Farm Brewery, and allow us to start farming this fall.  Any money we raise will help us get the project off the ground, but if we reach or exceed our goal, we will be in a position to impact the community in a larger way.  Because we would love to give back to our supporters, we have a number of perks that anyone who helps fund us will recieve.

$5 usd  - Anyone who contributes five dollars will recieve a Bandwagon key chain

$10 usd - Anyone who contributes ten dollars will recieve a Bandwagon Brewery drink token, redeemable at our brewpub or our farm brewery

$25 usd - Anyone who contributes twenty five dollars will receive a $25 match voucher redeemable at our brewpub or our farm brewery. This will match your first $25 dollars spent.

$100 usd - Anyone who contributes one hundred dollars will receive a Bandwagon Golden Ticket, which will provide you VIP access to the first ever annual Bandwagon Harvest Party, to be held in October 2016!  Entry to the Bandwagon Harvest Party will include food, music and more importantly Bandwagon Beer.  

$500 usd - Anyone who contributes five hundred dollars or more can bring 3 of their closest friends to come brew a batch of Bandwagon Beer with our Head Brewer.

The Impact

We hope to convey to you the impact of you supporting our Farm Brewery will help you reach people throughout the community.  Since our inception we have consistently supported various local causes including but not limited to: Family & Children's Service of Ithaca, A Night to Remember benefiting people with Alzheimer's, Planned Parenthood, the Dorothy Cotton Institute, Historic Ithaca, various departments at both Cornell University and Ithaca College, and many more.  Our favorite ally in the local food web is the Healthy Food For All program.  Since our inception our partners have worked to support Healthy Food For All by volunteering our beer, food and time to the Annual Westhaven Farm Harvest Dinner.  The mission of providing families in need with healthy, locally grown food is not only important to the families who are fed, but to the local farmers who are supported as well.  It just makes sense.  We urge you to visit their web site to find out how you can help Healthy Food For All. Their team are amazing people and we urge you to hop on their Bandwagon!  By fall of 2016 we hope to host a Healthy Food For All dinner at our Farm Brewery so we may further support their efforts!  


Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that there may be people who can't contribute financially, however we still welcome you to be a part of our community.  Please visit our web site Bandwagon Beer and send us an email if you would like to contribute in another way, as we would love to work with you.

story:
Short Summary

Loaves and Fishes Food Bank is a non-profit in Nanaimo that has helped the hungry get back on their feet for the last sixteen years.   The work continues, but the biggest challenge now is space. There's not enough room to store and distribute the tons of food given out each year. It's in part the price of success.   Every month we source and distribute over $120,000 worth of food.   Food is distributed at 10 different locations and made possible by the work of over 480 volunteers.  Additionally, food is provided free of charge to over 30 other non profits in the Nanaimo area. 

We have turned food retailers into partners - We now pick up pick up perishable food that retailers are throwing out through our Food 4U Food Recovery Program.  95% of this food is still good, so we are able to provide much better nutrition, while at the same time dramatically reducing food waste in our community.  This means better nutrition, bigger hampers and a desperate need for more space.   The 5% of food that is not suitable for human consumption is provided to local chicken, pig and cow farmers as well as a rabbit rescue.

All of this activity has been conducted out of a warehouse that is less than 500 square feet.  Volunteers often have had to work outside to make this work.  We need a significantly bigger warehouse to handle the increase in food coming in.   

What We Need & What You Get

We need $550,000 to purchase and renovate a new warehouse at 210 Fry Street.  A purchase price of $425,000 has been negotiated and we anticipate another $125,000 in improvements (walk in cooler, roofing upgrades, loading bay paving, washrooms)  We have raised $365,000 so far: $275,000 from the City of Nanaimo, $50,000 for the Nanaimo Port Authority and $40,000 in private donations.
We are seeking to raise $50,000 through Indiegogo to help cover the current $185,000 short fall.  
Contributions of $30 or more will receive a "Loaves and Fishes Supporter Fridge Magnet.
Contributions of $150 or More will receive a "Loaves and Fishes Supporter Fridge Magnet and a Loaves and Fishes Supporter T-shirt.
Contributions of $500 or More will receive a "Loaves and Fishes Supporter Fridge Magnet, a Loaves and Fishes Supporter T-shirt and a plaque with their name on it 

The Impact

A new warehouse will positively impact our operations in 4 significant ways:

1.) Currently we have 5 grocery stores participating in our Food 4U Food Recovery Program.  With a new warehouse we will be able to invite other stores to participate in this innovative program as we will have room to handle the food.  This will result in increased food for food bank clients and the agencies we serve.

2.) A new warehouse will enable us to use our current property at 1009 Farquhar Street strictly for distribution to clients.  This will mean we can increase the hours we are open to clients from the current 16 hours a week to over 30 hours a week.

3.)  With our current facility being used only for distribution, we will be able to set up a system where clients can choose each item they receive.  Rather than being given a bag of food, people could pick the food that meets their preferences and dietary needs.  

4.) Food will not have to be stored outside under tarps, nor will volunteers and staff won't have to work outside to ensure food is ready for clients.  Clients will be able to pick food up inside instead of outside under tents and awnings.  


Risks & Challenges

The new warehouse will be the most significant change in our infrastructure in our history.  As such it presents significant operational challenges.  These challenges include moving food, staff and volunteers between 2 locations and ensuring we are able to communicate clearly between the two sites.  Fortunately the 2 locations are less than a 2 minute walk apart.  We have found that VHF radios work well for communicating between the two locations.  $2400 worth of radios have been donated for this purpose.
Additional expenses will be incurred with the new warehouse.   We anticipate our monthly expenses going from $32,000 per month to $38,000 per month ($72,000 per year).  To compensate for this increase we have applied for gaming funds to help pay wages.  This application has been approved and we now have $50,000 to pay wages that we did not have before.  This means that funds we had to pay wages can now be applied to the operating expenses of the new warehouse.  This leaves $22,000 annually that needs to be fund raised to cover expenses.  We intend to solicit donations form the public as well as initiate an annual "signature event" to cover these additional expenses.  


Other Ways You Can Help

Beyond contributing to this campaign please consider the following ways to support Loaves and Fishes:

1.)  Volunteer.  Orientation happens on the first Wednesday of the Month at 3:00 pm and the 3rd Monday of the month at 7:30 pm.  Please see our website for more info. 

2.) Come for a tour and see the work we do.  Call 250 754 8347 ext 222 to book a tour.

3.) Share this campaign with your friends.

3.) Share this campaign with your friends.

story:
BCA Matching Grant

The Border Community Alliance’s mission: To improve the lives of people in the US/Mexico border region through experiential education, policy advocacy, and strengthening cross border ties. 


BCA supporter steps up with a challenge grant and asks you to help!

The Border Community Alliance is happy to announce a BCA member has issued a new $5,000 challenge grant. The challenge period runs until March 29, 2015.

This donor will match every dollar contributed to BCA, up to $5,000. All those who contribute $25 or more will receive an automatic membership with BCA. Check out our great list of benefits! If you are already a member - thank you. You can also gift a friend or family member with a BCA membership. Please join us in this fundraiser to help BCA receive the full $5000 matching grant. 

Help us meet this challenge and support BCA’s 2015 campaign for border communities. Go to our website at www.bordercommunityalliance.com for more details about BCA and FESAC programs, to donate, and to sign up for a Cross Border Tour. BCA is happy to meet with you to answer any questions or to give a presentation on our work and how you can get involved. Just email us at scastro@bordercommunityalliance.com or call 520-398-3229.

Thank you for your support!

Indiegogo campaign images courtesy Petra Barth, Susannah Castro, Robert Phillips, Martin Ethington; film courtesy Frances Causey and Rogelio Garcia.

story:
Short Summary

Hi,

My Name is Ross and I am starting this in order to help me change my career.

I am here at Indiegogo to ask for help to upscale my current hobby as a Quail enthusiast into a full blown Quail Farmer! I have invested all I have into this venture and what I am asking for is what I'll need to get me over the hump.

I plan on bringing Quail Eggs as well as a long list of locally and Organically Grown Produce to the immediate local market. Quail eggs are considered a Super Food because they are packed full of nutrients & have many healthy healing properties to them.


What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for a total sum of 5000.00 so that I can turn my dream into a reality. I am a small local food producer and I want to make this my full time career. 

It has been a hobby of mine for the past 5 years producing food and selling it in my local market. During this time I have developed a market base and provided an education about food with my customers.

I am a Permaculturalist and all of my methods are organic healthy and ethical. Whether it's one of my quail or chicken eggs or a head of lettuce everything I grow is given the utmost care and respect. That way it will be the very best for your table and most importantly your body.

I am passionate about bringing Whole Healthy Food to as many people as I possibly can. I have done my market research at this point and have received orders for product that I cannot fulfill without growing my current operation. I know that whole healthy LOCAL food is what the people want, and I know this is what our planet needs for healing to begin.

We are "food sick" as a society - allergies are on the rise and intolerance to Gluten are just 2 of the many things that people are suffering from. We need to take a step back and take a long hard look at what we are putting into our bodies. The food we are being fed is more "food like" than actual food and I want to change that.

If you believe fundamentally in what I believe, which is: “Change starts with one, and grows from there”, then please pledge what you can in order to help me achieve my dream in bringing healthy, REAL food to the local market

The funds will be used to build quail hutches to house more quail in order to keep up with the overwhelming demand. The funds will also go toward the rental of equipment in order to make more Organic Hugel Beds for production of Organic produce.


The Impact

By making a donation to my Campaign it will give a boost to healthy local food. I started raising pastured poultry 3 years ago and the community has embraced it to the point that I am growing the maximum amount of free range table chickens currently allowed to be grown by a private producer in accordance to the Ontario Chicken Board.

Through my hard work and dedication to the local food movement I have been able to grow it to this level, but I need your help to get to the next level both in infrastructure and personal growth. We need to return to the past in order to fix our future.

Risks & Challenges

Some of the major risks to this operation is my location. I am located in Algonquin Highlands, which is a seasonal cottage country setting surrounded by forests and lakes rather than your typical mono-culture setting (flat tillable land) making it challenging to grow food crops in the typical fashion.

That being said there is no lack of water for irrigation therefore making my growing season drought free. Also the amount of biomass that I am surrounded with is staggering making the practice of fertilizing with chemicals unnecessary and with the practice of HugelKulture it also makes the practice of harsh herbicides unnecessary as well.  

The big plus is that Quail feel right at home being game birds in a forested natural setting.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute to the campaign monetarily you can still help. Please share this with your friends. If anyone knows of any buyers in the food industry in Toronto or the GTA that you could introduce me to, that would be great!

said there is no lack of water for irrigation therefore making my growing
season drought free. Also the amount of biomass that I am surrounded with is staggering
making the practice of fertilizing with chemicals unnecessary and with the
practice of HugelKulture it also makes the practice of harsh herbicides unnecessary
as well.  
The big plus
is that Quail feel right at home being game birds in a forested natural
setting.   Other Ways You Can Help 
Even if you cannot
contribute to the campaign monetarily you can still help. Please share this
with your friends. If anyone knows of any buyers in the food industry in Toronto or the GTA that you could introduce me to, that would be great!

story:
A Parklet in Dogpatch

We are building the first public Parklet on 3rd street right in front of the Museum of Craft and Design. With areas for much needed bike parking, working, and relaxing, this Parklet will contribute enormously to the culture of the Dogpatch historic district.

We need your help to finish it!

The Museum of Craft and Design opened in its new home on 3rd street in 2013. Featuring stunning exhibitions on contemporary craft and design, the Museum has received national acclaim in The Chronicle, The Washington Post, 7x7, and Bon Apetit, and was called the "cultural hub" by Travel & Leisure magazine. 

The Dogpatch neighborhood has welcomed us with open arms, and we are thrilled to be contributing to the burgeoning cultural scene of this waterfront neighborhood south of the ballpark.

Now we want to give back!

Marcel Wilson, Principal at Bionic has generously donated his time and expertise in designing this Parklet. 

What's been said:
"(This) Parklet design set the standard and (will be) the benchmark for all Parklets in San Francisco." - LEED AP, San Francisco Planning Department 

"(This is an) innovative, boundary-pushing project..." - Pavement Parks, San Francisco

"Thank you for your willingness to help beautify our city and enhance the public realm." - Pavement Parks, San Francisco


What We Need and What You Get

Our permit was delayed in city deliberation and our original design was changed. With the city's required modifications, our materials and the redesign were an additional cost. We have raised $125,000 through generous supporters and grants, and we need at least an additional 25,000 to support the buildout budget. We have to build now because our permit will expire soon, so we need your help more than ever before.

Depending on your donation level, you have the option to receive:

  • Acknowledgment on the Parklet Panel, Museum of Craft and Design apparel and products, membership, and the highest level will have their name on our Donor Wall. 
If we don't reach our goal of $25,000, we will take what has been generously given and continue fundraising outside of Indiegogo in order to ensure this project happens.

Your help is incredibly valuable. Dogpatch continues to grow as a cultural neighborhood in San Francisco, and this Parklet will add more community space in a neighborhood that has only three parks and little green space among the historic American Industrial Center warehouse.

Please help make this Parklet a reality!

 


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help by sharing this campaign along through any of your social media outlets or word of mouth.
