VALENTINES DAY IS COMING UP - THERE IS STILL A REASON TO GIVE YOUR DOG A PRESENT. GIVE HIM AND US EVIDENCE-BASED KNOWLEDGE - DO IT TODAY!

Help us do research on associations between dog diets and disease. A touchy subject - but Oh! - so important!
  We, the DOGRISK research group, are a group of researchers in Finland, Europe that have dedicated our research to solving the riddles of diseases that we suspect are due to non-optimal nutrition. We mean diseases like cancer, heart disease, osteoarthritis, epilepsy, diabetes, chronic gastrointestinal diseases, hypothyroidism, teeth and gum problems, and many more. We call ourselves the DOGRISK research group as we are looking for DOGs’ RISK factors for diseases.
Although we do appreciate that other things, such as genes, obesity and environment also have a big impact, our primary focus is on what the dogs eat and how the diet associates with disease. We look at:

macro and micro nutrients in the foods and in the dog,
gut microbiota (=the bacteria in the gut),
nutrigenomics (=how nutrients and food effect to gene expression) and
epidemiology (=where we look at data on what dogs eat and what diseases they have and see if there is an association).

Our ongoing projects:


1) A population based epidemiology study: Over 11.000 dog owners have now answered our extensive, validated questionnaire. We ask about their dog’s characteristics, environment, their human and furry family, their activity, the diseases they have had or have, and their diet. Owner owned dogs have usually happily eaten the same diet for months, or even years. Different dogs have been fed different diets: low quality kibble, high quality kibble, “sausages”, canned foods, home-cooked diets, raw diets, BARF, mixed diets etc. Because of this we can now see what diets have led to less disease and what diets have led to more disease. We just need some salary money so that we can analyze the 11.000 cases. YOU can help us getting this done.

2) Diet intervention studies: We have already made the first diet intervention study where about 45 dogs ate one of two balanced diets for 4-5 months. They were otherwise living normal lives with their owner families. We took feces, urine, blood samples, biopsies and hair from the dogs before and after the trial. Then we analyzed the samples for serum values, vitamins, fatty acids, organ function biomarkers, blood cell values, gut microbiota, RNA expression and some other things but now we have no money to do the statistics, write the articles and publish the results. AND we would need to do at least one more similar study to confirm the results! YOU can help us doing this as well!

 
WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET:
We need research funding and you will get evidence-based information and published data on how different diets associate with dog diseases.
We would need 25 $ from EVERYBODY that gets this message. For that you can e.g. get this awesome ribbon  to tell others that you care: 

Or a VERY SMALL SUM from everyone on earth that owns, or has ever owned, a dog or that has had a 2-or 4 legged family member with any of the diseases above. Here is what we need and what we can do with the money:



For every 1.000 $: we can analyze one dog, at one time point (all analyses). So for a trial of 50 dogs with 3 times sampling, we need 150.000 $. Expensive - but sooooo interesting!


For every 2.000 $: we can publish one article in a peer-reviewed, open access journal. In two years we anticipate to publish 15 so we would need 30.000 $

For 10.000 $: we can send our researchers to international veterinary and dog nutrition conferences to present independent diet-related research results
For 10.000 $: we can use statisticians and bioinformatics for our papers

For every 150.000 $: we can pay salary for one year for  our researchers and we hope to get enough money to work undisturbed for 2 years, meaning 300.000 $.

THIS MAKES A TOTAL OF  2 YEARS OF WORK FOR 500.000 $ - Research is expensive!

BUT - if we do this together we researchers can continue the work. This is something to give your dog friend this year as a Valentines gift. We suggest you give your dog a hug and a kiss and let it know that this years present went to trying to figure out diseases. If you send us a picture of your dog as a message to our Facebook page "dogrisk", we will also insert a text into the picture, saying something like "My owner supports DOGRISK research!" This you can then use when you let your friends know about the campaign on social media (as you spread the message, this will also help us). It will look something like this:

 
As we get to continue we will publish peer-reviewed journal articles on associations between diet and atopy, osteoarthritis, epilepsy, cancer, tartar and many other diseases. As we go we will all learn at least some more things about what we SHOULD  or SHOULD NOT feed our friends. The good thing is that we are already more than half way as we already have the data from our questionnaire and from our first feeding trial, BUT WE JUST DO NOT HAVE ANY FUNDS RIGHT NOW TO ANALYZE them. To be able to do it, we need funding and therefore we have some perks that will leave lots of money for research. So please also consider our expensive - but unique- perks!
YOUR SUPPORT WILL HELP US CONTINUE OUR IMPORTANT RESEARCH!
 
THE GROUP
If You still want to read on we will now introduce ourselves briefly:


Anna Hielm-Bjorkman, DVM, PhD, CVA, Adj.Professor, PI, DOGRISK group leader:     I am 54 years old and have been working in my own clinic and at the University of Helsinki for  nearly 30 years. I treat all the diseases above and have been getting frustrated over the fact that we doctors (animal and human doctors, in fact) really have no clue why our patients get these diseases. The same is true for our family members and friends; why do we humans get cancer, diabetes, epilepsy etc...? In the work we do here we can get answers for risk factors for both dogs and humans. Modern medicine seldom treats the disease anyway, mostly we just hide symptoms. In my work I use  supplements, surgery, pharmacological and non-pharmacological treatments and would like to use nutrition much more that we do today. My work in nowadays 80% research but with a zero internal budget. This means I have to get research funding for the whole group from outside the University. And studying dog food is not a top priority in any country's financial plan! Therefore we hope that we who are dog owners could maybe fix this together - as no one else will - and we think we need this information.

Website:   https://tuhat.halvi.helsinki.fi/portal/en/person/hielmb   www.dogrisk.com




Liisa Uusitalo, MSci, PhD (Human/dog nutrition epidemiology): I am a nutritional scientist with a doctor's degree in epidemiology. I have been involved in human nutrition epidemiology studying  the associations of diet with type 1 diabetes. I have been working in the DOGRISK project for a year and a half, and I am really excited about using my epidemiologic insight for the benefit on animals, as well as of humans, now. There are so many inspiring analysis waiting: epilepsy, cancer, diabetes, atopy, joint diseases...all important for both dogs and humans!

Website: https://www.linkedin.com/in/liisa-uusitalo-b66a...




Johanna Anturaniemi, MSci (animal breeding), PhD student (nutrigenomics, metabolomics): I am an agronomist and graduated in 2010 having animal breeding (genetics!) as my major. Since then I have worked in the DOGRISK research group. I am really interested in nutrition and its impact on health and diseases. I would like to know much more about the complex network of genes, nutrients, and metabolism. To study these associations in dogs will help us understand their role in our dogs' and also our own life. My inspiration for this work has been my atopic Staffy 'Elvis' who passed away in 2014.

Website: https://tuhat.helsinki.fi/portal/en/persons/johanna-anturaniemi(eea11397-1f2f-4343-a2f5-af5aa71c0993).html



Noora Sjögren, DVM, MSci (Animal nutrition), PhD student, Animal nutrition diplomate student: I am a 36 years old veterinarian, I have a MSc in animal nutrition and I am an agronomist. In spring 2016 I was accepted as a  ECVCN (The European College of Veterinary and Comparative Nutrition) resident, and my goal is to be a diplomate in the area of clinical animal nutrition.  Animal nutrition has always been my interest and specially the opportunities it brings in to treating both diseases and preventing them. In my everyday practice as a vet I want to treat my patients as good as possible, and rather prevent the diseases than treat them. I want to find the diseases that can be prevented by nutrition. Website: https://fi.linkedin.com/in/noora-sj%C3%B6gren-8...

Robin Moore, Masters student (biochemistry, organic chemistry)  I am 23 years old, and began studies at the University of Helsinki in Fall 2012, majoring in chemistry and minoring in molecular biology. In Dogrisk, I use statistical and biochemical analysis of metabolomic data in order to study how dietary intake can cause disease risks in dogs. The metabolome of an organism is primarily influenced by diet, and hence so is their overall health This is a novel field which has important implications towards our understanding of what can cause disease, as well as how diet can be used as a preventative for various disorders.

Website: https://tuhat.helsinki.fi/portal/fi/persons/rob...DOGRISK homepage: http://www.dogrisk.com/research-group

Susanna Paavilainen, Anna Loimaranta and Niina Siljander and their dogs are in the DOGRISK cancer sniffing dogs project. We will campaign for that project later.
We also have Sara Zaldivar-Lopez from Spain, Stella Barrouin-Melo from Brazil, Ziga Gerber from Slovenia and others that ave been working on the project when visiting Finland. Also, many not here mentioned PhD students and licenciate vet students have worked on the project.

All in all - The strength of the group is being curious, looking outside the box, love for research, not having any predetermined ideas of what we will find, not going where the fence is lowest, not being pushed around by big companies or big pharma, and having a group of top researchers on the job! In the DOGRISK project we have no other agenda than learning why and how diseases happen, how this is linked to nutrition - and therefore if and how we can prevent disease, and, if possible, cure it. But like so many, we are suddenly without funding.
Further down we will open up the total impact of our work
 
THE IMPACT
This project is awesome! We have already sneaked at the data and KNOW that we will find associations between diet and diseases. Some foods are really protecting while other foods are not so healthy. We do have a lot of hypotheses on why, but to be honest, at this time we still have no clue of what the "why" is. Here are some of the hypotheses we work with: Is it that high temperatures during processing make food more unhealthy? Would a high fat, low carb diet be healthier for dogs? Do dogs need vitamin C to be added into the diet? Are kibbles un-physiological as they are so dry? Does the food lack trace-elements that we have not considered? Has the food become too sterile for the good of the patient? Does wrong food mean wrong gut microbiota - and wrong gene-expression? -In the end we will know and will not have to speculate anymore. And we are not at all against any type of diets (dry, canned, raw, home-made) but hope that all results we get will benefit ALL types of diets. If they are too sterile then we might have to put more probiotic bacteria into all type of foods, if dry food is too dry then the industry would write that it has to be mixed with water, if raw food makes dogs get diarrhea then raw food companies would have to write that it takes 3 weeks for the intestines to switch to raw diet etc.
Another great impact of this research is what it has on human nutrition research. It is hard to look at how nutrition and diets associate with human disease as human disease often comes late in life and the diet has been so varied during the persons life. People also cheat, and will not put all the wine and chocolate into the diet diaries. Dog owners seldom cheat and the dogs diet is often the same for months, even years and therefore good to use in calculating risks. As dogs also live in the same environment and has the same diseases as humans they are excellent "models" for human disease. Much better that lab rats or mice and much more ethical as we can use happy owner-owned dogs. So this research has a direct impact also on your own and your family's life!
Your contribution will make all the difference. Please try to spread this message to all breeder, kennel, pet store, groomer and vet internet sites that  you know of! We in the research group are also vets, nutritionists and breeders ourselves and we want to know - so why would not your friends want to know? On top of that, we are also routinized researchers with a good track record of publishing in the best journals in the veterinary or nutritional field (see the researcher pages at http://www.dogrisk.com/publications). We are also proud of how this research will be conducted: dog owners, pet lovers, people interested in the same diseases in themselves or in friends and relatives, hopefully also the dog food industry, maybe even the medical industry, will go in here together and fund impartial and independent, ethical dog food research. Thank You for helping us doing it this way!
 
ARE THERE RISKS?
Why do we want to do this crowdfunding? Because we have just spent 2 years trying to get funded and we are tired of getting a "YES! Super project! But a bit too NEW for us", "Interesting...but we cannot help you" or "Next year maybe...". We have therefore put a 500.000 $ goal, as we would like to work now at least for a couple of years, before we would need to gather money again. To work with what we are good at; research!
So what are the risks? There is no risk. We work for the University of Helsinki; number 67 on the QS sacle and number 103 on the THE scale (these are scales that put universities on lists of being number x in the world) so we work in a good research environment. Research money is scarce in Finland now due to a financial recession, and it is hard to get money for ambitious, innovative, new projects that need a lot of funding due to costly analyses: metabolomics, RNA-sequencing, DNA GWAS, gut microbiota analyses etc. We will do as much analyses as we get money for - most of the analyses for our first diet intervention are already done so we know they work for dog samples. All money we get in will go to finance the work in our research group. That is also why the perks are expensive, although what you get is cheap for us to make. And we will keep you updated on what we do and where we publish through our own net pages at http://www.dogrisk.com/publications
What are the risks if we do not get funded? That we will misuse our brains and start a nice cafeteria instead...! No...even if we get only a part of what we hope to get in we will continue this work. It stated in 2009 and will continue on a pace that our finances permits. If we get only a little bit of money only one of us will work and we will do no more analyses and no more diet interventions. If we get lots we can work for 20 more years! We can take in new researchers, do new diet interventions, work on what we have and what we will get in. We have struggeled for 8 years now and will either struggle on, or then, with YOUR help-fly over the hurdles!
 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP IF YOU HAVE NO MEANS OF HELPING US FINANCIALLY
If you cannot pay via a credit card (as Indiegogo no more supports pay pal); here are some other ways you can help:
1.  Please send this page as a message (e-mail, twitter, facebook...) to all friends, relatives and people that own an animal and ask them to contribute and make some noise about us. Lets see how many $ you can get to our campaign! Together we can! Merry X-mas!
2. If 1000, 100 or 25 $, € or £ is too much for you, then please consider giving us 10 $. Or 5 $. Send us an e-mail (anna.hielm-bjorkman@helsinki.fi) and we will put in a new perk for you.Thank You!
3. If you have ideas about associations between diseases and diets in dogs that you have thought of as a dog owner or breeder, please send us a mail on anna.hielm-bjorkman@helsinki.fi. We are interested in what you have seen! Thanks
 
Please let us show you that grass root funding can do great things! Just press any of the perk buttons and you will be on your way to help a small innovative research group to help both YOU and YOUR DOG!PLEASE MAKE THIS GO VIRAL!  ------------------------  Ja tässä osa tekstistä suomeksi:Mitä ruokaa koira laittaisi: raakaravintoa, kuivamuonaa, koiranmakkaraa? Millainen ruoka olisi lemmikeillemme parasta? Tue eläinten ruokintaa käsittelevää tieteellistä tutkimusta!Jos haluat tukea kampanjaa niin skrollaa sivu ylös alkuun niin näet oikealla puolella vastikkeita (engl. "Perks"). Valitse sopiva itsellesi seuraavista: Vain yksi ilmoitus niistä on suomenkielellä eli kannatusnauha (25 $ + 5$ postitus) mutta myös 3 x vuodessa ilmestyvä DOGRISK uutiskirje lähetetään suomenkielisenä sähköpostiisi (1 vuosi 50 $, 3 vuotta 100 $). Sitten myymme "haluatko olla Tutkija päivän Viikissä (1000 $) sekä raakaruokaseminaaripäivä huippututkijoiden kanssa (Englanniksi - 1000 $). Hinnat ovat korkeat ja tuotteet pienet, jotta kate olisi iso ja tutkimus saisi pelinappuloita ;c)) Kun olet valinnut yhden paina punaista "GET THIS PERK" niin sinut ohjataan korttimaksuun.Koirille on tarjolla erilaisia ruokavalioita, joiden suosio vaihtelee ja jotka joutuvat helposti kiistelyn kohteiksi. Tieteellistä tutkimustietoa ruokavalioiden paremmuudesta ei tällä hetkellä juurikaan ole. Helsingin yliopistossa on käynnissä tutkimusprojekti koirien ruokinnan ja terveyden yhteyksistä. Rahoita projektiamme ja auta meitä saamaan työmme valmiiksi!DOGRISK on suomalainen tutkimusryhmä, joka selvittää koirien ruokinnan yhteyttä niiden sairausriskeihin. Tutkimme esimerkiksi syöpää, sydänsairauksia, nivelrikkoa, epilepsiaa, diabetesta, ruoansulatuskanavan sairauksia, kilpirauhasen vajaatoimintaa ja hammassairauksia. Sairausriskeihin vaikuttavat ruokinnan lisäksi muut ympäristötekijät ja geneettinen perimä, mutta meidän pääasiallinen tutkimuskohteemme on juuri ruokinta, jota tutkimme monipuolisesti eri tieteenalojen menetelmiä ja kysymyksenasetteluja hyödyntäen. Projektissa käytetään kahta erilaista tutkimusasetelmaa: 1) havainnoivaa epidemiologista kyselytutkimusta ja 2) ruokintainterventiokokeita.1) Olemme keränneet laajalla kyselylomakkeella tietoa jo lähes 11 000 koiranomistajalta. Kysely käsittelee koiran ominaisuuksia, käyttöä, elinympäristöä, ruokintaa ja sairauksia. Koirat syövät tyytyväisenä samaa ruokaa päivästä ja vuodesta toiseen, mutta ruokavalion koostumus vaihtelee koirien välillä. Jotkut syövät kuivamuonaa, jotkut koiranmakkaraa ja tölkkiruokaa, jotkut taas kotiruokaa tai raakaruokaa. Tässä suhteessa koirilla on helppo jäljittää ruokinnan ja sairauksien välisiä yhteyksiä. Tarvitaan vain rahoitusta, jotta aineisto saadaan nyt analysoitua. Tähän tarvitsemme apuasi!2) Olemme jo toteuttaneet ensimmäisen ruokintainterventiotutkimuksemme, jossa 45 koiraa noudatti kahta erilaista, tasapainoista ruokavaliota 4-5-kuukauden ajan. Koirat jatkoivat tavallista elämäänsä omistajaperheissään tutkimuksen ajan. Tutkimuksen alussa ja lopussa niiltä kerättiin uloste-, virtsa-, veri-, karva- ja kudosnäytteet. Näytteistä on tehty jo monenlaisia mittauksia (mm. vitamiineja, rasvahappoja, verisoluja, suolistomikrobeja ja RNA-geeniekspressiota), mutta mittaustulosten analysoimiseen ja julkaisemiseen meillä ei tällä hetkellä ole rahoitusta. Tutkimus pitäisi myös toistaa tulosten varmistamiseksi. Tässäkin voit auttaa rahoittamalla projektiamme!Katso miten voit auttaa oikeanpuoleisista ”Perkseistä” (=vastineet). Esim. newsletterin (=uutiskirjeen) voit tilata myös suomenkielisenä! Ja support ribbon on vihreä DOGRISK-kannatusnauha jota voit pitää koirasi kaulapannassa, valjaissa, remmissä tai vaikka omassa takissasi! Näytä hyvää esimerkkiä muille ja anna koirasi olla ylpeä siitä, että tuet koiratutkimusta. Saat ylläolevan tapaisen tekstin koirasi kuvaan, jos laitat kuvan viestinä Dogriskin Facebook-sivuille!HUOM: Kaikki vastikkeet ovat kalliimpia kuin niiden arvo; sillä juuri keräämme tutkimusvaroja.________________________________________________   And here is the text in GERMAN: Was ist gesünder: Fertigfutter, Selbstgekochtes oder BARF?Welche Art von Futter ist für unsere Hunde ideal? Hilf uns dabei, unabhängig von der Futtermittelindustrie zu forschen und diese wichtige Frage endlich zu beantworten. Futtertrends kommen und gehen, stets begleitet von hitzigen Diskussionen darüber, welche Ernährungsform die gesündeste ist: Die Hundehalter schlagen sich deswegen förmlich die Köpfe ein. Bis heute gibt es dazu keine ernstzunehmenden, wissenschaftlichen und vor allem unabhängigen Fakten. Deswegen haben wir beschlossen, etwas dagegen zu unternehmen. Wir, die DOGRISK Forschungsgruppe, wollen es genau wissen! Allerdings ist professionelle Forschung teuer und die Suche nach Sponsoren ist schwierig, wenn es um alternative Fütterungsmethoden geht und keine multinationalen Konzerne hinter der Forschungsidee stehen. Deswegen brauchen wir die Unterstützung der Hundehalter, deswegen brauchen wir Deine Unterstützung! Hilf uns dabei, unabhängige Forschung zu betreiben. Unterstütze unsere Forschung: Im Sinne gesunder Hunde Beteilige Dich jetzt! Jeder Euro zählt!Hilf uns, die Zusammenhänge zwischen Fütterung und Erkrankungen zu belegen! Wie Du helfen kannst Du kannst uns dabei helfen, unabhängig zu forschen – selbst, wenn Du kein Geld ausgeben kannst. Perk / Prämie kaufenDu kannst einen finanziellen Beitrag leisten, indem Du eine unserer Prämien kaufst. Du erhältst also eine Gegenleistung für Dein Geld. Angefangen vom DOGRISK Newsletter, über Studien und Bücher bis hin zu einem Tag in unserem Labor, haben wir interessante Prämien zusammengestellt. Die Einnahmen fließen direkt in unsere Projekte.  Kleinen Betrag spendenWenn Dir die Perks zu teuer sind, kannst Du natürlich einfach einen kleineren Betrag spenden. Jeder Euro zählt! Denk daran, es gibt Millionen von Hundehaltern in Deutschland, Österreich und der Schweiz. Wenn jeder nur 10 Cent spenden würde, könnten wir unabhängig forschen. Aktion teilenAuch wenn Du gar keine finanziellen Mittel beisteuern kannst, kannst Du uns helfen. Teile diese Aktion auf Facebook, bei Twitter oder per E-Mail. Informiere jeden, den Du kennst darüber. Wer wir sindWir, die DOGRISK Research Group, sind eine Gruppe von unabhängigen Wissenschaftlern aus Finnland und widmen unsere Forschung zur Lösung des Rätsels, ob bestimmte Erkrankungen die Folge nicht optimaler Fütterung sein könnten. Gemeint sind Krankheiten wie Krebs, Herzkrankheiten, Arthrose, Epilepsie, Diabetes, chronische Magen-Darm-Erkrankungen, Schilddrüsenunterfunktion, Zahn- und Zahnfleisch-Probleme ... und viele mehr. Wir nennen uns die DOGRISK Research Group, wie wir nach Risikofaktoren für Erkrankungen von Hunden suchen. Uns ist selbstverständlich bewusst, dass andere Einflussfaktoren wie Genetik oder Umwelt ebenfalls eine große Rolle spielen, dennoch liegt unser Hauptaugenmerk auf der Ernährung und darauf, ob Erkrankungen mit der Fütterung in einem Zusammenhang stehen. Wenn Du genaueres über uns wissen willst, scrolle nach unten, wir möchten, dass Du alles über uns und unsere Arbeit erfährst. Woran wir arbeiten  Im Moment konzentriert sich unsere Forschung auf 2 sehr interessante Projekte:
Halterbefragung zur Entstehung von Krankheiten: 11.000 Hundebesitzer haben bisher unsere umfangreichen, validierten Fragebögen beantwortet. Wir befragen die Tierhalter nach Lebensumständen, Aktivität, etwaigen Erkrankungen und natürlich nach der Art der Ernährung. Ob nun Fertigfutter, Tischreste oder BARF – wir können anhand dieser Daten auswerten, welche Fütterungsart mit welchen Erkrankungen in einem kausalen Zusammenhang steht. Wir benötigen nur noch die notwendigen finanziellen Mittel, um diese riesige Datenmenge auszuwerten. Hilf uns dabei!
Studie zum Einfluss einer Ernährungsumstellung: Wir haben 45 Hunde in zwei Gruppen unterteilt. Jede Gruppe bekam über einen Zeitraum von 4 bis 5 Monaten jeweils ein bestimmtes, ausgewogenes Futter. Dabei lebten sie zuhause bei ihren Familien. Wir haben Kot-, Urin- und Blutuntersuchungen vor und nach der Futterumstellung durchgeführt. Leider fehlen uns nun die finanziellen Mittel, um eine statistische Auswertung durchzuführen, Artikel zu schreiben und diese zu veröffentlichen. Außerdem müssen wir natürlich noch eine weitere Studie durchführen, um die Ergebnisse zu bestätigen. Du kannst uns dabei helfen, das umzusetzen!
 Was wir brauchenWir benötigen natürlich Forschungsgelder für diese Projekte… denn Forschung ist teuer: Es kostet allein 1.000 €, eine komplette Analyse für einen einzigen Hund durchzuführen. Nehmen 50 Hunde an einer Studie teil und jeder Fall muss 3-mal ausgewertet werden (vor, während und nach der Futterumstellung), so sind das schon 150.000 €. Es kostet 2.000 €, einen wissenschaftlichen Artikel in einer anerkannten Fachzeitschrift zu veröffentlichen. Und nur dann wird eine Studie in Fachkreisen Beachtung finden. Wir gehen davon aus, in den nächsten beiden Jahren 15 Artikel zu veröffentlichen, das macht 30.000 €. Es kostet 10.000 € statistische Analysen durchführen zu lassen, die für ernstzunehmende Forschung unerlässlich ist.   Es kostet 150.000 € das Jahresgehalt aller beteiligten Wissenschaftler der DOGRISK Research Group zu finanzieren. Das macht 300.000 € für 2 Jahre Forschung. Wir benötigen also 500.000 €, um 2 Jahre lang im Sinne gesunder Hunde forschen zu können. Die Mitglieder der ForschungsgruppeDamit Du ganz genau weißt, wen Du unterstützt, möchten wir uns gern einzeln vorstellen. Anna Hielm-Bjorkman, DVM, PhD, Professor, PI, DOGRISK Group Leiterin: Ich bin 54 Jahre alt und habe 19 Jahre lang als praktizierende Tierärztin gearbeitet. Seit 9 Jahren bin ich im Bereich Hochschulforschung, als Dozentin und Tierärztin tätig. Ich behandle alle oben genannten Krankheiten und bin unglaublich frustriert darüber, dass wir Ärzte wirklich keine Ahnung haben, warum unser hündischen Patienten eigentlich erkranken. Und das gleiche gilt für unsere zweibeinigen Familienmitglieder und Freunde: Warum bekommen wir Krebs, Diabetes, Epilepsie usw. ...? In meiner Arbeit war ich schon immer daran interessiert, Krankheiten zu vermeiden, an Stelle sie nur zu behandeln. Die moderne Medizin behandelt die Krankheit sowieso meist nicht, sondern kaschiert nur die Symptome. In meiner Arbeit konzentriere ich mich auf die Ernährung und behandle mit Nahrungsergänzungsmitteln, aber auch Chirurgie, pharmakologischen und nicht-pharmakologische Behandlungen, um zu einer echten Gesundung zu gelangen. Meine Arbeit konzentriert sich zu 80% auf die Forschung, allerdings wird mir von der Universität gar kein Budget zur Verfügung gestellt.  Dies bedeutet, dass ich meine Finanzierung selbst bewerkstelligen muss. Und Hundefutter scheint nicht die oberste Priorität im Finanzplan von Finnland zu sein…Ich habe natürlich auch einen Vierbeiner zuhause. Sie heißt Lyra, ist ca. 2 Jahre alt und kommt aus Griechenland. Sie wird roh ernährt. Webseite:  https://tuhat.halvi.helsinki.fi/portal/en/person/hielmb    Liisa Uusitalo, MSCI, PhD (Mensch / Hund Ernährungsepidemiologie): Ich bin eine Ernährungswissenschaftlerin und habe im Bereich Epidemiologie promoviert. Ich war seit meinem Studienabschluss im Bereich der menschlichen Ernährungsepidemiologie tätig, wobei ich mich auf die Entstehung von Typ-1-Diabetes konzentriert habe. Seit anderthalb Jahren engagiere ich mich für das DOGRISK Projekt und ich warte gespannt darauf, endlich meine epidemiologischen Erkenntnisse zum Nutzen von Mensch und Tier einzusetzen. Es gibt so viele spannenden Themen zu denen wir noch viel zu wenig wissen: Epilepsie, Krebs, Diabetes, Allergien, Gelenkerkrankungen ... alle samt wichtig für Hunde und Menschen! Webseite: https://www.linkedin.com/in/liisa-uusitalo-b66a74a4?authType=NAME_SEARCH&authToken=Rhie&locale=en_US&srchid=46914541481919461126&srchindex=1&srchtotal=4&trk=vsrp_people_res_name&trkInfo=VSRPsearchId%3A46914541481919461126%2CVSRPtargetId%3A372904062%2CVSRPcmpt%3Aprimary%2CVSRPnm%3Atrue%2CauthType%3ANAME_SEARCH Johanna Anturaniemi, MSCI (Tierzucht), Doktorandin (Nutrigenomik, Metabolomik): Ich bin Agrarwissenschaftlerin und schloss mein Studium im Jahr 2010 im Bereich Tierzucht mit dem Hauptfach Genetik ab. Seitdem arbeite ich bei der DOGRISK Research Group. Der Einfluss der Ernährung auf die Gesundheit und Erkrankungen ist ein hochinteressantes Forschungsgebiet. Ich möchte unbedingt die komplexen Zusammenhänge zwischen Genetik, Ernährung und Stoffwechsel erforschen. Solche Erkenntnisse würden uns helfen, die Bedeutung für unser Leben und auch das unserer Hunde zu verstehen. Meine Inspiration für diese Arbeit war mein Staffi 'Elvis', der unter Allergien litt und 2014 leider verstorben ist. Webseite: https://tuhat.helsinki.fi/portal/en/persons/johanna-anturaniemi(eea11397-1f2f-4343-a2f5-af5aa71c0993).html Noora Sjögren, DVM, MSCI (Tierernährung), Doktorandin im Bereich Tierernährung: Ich bin eine 36-jährige Tierärztin, ich habe einen Master of Science in Tierernährung. Außerdem bin ich Agrarwissenschaftlerin. Im Frühjahr 2016 wurde ich bei ECVC (The European College of Veterinary and Comparative Nutrition) angenommen und mein Ziel ist es, im Bereich der klinischen Ernährung Tieren zu forschen. Tierernährung hat hat mich schon immer interessiert, vor allem die Behandlung und Prävention von Erkrankungen.  In meiner täglichen Arbeit als Tierärztin möchte ich meine Patienten so gut wie möglich behandeln und Krankheiten lieber verhindern, als sie zu threrapieren. Meine zwei Westies "Tarmo" und "Tyyne“ sowie mein Zwergdackel „Hilkka“ sind meine Inspiration – auch für Sie möchte ich herausfinden, welche Erkrankungen man mit Hilfe einer optimalen Ernährung verhindern kann. Außerdem gehört Robin Moore zu unserem Team, er ist eine 23-jähriger Bachelor Student im Bereich Biochemie.  Webseite: https://tuhat.helsinki.fi/portal/fi/persons/robin-moore(3ce9d107-a531-470b-b5b3-39199985bff5).html Zusätzlich unterstützen uns Susanna Paavilainen, Anna Loimaranta, Niina Siljander,Sara Zaldivar-Lopez, Stella Barrouin-Melo und Ziga Gerber. Die Stärke unserer Forschungsgruppe liegt darin, neugierig zu sein, auf der Suche nach Antworten auch über den Tellerrand zu schauen, Forschung im Sinne der Tiere zu lieben, keine vorgefertigten Meinungen zu haben, auch mal um die Ecke zu denken und vor allem, sich nicht von großen Futtermittelherstellern oder der Pharmaindustrie „herumschupsen“ zu lassen. Außerdem sind wir – bei aller Bescheidenheit – hervorragende Wissenschaftler. Die DOGRISK Forschungsgruppe hat nur ein Ziel: zu lernen, wie Krankheiten entstehen und dies mit der Ernährung in Verbindung gebracht werden kann. Vor allem aber, wie man diese Erkrankungen verhindern und behandeln kann. Im Sinne der Tiere und nicht mit Gewinnen, Margen und Marktanteilen im Hinterkopf.  Positive Auswirkungen unserer ForschungUnser Projekt ist einfach genial! Wir haben die Daten bereits in Augenschein genommen und die verraten uns bereits, dass es einen Zusammenhang zwischen Erkrankungen und der Ernährung gibt. Einige Lebensmittel wirken sich tatsächlich positiv aus, während andere wirklich ungesund sind ... Wir haben eine Theorie, warum das der Fall sein könnte, aber um ehrlich zu sein, wissen wir es eben noch nicht genau. Um mal einige Beispiele zu nennen: Führt das Erhitzen von Lebensmitteln dazu, dass sie ungesünder werden? Ist eine fettreiche, aber kohlenhydratarme Ernährung gesünder für Hunde? Benötigen Hunde wirklich kein Vitamin C im Futter? Ist Trockenfutter einfach „zu trocken“? Fehlen im Fertigfutter Nährstoffe, die wir vielleicht gar nicht auf dem Schirm hatten? Ist das Futter für eine gesunde Ernährung vielleicht einfach zu „steril“? Wenn wir das erforschen können, werden wir es wissen und müssen nicht mehr spekulieren. Eine weitere große Auswirkung unserer Forschung bezieht sich es auf die menschliche Ernährung. In Bezug auf uns Menschen ist es noch schwerer, Zusammenhänge zwischen Ernährung und Erkrankungen festzustellen, da wir meist erst im Alter erkranken und die Ernährung sich im Laufe eines Menschenlebens ständig verändert. Menschen neigen außerdem dazu, Fragebögen nicht ganz so ehrlich auszufüllen und die abendlichen Chips, Schokolade oder das Glas Wein nicht mit in den Fragebogen einzutragen. Das ist bei Hunden anders, da dort der Mensch das Futter zuteilt. Außerdem bleibt die Ernährung der Tiere über Monate oder gar Jahre gleich. Weil Menschen und Hunde aber ansonsten in der gleichen Umgebung leben und oftmals unter den gleichen Erkrankungen leiden, können wir Rückschlüsse auf die menschliche Ernährung ziehen. Das ist bei Laborratten nicht in dem Umfang möglich, da sie eben unter Laborbedingungen gehalten werden. Bitte unterstütze uns! Dein Beitrag kann den Unterschied machen. Teile diese Aktion in Sozialen Medien und informiere andere Hundehalter, Deinen Züchter, Deinen Tierarzt oder Tierheilpraktiker, den Zooladen um die Ecke oder das örtliche Tierheim. Wir sind routinierte Wissenschaftler mit einer beeindruckenden Reihe von Publikationen in den besten Fachzeitschriften für Veterinär- und Ernährungswissenschaften (siehe: http://www.dogrisk.com/publications). Wir sind stolz auf unsere Forschung und hoffen, einen Beitrag zur Gesunderhaltung unserer Hunde leisten zu können. Wir forschen für alle Hundebesitzer, Tierliebhaber und Menschen, die vielleicht unter den gleichen Erkrankungen leiden wie ihre geliebten Vierbeiner. Wir hoffen, mit unserer Forschung einen Einfluss auf die Futtermittel- und Pharmaindustrie zu nehmen. Aber das geht nur, wenn wir unabhängig forschen können und dafür brauchen wir Deine Hilfe!Vielen Dank für Deine Unterstützung! -------------------------       And here is part of the text in Portuguese: O que os cães cozinhariam; carne, gorduras, ossos, ração seca, alimentos crus,…?Todos nós perguntamos que tipo de alimento devemos dar aos nossos animais de estimação. Ajude-nos a fazer pesquisa baseada em evidências! Financiamento colaborativo é uma forma democrática de angariar fundos para apoiar as necessidades de sua comunidade. Faça hoje sua contribuição" As dietas para cães vêm e vão. Os donos parecem entrar em discussões acaloradas sobre qual é a dieta mais saudável, qual é a mais nutritiva, qual é a mais balanceada, e por aí vão. Até o momento, não existem fatos baseados em evidências sobre isso, se uma dieta é melhor do que outra. Nós decidimos fazer algo a respeito disso: nós queremos saber! A Finlândia é um país onde você pode fazer pesquisa independente e desenvolvida em Universidades. Mas como as pesquisas são dispendiosas, nossos benefícios (perks) também são. Entretanto, o dinheiro que conseguirmos arrecadar vai direto para o projeto. Por favor, ajude-nos a continuar nossa pesquisa!Benefício: Nossos próximos 5 artigos científicos:Com a ajuda da sua contribuicão, nós poderemos publicar dados que temos reunido desde 2009. Mal podemos esperar por mergulhar nesses dados! Você terá acesso a cada um dos artigos em seu e-mail no mesmo dia em que eles forem publicados. Um artigo adicional, o primeiro já publicado em revista científica editada por especialistas, em cujo texto validamos parte do questionário de frequência alimentar, será enviado ao seu e-mail logo que esta campanha termine.

story:
Hello, We are here to bring change to the old and traditional fast food industry!



Why we believe Conny will be a success 

  • We believe that Conny will be a success because it is a new tasty, fun and delicious food, that can be enjoyed by anyone, literally anyone!
  • Conny is a completely new kind of food, easy and fun to eat!
  • As our Conny are so different from any other food in the fast food and finger food industry we believe Conny will be a fresh start in an industry that has only sold burgers, fries and fried chicken for decades!
  • The young population of Latvia has an open mind, and is looking to see their country develop! Here we are to bring jobs, and fresh opportunities to this fabulous country!
  • Conny are simply delicious!

Team pictures


                                    

Kristina, Stefano and Jess

                                                                                      


Biography

&

story


Stefano is born in Italy, Jess (me) is also born in Italy and Kristina was born in Latvia! 

We are a great and cooperative team full of ideas and ready to bring change to the fast food Industry with our delicious Conny's!!

 We have had a huge love for food from the beginning of our days! we always loved to cook, eat and try new foods!

The most passionate about cooking is Stefano, the oldest guy in our profile picture, don't tell him I wrote that :))

Anyways, he was the one that came up with the Conny idea, and he wanted to create a team to bring Conny to life!

Therefore he asked me, (Jess the guy with the brown hair, on the right of the picture) and his wife Kristina (the blond woman sitting on the chair) to help him bring this new food to life, so everybody could taste one! 

We all agreed to make a team, and bring this idea to life, because we believed in it from the first second we put that Conny into our mouths, they completely melted away!! It was so delicious!

Here we are now working hard to bring Conny to Latvia for you, your family and your friends!


Connys


BBQ Conny


Bacon&eggs Conny

                                                          

Ridziniece Conny


And many more...

What we have 


We have nearly everything that we need to get started

  • We have a Latvian registered company called SIA CONNY
  • We have all the food menu ready, with all the different delicious Conny recipes!


  • we have all the costs figured out about the price to make one single Conny, how much do we have to sell to cover our costs!
  • We would potentially like to open our selling point in Riga City Center, but in case it is not possible we are flexible to other solutions(opening in a shopping center)!

why we need your funding


  • We need 46'599$ or 43'000€ (we put the funding in dollars to abilitate people to fund us via credit/debit card, which wasn't an option if we asked our funding in euros.) 
  • We need your funding to find and rent a place where we will open our first restaurant in Latvia!
  • To buy a kitchen and all the cooking equipment we need to make connys.
  • To buy the needed ingredients to make connys in bulk quantity.
  • Marketing Promo Campaign in Baltic Countries (tv, magazine, radio)


What we do if we don't get fully funded

If we don't get fully funded no stress:

  • If we need from 1€-10'000€ to reach our final goal we will take a loan from the bank.
  • In case the sum needed to reach our goal is higher than 10'000€ we will get a bank loan, and we will find other investors!

Our team (part 2)

Stefano
                                                                                          


         Jess                                                                                                                                          

                                 Kristina      




Our unique Perks for you


  • 2$ We will post your name on our OFFICIAL facebook page thanking you! 
  • 4$ Get a 100% FREE Conny of your choice! Get your name featured on our OFFICIAL facebook platform! (and your face on request)
  • 6$GET a 100% FREE Conny of your choice, and 1 completely FREE non-alcoholic drink! You will get a special feature of your name, on our OFFICIAL Facebook platform and twitter platform, with a small dedicated dedication! 
  • 11$ You get 3 completely FREE Conny of your choice and 1 totally FREE non-alcoholic drink! You will be specially featured on our OFFICIAL facebook page, and twitter page! (a picture of your face can be posted on request).we will put a picture of you will be put on to our restaurant wall! (with your permission)
  • 22$ Get 1 Exclusive picture of you (with your permission) on the wall of our first restaurant! Plus you get 3 completely FREE conny's of your choice, plus 3 FREE amazing Conny's special edition with Spanish-paella in it! And.... to end 2 totally free non-alcoholic drinks of your choice! all for you, your friends and your family!! Get invited to the opening ceremony of the first Conny Restaurant in Latvia! 
  • 55$ Get 1 exclusive picture of you on our wall (with your permission) Get 15,  100% FREE Conny: 8 normal Conny of your choice, and 8 special edition Conny Spanish Paella (XL size), plus 5 completely FREE drinks of your choice! Get invited to the opening ceremony of the first Conny Restaurant in Latvia! 
  • 100$ Get an A3 picture of you on our wall!Get a special Conny called after you, with VIP ingredients (possibility of designing your own Conny, with the food you want inside it)!Get 16 limited edition Conny Spanish Paella, + 16 normal Conny of your choice, and 15 FREE non-alcoholic drinks! Get invited to the opening ceremony of  every single Conny Restaurant that will ever open!

Risks & Challenges


Any business has risks and difficulties that they have to overcome

  • Our major risk is to cover the costs, we plan to cover them by having a strong and influent advertising campaign to let as many people in Latvia know about Conny arriving in Latvia.
  • People not liking our Conny, we plan to overcome this potential problem by being very open to suggestions that the customers might have about Conny, or anything else they might feel needs some improvement.
  • Are we able to run a business? Yes we have members of our team with 20 years experience in business, and we have figured out every cost that our business we have, from the food, to the electricity and every other cost.

 This are our potential difficulties we feel ready to overcome


Other Ways You Can Help


If you are interested in financing/investing in our project from 5000(euros) and up, please contact us! We can discuss about some special deals.

phone number: +37122343818

E-mail: connycones@gmail.com


If you cannot contribute but still would like to help... 

this is completely fine!


  • we would be really thankful if you spread the word around about us, to your family and friends! We actually really thank you for that!
  • At the click of a button you could share our IndieGoGo page on facebook, twitter, Instagram, or whatever platform you prefer!
  • Tweet to your friends about us&write something on your facebook timeline about conny's! Let your friends know! We want to give our most sincere thank you for doing this to help us!


THANK YOU!
story_txt:
Hello, We are here to bring change to the old and traditional fast food industry!Why we believe Conny will be a success We believe that Conny will be a success because it is a new tasty, fun and delicious food, that can be enjoyed by anyone, literally anyone!Conny is a completely new kind of food, easy and fun to eat!
As our Conny are so different from any other food in the fast food and finger food industry we believe Conny will be a fresh start in an industry that has only sold burgers, fries and fried chicken for decades!
The young population of Latvia has an open mind, and is looking to see their country develop! Here we are to bring jobs, and fresh opportunities to this fabulous country!
Conny are simply delicious!
Team pictures                                    
Kristina, Stefano and Jess

                                                                                      Biography&storyStefano is born in Italy, Jess (me) is also born in Italy and Kristina was born in Latvia! We are a great and cooperative team full of ideas and ready to bring change to the fast food Industry with our delicious Conny's!! We have had a huge love for food from the beginning of our days! we always loved to cook, eat and try new foods!
The most passionate about cooking is Stefano, the oldest guy in our profile picture, don't tell him I wrote that :))
Anyways, he was the one that came up with the Conny idea, and he wanted to create a team to bring Conny to life!
Therefore he asked me, (Jess the guy with the brown hair, on the right of the picture) and his wife Kristina (the blond woman sitting on the chair) to help him bring this new food to life, so everybody could taste one! 
We all agreed to make a team, and bring this idea to life, because we believed in it from the first second we put that Conny into our mouths, they completely melted away!! It was so delicious!
Here we are now working hard to bring Conny to Latvia for you, your family and your friends!

Connys

BBQ Conny





Bacon&eggs Conny




                                                          



Ridziniece Conny




And many more...What we have 


We have nearly everything that we need to get started


We have a Latvian registered company called SIA CONNY
We have all the food menu ready, with all the different delicious Conny recipes!






we have all the costs figured out about the price to make one single Conny, how much do we have to sell to cover our costs!
We would potentially like to open our selling point in Riga City Center, but in case it is not possible we are flexible to other solutions(opening in a shopping center)!

why we need your funding


We need 46'599$ or 43'000€ (we put the funding in dollars to abilitate people to fund us via credit/debit card, which wasn't an option if we asked our funding in euros.) 
We need your funding to find and rent a place where we will open our first restaurant in Latvia!
To buy a kitchen and all the cooking equipment we need to make connys.
To buy the needed ingredients to make connys in bulk quantity.
Marketing Promo Campaign in Baltic Countries (tv, magazine, radio)


What we do if we don't get fully funded
If we don't get fully funded no stress:


If we need from 1€-10'000€ to reach our final goal we will take a loan from the bank.
In case the sum needed to reach our goal is higher than 10'000€ we will get a bank loan, and we will find other investors!


Our team (part 2)

Stefano

                                                                                          
         Jess                                                                                                                                          
                                 Kristina      




Our unique Perks for you

2$ We will post your name on our OFFICIAL facebook page thanking you! 
4$ Get a 100% FREE Conny of your choice! Get your name featured on our OFFICIAL facebook platform! (and your face on request)

6$GET a 100% FREE Conny of your choice, and 1 completely FREE non-alcoholic drink! You will get a special feature of your name, on our OFFICIAL Facebook platform and twitter platform, with a small dedicated dedication! 

11$ You get 3 completely FREE Conny of your choice and 1 totally FREE non-alcoholic drink! You will be specially featured on our OFFICIAL facebook page, and twitter page! (a picture of your face can be posted on request).we will put a picture of you will be put on to our restaurant wall! (with your permission)

22$ Get 1 Exclusive picture of you (with your permission) on the wall of our first restaurant! Plus you get 3 completely FREE conny's of your choice, plus 3 FREE amazing Conny's special edition with Spanish-paella in it! And.... to end 2 totally free non-alcoholic drinks of your choice! all for you, your friends and your family!! Get invited to the opening ceremony of the first Conny Restaurant in Latvia! 

55$ Get 1 exclusive picture of you on our wall (with your permission) Get 15,  100% FREE Conny: 8 normal Conny of your choice, and 8 special edition Conny Spanish Paella (XL size), plus 5 completely FREE drinks of your choice! Get invited to the opening ceremony of the first Conny Restaurant in Latvia! 

100$ Get an A3 picture of you on our wall!Get a special Conny called after you, with VIP ingredients (possibility of designing your own Conny, with the food you want inside it)!Get 16 limited edition Conny Spanish Paella, + 16 normal Conny of your choice, and 15 FREE non-alcoholic drinks! Get invited to the opening ceremony of  every single Conny Restaurant that will ever open!

story:
"Greeking me" = To make me feel like a Greek for a while.

(Of course you won't find this term in a dictionary!)

Our country, Greece, has been in the center of worldwide interest during the last year. The financial crisis is a huge daily obstacle for many people and unemployment hits more and more Greeks, especially the younger ones.
Greeking.me is actually an effort by two young enterpreneurs, that strive to make a difference and build a sustainable venture in Greece. We have faith in our abilities & the potential of the project and remain optimistic about the success of our effort.

But first things first. Let us introduce.
In the last few years, the number of people who visited Greece in order to get a close look at its beauties, history and cultural background has increased. Undoubtedly, there is a great need for quality, innovative and reliable touristic services.

Greeking.me is providing fun, interactive experiences through which people will get to know the real greek culture in an authentic way. Our city, Athens, is a vibrant place, full of contrasts and secrets. Our goal is for you to explore Athens like a local through hands-on, personalized experiences.

The whole idea is based on activities that everyone loves; exploring, cooking, dancing & having fun! Our services address to explorers and visitors who want to feel the real Greek vibe, avoiding the tourist traps.


1.  Quality: All our services are carefully designed in order to offer you an experience of exceptional value. It is our aim to create for you unique, memorable experiences.

2. Authenticity: Our daily mission is to offer you experiences that exceed your expectations. Through our tours and workshops, you will explore the authentic character of the city through the eyes of a local.

3. Excellence: We are committed to being a high performance tourism agency by staying focused on total customer satisfaction. We continuously improve our processes and ourselves in order to offer you the best service.

4. Customer-focused: It is our aim to provide the highest level of customer service. We treat each customer as a friend, building a personal relationship with him.

Α few monhs ago, we decided to share our venture with the Indiegogo community, hoping to find support for our new beggining. You see, economy in Greece is exactly what it looks like. Building a company from scratch is a big, scary adventure, involving lots of difficulties and expenses. The annual taxation rate for a small business is 26% of the total profit, while you are also obliged to pay in advance a 50 % tax rate of the next year -not to mention the endless bureaucracy and the unfriendly financial environment.
Despite all these facts, though, we remain optimistic and feel certain that our idea will offer a great value to anyone who wishes to discover the authentic local life in Athens.
This is why we need your support; if we cover our first year expenses with the help of your contribution, we will be able to pay all the taxes, fees & payments that are necessary in order to fully operate our business. We begin now, we begin from scratch & we trust that your help combined with our work will bring to life an exciting new venture in the tourism market of Greece.

By supporting us:
  • You support Greek economy by giving jobs to Greek people. Unemployment is the #1 problem of our country.
  • You help us inspire young Greeks to make their efforts in their own country, instead of leaving Greece. Crowdfunding is a really great way to kick-off your own venture, so let's inspire more people to use it.
  • You help us create an outgoing sustainable business model that will create even more jobs in the future. Our vision is to expand Greeking.me in more cities and islands in Greece.
  • Travelers from all over the world will have the chance to come closer to Greek culture through personalized, fun & authentic experiences.

For the launching of Greeking.me, we need $15,000.
Here is a breakdown of our total costs for the first year:

We decided to give to our funders some unique perks that will give them a real taste of Greece. We thought that it would be great if you receive some premium, traditional products as a reward for your contribution! Thus, we partnered with 8 great Greek companies, who export globally. Take a look at our perks and choose the one that suits you:



The beekeeping family business Rota started producing thyme honey 40 years ago on the island of Serifos. The Family Beez honey is an exceptional kind of Greek organic raw honey of a unique taste, rich aroma and golden color. For each contribution of $99, you will receive a Family Beez GIFT PACK, consisting of a 460g beautifully packaged organic raw honey. A modern yet traditional Greek gift of great value.

Oreanthi blends in an innovative way Greek herbs, tried and trusted by generations with aromatic flowers and produces premium herbal teas in a fresh, new way to taste delicious and promote wellness. Oreanthi's herbal infusions are created by carefully selected Greek herbs and flowers and, with the expertise of a master blender and herbalist, 5 sophisticated delicious, fragrant blends are produced.

Meraki Organic Tea Mix won the Great Taste Awards 2015. It is a calming tea, rich in antioxidants that includes mountain Tea, marjoram, sage, mint, louisa & lavender. Tip for contributors: Use it as an evening tea, when high stress levels are mostly noticed!

Fisika soaps are totally natural and made of the well-known Cretan organic olive oil. Each product is handmade, created with care and attention to detail. Ideal for all skin types, Fisika soaps are refreshing, nourishing & hydrating. For each contribution, you will receive one pocket soap (40g) and one soap bar (110g). Choose among chocolate-jasmine, olive, rosemary-nettle and orange.

Ready to taste this yummy Greek fruit? For each contribution, you will receive one Askada dried figs jam (240g) & two Askada fig bars. The fig marmelade is made from sundried figs, fresh lemon juice & rapadura sugar and is ideal for use in cakes, wafer, stuffed buns etc. The fig bars are gluten free and without added sugar.

Greek delights are a sweet temptation that came to Greece, during the beginning of 19th century. Since then, the traditional recipe has been enriched with various ingredients and has a great variety of flavors. These small but tasty morsels can be served with your coffee or tea at home. The Bariamis delights, with their taste and quality, are the perfect treat for any occasion. A treat to sweeten your life and the lives of people you love. With each contribution of $35, 2 packages of Bariamis Greek Delights will come to your door.

The leading ANAX Superfood is a 100% natural product with Greek thyme honey, goji berry, sea buckthorn, Ceylon cinnamon and Chios mastic. A spread with a unique exotic taste. With no preservatives or other additives, the mixture of these natural ingredients combines their multiple beneficial properties in a tasty spoonful for all health-conscious people.


What better way to enjoy your Greek coffee than in an impressive Ploos Design coffee cup with saucer? This fine porcelain espresso cup is designed & printed with love in Greece. By contributing $65 you will also receive a Loumidis 200g original Greek coffee pack.


Your support is vital for us, as it will help us implement our idea in its early beginning. We are pretty convinced that lots of people globally share the same perspective with us, always trying to discover the authentic local life of their travel destination. With your contribution, we will create an innovative tourism agency that will drastically change the way that travelers experience Greek culture.
Let's build together the Greeking.me community - it starts with you!

We realize that some people may not be in a position to make a monetary contribution. Become an advocate of our work, if you aren't already:

  • Spread the word! Tell others about what we are doing and share our campaign on Twitter, Facebook and other social media.
  • Have some ideas about a new service? Don't be shy, contact us!
  • Give us your feedback about Greeking.me. It is really vital to us!
  • Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter.

How can I support the campaign without using PayPal?

If you would like to contribute to the campaign and get a perk of your choice without using PayPal, please send an email at athens@greeking.me with your perk of choice, your delivery address, the name to publish (you can donate anonymously as well) and your donation amount and we will send you our bank details. Once we have received the funds, we will add them to the campaign and your name will appear on the list of supporters.

When will the perks be delivered?

After the completion of our campaign, we will immediately dispatch the perks. Delivery time to UK/Europe will take 2-5 days. Rest of the World will take up to 10 days.

Why are you different from other travel agencies organizing walking tours in Greece?

We are not another travel agency organizing walking tours. Greeking.me is a new way of coming closer to Greek culture through a series of carefully designed experiences. Our walks in cultural trails of Athens (Morning Strolls, Neoclassical Turns & Night Crawlers), the gastronomical experience of Greek Ambrosia and the Zorba inside me are based on activities that we all love; exploring, cooking, dancing & having fun. Our experiences are fun, personalized and authentic aiming to differ from the ordinary tourism services.

Ready to dive into the authentic Greek culture?

Spread the love. Make it happen.

story:
News: All donations up to £5,000 will be matched by one of our existing funders. This means we will receive £20 for every £10 you donate!

Open Briefing is launching pioneering security and training units to help aid workers, human rights defenders, peace activists journalists and others stay safe and operate effectively, supporting them with preparation and training and also while they're on the ground. With your help we can protect those striving to make the world a better place!

What is Open Briefing?

Open Briefing is the world’s first civil society intelligence agency. We are a unique team of intelligence, military, law enforcement and government professionals working tirelessly behind the scenes to make a difference. We focus on doing three things:

  • We provide intelligence, security and training to organisations striving to make the world a better place.
  • We scrutinise the actions of governments and militaries and generate alternative policies.
  • We deliver a public intelligence service so that you know what is really going on in the world.

Founded in 2011, Open Briefing is a groundbreaking non-profit social enterprise supported by volunteers. We take no government or corporate funding and rely on charitable grants and public donations. We are your intelligence agency.

As featured by:

What are we planning?

There are thousands of ordinary people risking their lives every day to protect people and the planet. With your help, we can keep them safe.

We want to help aid workers, human rights defenders, peace activists, civil liberties campaigners, journalists and others operate safely and effectively on the ground in complex, hostile or remote areas, such as war zones, disaster areas or under repressive regimes. With your support, we can launch a security unit and a training unit to do just this.

Security unit

Our new security unit will address the serious lack of suitable security provision for activists and NGO workers. Working with trusted partners, Open Briefing is developing a range of defensive non-violent security services appropriate for the protection of civil society actors operating in high-risk environments. Such services might include GPS locators with 24/7 monitoring and SOS functionality, unarmed close protection teams made up of former police officers (rather than soldiers) and evacuation and crisis management plans.

Training unit

Our new training unit will deliver training packages tailored to the needs of civil society clients. In the first instance, this will include a range of Hostile Environment Awareness Training (HEAT) modules, including first aid, kidnap and hostage awareness, and counter-surveillance. We will also provide capacity-building courses designed to help NGO researchers use intelligence effectively, including training in collecting and analysing open source intelligence (OSINT), or designed to help human rights defenders and other activists operate and communicate securely, including training in cyber and information security.

“Issues of security and defence are often the least transparent to the public. Open Briefing is an important contribution to ensuring democratic oversight of governments and armies.”
John Feffer, co-director, Foreign Policy in Focus

These new units will join our existing intelligence unit and think tank, which have both been running since 2011.

Intelligence unit

Open Briefing’s pioneering intelligence unit provides in-depth intelligence briefings to civil society organisations and concerned citizens. This includes responding to the specific intelligence requirements of an international network of over 100 well-known aid agencies, human rights groups and other charities. The unit also publishes several monthly briefings designed to inform public and political debate, including on developments in remote-control warfare (armed drones, special forces, mercenaries, autonomous weapons, mass surveillance and cyber conflict) and scrutinising UK military actions against Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.

Think tank

While undertaking our intelligence work, we frequently identify policies that are not working. Our role then becomes to explain these failings, propose alternative strategies, and leverage our networks to promote those alternatives to opinion-formers, policymakers and the general public. As part of this, Open Briefing publishes a number of policy-orientated publications, which are informed by rigorous research and subject to expert review. 

Who are we?

Open Briefing is the brainchild of our founder, Chris Abbott. Chris was the deputy director of the world-renowned Oxford Research Group peace and security think tank until 2009. He is the author of two popular books on security and politics, as well as numerous influential reports and articles. He lives with his family on a smallholding in Cornwall in the west of England.

Chris is joined by an expert team of analysts and researchers. Our close-knit team of 16 people includes:

Steve Hathorn, who has nearly 30 year’s experience in intelligence spanning the British Army, United Nations, International Criminal Court and National Crime Agency.

Chris Cushing, who is a former military officer and has directed emergency humanitarian operations in 17 wars and two disasters for various international humanitarian organisations.

Rob O’Gorman, who is a former Canadian Forces intelligence operator, with over 20 years’ experience providing tactical, operational and strategic assessments.

Kevjn Lim, who is a former intelligence officer in the Singapore Armed Forces and was previously a delegate for the Red Cross in the Palestinian territories, Sudan, Iraq, Libya and Afghanistan.

Marc van Oudheusden, who is a senior adviser to both the Dutch government and NATO on internationalal crisis management.

The rest of our team includes academics, civil society leaders, political advisers and former police officers and intelligence officers from the United Kingdom, United States, Australia and Canada.

All of us are dedicated to applying our unique skills and experiences to making the world a better place. But we need your help.

“Open Briefing has established itself as singularly well-informed source of information on a wide range of international security issues. It has done so with a tiny budget compared with just about every NGO. Its entry on to the scene really is a breath of fresh air.”
Paul Rogers, professor of peace studies, University of Bradford

How can you help?

Unlike many organisations, Open Briefing does not take any money from governments or corporations. We rely on the support of volunteers and are funded by charitable grants and public donations.

Our new security and training units are groundbreaking, and we want to launch them with the backing of crowdfunding so that they are a truly public enterprise. So please help by supporting our crowdfunding campaign and encouraging your friends, family and colleagues to join you.

And to make your donation go even further, one of our existing funders has agreed to match all donations up to £5,000. So we will receive £20 for every £10 you donate!

Want to know more?

More information can be found on our website at www.openbriefing.org. Our full business plan for the next three years can be read at http://www.openbriefing.org/docs/Open-Briefing-proposal-2016-19.pdf.

If you have any questions, then please email our executive director, Chris Abbott, at chris.abbott@openbriefing.org who will be happy to answer them. Thank you!

“With its rational, thorough and transparent approach, Open Briefing has the potential to become an important corrective to often speculative media coverage.”
Magnus Nome, commissioning editor, openDemocracy
“Open Briefing has proved hugely useful time and again. Their analysis helps us focus our energies on where we can have the greatest impact for the protection of civilians in conflict. The value of that contribution cannot be over-estimated.” Nick Martlew, UK director, Crisis Action
“Open Briefing provides an invaluable service to us, conducting high-quality research in extremely tight timeframes and with a limited budget. The unique and wide-ranging pool of expertise available ensures that our very specific requests are met with the utmost precision.” Caroline Donnellan, manager, Remote Control project
story_txt:
News: All donations up to £5,000 will be matched by one of our existing funders. This
means we will receive £20 for every £10 you donate!
Open Briefing is launching pioneering security and training units to help aid workers, human rights defenders, peace activists journalists and others stay safe and operate effectively, supporting them with preparation and training and also while they're on the ground. With your help we can protect those striving to make the world a better place!
What is Open Briefing?
Open Briefing is the world’s
first civil society intelligence agency. We are a unique team of intelligence,
military, law enforcement and government professionals working tirelessly
behind the scenes to make a difference. We focus on doing three things:


We provide intelligence, security and training to
organisations striving to make the world a better place.
We scrutinise the actions of governments and militaries and generate
alternative policies.
We deliver a public intelligence service so that you know what is really going on in the world.


Founded in 2011, Open Briefing is a groundbreaking non-profit social enterprise supported by volunteers. We take no government or corporate funding and rely on charitable grants and public donations. We are your intelligence
agency.As featured by:What are we planning?
There are thousands of ordinary people risking their lives every day to protect people and the planet. With your help, we can keep them safe.
We want to help aid workers, human rights defenders, peace activists, civil liberties campaigners, journalists and others operate safely and effectively on the ground in complex, hostile or remote areas, such as war zones, disaster areas or under repressive regimes. With your support, we can launch a security unit and a training unit to do just this. 
Security unit Our new security unit will address the serious lack of suitable security provision for activists and NGO workers. Working with trusted partners, Open Briefing is developing a range of defensive non-violent security services appropriate for the protection of civil society actors operating in high-risk environments. Such services might include GPS locators with 24/7 monitoring and SOS functionality, unarmed close protection teams made up of former police officers (rather than soldiers) and evacuation and crisis management plans.
Training unit Our new training unit will deliver training packages tailored to the needs of civil society clients. In the first instance, this will include a range of
Hostile Environment Awareness Training (HEAT) modules, including first aid,
kidnap and hostage awareness, and counter-surveillance. We will also provide
capacity-building courses designed to help NGO researchers use intelligence
effectively, including training in collecting and analysing open source intelligence (OSINT), or designed to help human rights defenders and other activists operate and communicate securely, including training in cyber and information security. 
“Issues of security and defence are often the least transparent to the
public. Open Briefing is an important contribution to ensuring democratic oversight
of governments and armies.”John Feffer, co-director, Foreign Policy in Focus

These new units will join our existing intelligence unit and think tank, which have both been running since 2011.
Intelligence unit Open Briefing’s pioneering intelligence unit provides in-depth intelligence briefings to civil society organisations and concerned citizens. This includes responding to the specific intelligence requirements of an international network of over 100 well-known aid agencies, human rights groups and other charities. The unit
also publishes several monthly briefings designed to inform public and political debate, including on developments in remote-control warfare (armed drones, special forces, mercenaries, autonomous weapons, mass surveillance and cyber conflict) and scrutinising UK military actions against Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.
Think tank While undertaking our intelligence work, we frequently identify policies that are not working. Our role then becomes to explain these
failings, propose alternative strategies, and leverage our networks to promote
those alternatives to opinion-formers, policymakers and the general public. As
part of this, Open Briefing publishes a number of policy-orientated publications, which are informed by rigorous research and subject to expert review. 


Who are we?

Open Briefing is the brainchild of our founder, Chris Abbott.
Chris was the deputy director of the world-renowned Oxford Research Group peace
and security think tank until 2009. He is the author of two popular books on
security and politics, as well as numerous influential reports and articles. He lives with his family on
a smallholding in Cornwall in the west of England.
Chris is joined by an expert team of analysts and researchers. Our close-knit team of 16 people includes: 
Steve Hathorn, who has nearly 30 year’s experience in intelligence spanning the British Army, United Nations, International Criminal Court and National Crime Agency.
Chris Cushing, who is a former military officer and has directed emergency humanitarian operations in 17 wars and two disasters for various international humanitarian organisations.
Rob O’Gorman, who is a former Canadian Forces intelligence operator,
with over 20 years’ experience providing tactical, operational and strategic
assessments.
Kevjn Lim, who is a former intelligence officer in the Singapore
Armed Forces and was previously a delegate for the Red Cross in the Palestinian territories, Sudan, Iraq, Libya and Afghanistan. 
Marc van Oudheusden, who is a senior adviser to both the Dutch government and NATO on internationalal crisis management. 
The rest of our team includes academics, civil society leaders, political advisers and former police officers and intelligence officers from the United Kingdom, United States, Australia and Canada. 
All of us are dedicated to applying our unique skills and experiences to making the world a better place. But we need your help. 
“Open Briefing has established itself as singularly well-informed source of information on a wide range of international security issues. It has done so with a tiny budget compared with just about every NGO. Its entry on to the
scene really is a breath of fresh air.” Paul Rogers, professor of peace studies, University of Bradford


How can you help?
Unlike many organisations, Open Briefing does not take any money from governments or corporations. We rely on the support of volunteers and are funded by charitable grants and public donations. 
Our new security and training units are groundbreaking, and we want to launch them with the backing of crowdfunding so that they are a truly public enterprise. So please help by supporting our crowdfunding campaign and encouraging your friends, family and colleagues to join you. 
And to make your donation go even further, one of our existing funders
has agreed to match all donations up to £5,000. So we will receive £20
for every £10 you donate!
Want to know more?
More information can be found on our website at www.openbriefing.org. Our full business plan for the next three years can be read at http://www.openbriefing.org/docs/Open-Briefing-proposal-2016-19.pdf.
If you have any questions, then please email our executive director, Chris Abbott, at chris.abbott@openbriefing.org who will be happy to answer them. Thank you!
“With its rational, thorough and transparent approach, Open Briefing has the potential to become an important corrective to often speculative media coverage.” Magnus Nome, commissioning editor, openDemocracy

“Open Briefing has proved hugely useful time and again. Their analysis helps us focus our energies on where we can have the greatest impact for the protection of civilians in conflict. The value of that contribution cannot be over-estimated.” Nick Martlew, UK director, Crisis Action

“Open Briefing provides an invaluable service to us, conducting high-quality research in extremely tight timeframes and with a limited budget. The unique and wide-ranging pool of expertise available ensures that our very specific requests are met with the utmost precision.” Caroline Donnellan, manager, Remote Control project

story:
Short Summary

Eden Urban Farms has a vision to revolutionize the way food is grown and distributed around the world. We have an opportunity to make it happen starting right here in Detroit.

Eden Urban Farms employs a sustainable agriculture model utilizing indoor farming technology to provide locally grown fresh foods and employment opportunities to urban communities. Growing indoors and maximizing square footage by stacking growing systems, consistently yields double, triple or quadruple the harvest output achieved outdoors without the impact of weather. We can grow and provide locally sourced food products year-round to serve under-resourced communities, local grocers, restaurants, produce wholesalers and more.

Just imagine, no longer would you have to wait for strawberries to be in season or tomatoes, cucumbers, basil and even lettuce. Now you can have fresh, local produce year-round. Just think about the positive social and economic impact that could create!

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $25,000 right away to help secure a growing facility in the city of Detroit and purchase more growing equipment and supplies so we can start growing right away!

This initiative can only work if you help us. We believe in what we're doing and we have had a significant amount of support in the business, social and civic communities, but we need your investment to help reach these goals.

We have some great perks to send you if you choose to support our mission. We thank you for even the consideration.

The Impact

While we have received great interest from wholesale, commercial and retail grocers that are interested in selling our produce, we feel a responsibility toward feeding our community.

4 million households in Michigan alone live at risk of hunger. 1 in 5 people in Detroit face hunger or lack of food. These numbers don't even take into account how little access there is in the city of Detroit to fresh produce and healthy, organic foods.

For a number of years we have been delivering food to Detroit families through our nonprofit counterpart, mercyworks. It became apparent there were not enough local grocers to service some communities, nor a sustainable food source for under-resourced families. This is why we decided to investigate further into this type of farming in order to create a sustainable source of fresh food.

Other Ways You Can Help

We need your dollars to help us achieve this goal. But that's not all ... whether you could invest $20 or $2,000, we need you to share this campaign with your social networks to help us gain attention and attract other supporters.

For those of you who can't invest dollars, you can still support us by getting the word out about this campaign and Eden Urban Farms. You can use the sharing tools on this page and tell your social networks about this cool concept that has the potential to change many lives ... and it's happening right here in Detroit.
