story:
Who We Are

We are Ahmad Al-Jamal and Hussam Taha; the co-founders of Restored. While we used to lead regular everyday jobs in the past; Ahmad was a Junior CRM Executive at a logistics service company and Hussam was a Language Assistant at a military training institute, we now focus all of our efforts on Restored as on-going experiment to show the world and, more specifically, the people of Palestine why color and spontaneity are the greatest recipe for happiness.


What is Restored? Or Why Palestine Needs Restored

Restored is all about recycling and renovation. We restore old furniture by taking each piece on its own; by taking the necessary steps to improve its quality, hone its beauty and possibly even re-invent it into something unexpected. Moreover, it is also our priority to retain the legacy and history of every piece by focusing on the small handmade details, birthmarks if you will, that bookend the uniqueness of each one.

It all began last summer while we were moving into a new apartment. We were aware of how expensive new furniture is, and so the idea of restoring old furniture made sense to us while furnishing a home on a budget. We created a tiny workshop for us at the apartment, used whatever tools we could get our hands on and started experimenting. We were instantly hooked on the possibilities, and couldn’t wait to make more and more. Our friends were impressed too and some even asked us to restore their old furniture for them before it all accumulated into a friend suggesting to us that we participate in the weekly flea market in the Old City of Ramallah, which in retrospect was when Restored really came to be.

And so we got on a bus one day and headed to Nablus where there is a big flea market for old furniture. We were nervous while choosing pieces to restore because we didn’t know how people would view our work. Fortunately, however, our first flea market was quite the success. People were intrigued by what they saw, and were also surprised by the fact that recycling could be associated with items they perceived as beautiful and reliable.

This strong reaction prompted us to work harder the following weeks; we bought some new tools and challenged ourselves to work with different, and in some cases more complex, types of furniture. Within a few weeks, we had brought furniture from streets and flea markets all over Palestine, including ones in faraway cities such as Nablus, Hebron and Qalqilya, back to Ramallah to restore them and prove to people that there is an abundance of potential in what we do, and that it CAN be a viable alternative to buying new furniture. We had worked on chairs, stools, tables, desks, closets, couches, candlesticks and so much more.

Once the flea markets had come to a halt, we made the decision to carry on with Restored and turn it into its own entity. Restored felt bigger than just a booth at the flea market because of the strong reactions we’ve received from the community here; a lot of people started donating their old furniture instead of throwing it away, so that other people would enjoy it. Moreover, a lot of people who had seen pictures of our furniture on the internet and approached us couldn’t tell that it was recycled; they thought it was new, and were intrigued by the colors and designs that we’d chosen.


All of that showed us that people were opening up to recycling and the other concepts that Restored entails. As a result, we decided to leave our jobs and focus on fulfilling the full potential of Restored to become a pioneer in the recycled furniture business in Palestine. Since then, we’ve improved the quality of our tools, rented a small workshop on the outskirts of the city and started displaying our products on the internet to reach more people and strengthen the perception of recycling in Palestine.

And now at this point, we feel like we have given Restored everything we can as individuals, and now we need to take a big step in order to reap bigger results.


Why A Car Is The Next Step For Restored

Because the most essential part of our job is finding the pieces. This process, at times, takes more time than restoring the pieces and delivering them, combined. We either rely on finding furniture whose owners had disposed of, or by going to old furniture flea markets in other cities, such as Nablus, which is one hour away and Hebron, which is two hours away. Not only does that take up a lot of valuable time, but it also poses a big financial burden on Restored as transportation costs are quite high, particularly for vehicles capable of carrying the amounts of furniture we need. Whether it were for long distances, such as when we visit other cities, or even when we are in Ramallah and we find old furniture around, we still have to pay for the full service of the vehicle even if we were only moving one piece of furniture.

As a result, it has become vital for Restored to have a car in order for us to move up. Not only would we reduce costs significantly, but we’d also be able to pick up any piece of furniture lying around no matter where or when, and we’d have much more time to work on them and perfect them. Subsequently, Restored would become far more effective and productive in terms of normalizing and popularizing recycling in the Palestinian community, by reaching more people and leaving them all satisfied with the quality and affordability of our work.

Our aim is that people would no longer associate recycling with tin cans and plastic, but with the vibrant possibilities of restored furniture.

"This piece, for example, was used as a storage box for weapons by the Israeli army before its transformation into a jewelry box."


How A Car Would Help Restored Achieve Its Goals

A car would help Restored enter the next chapter and achieve many of its short-term and long-term goals, such as the following:

  • Reduces transportation and delivery costs significantly, therefore keeping our prices affordable.
  • Reduces time and effort involved in transporting the pieces, and thus increasing productivity.
  • Helps advertise Restored as the logo is going to be imprinted on the car.
  • Helps us invest more money into upgrading our tools and opening up a gallery to display our products in within the next year.


The Car Restored Needs

The car Restored needs is the 2010 Peugeot Partner. It offers enough cargo space (3.3 m3) to facilitate with the daily tasks of Restored, not to mention that it is very efficient when it comes to fuel consumption.

Car Specifications:

Year: 2010

Manufacturer: Peugeot

Price (After Tax): 15000$

Horsepower @ RPM: 75 @ 4000

Torque @ RPM: 185 @ 1500

Energy: Diesel

Top Speed: 93 mph

Cargo Area: 3.3 m3

Payload Capacity: 625-850kg


We Are Already Very Thankful, But…

...we would like to show our appreciation by gifting one of our unique candlesticks to anyone who makes a contribution of 100$.

Anyone who contributes 200$ or more will be gifted one of our specialty Restored stools, hand-restored with love and appreciation.

As for those who contribute 500$ or more, we would like to gift them uniquely-carved copperware from the heart of Palestine.


We would be honored to receive your support, as we are already overwhelmed by the support of our friends, peers and loyal customers, as well as the fact that there are many people out there who might get to know Restored for the first time through this campaign.

We hope that we are worth your time, and that our message travels across.
story_txt:
Who We Are
We are Ahmad Al-Jamal and Hussam Taha; the co-founders of
Restored. While we used to lead regular everyday jobs in the past; Ahmad was a
Junior CRM Executive at a logistics service company and Hussam was a Language
Assistant at a military training institute, we now focus all of our efforts on
Restored as on-going experiment to show the world and, more specifically, the
people of Palestine why color and spontaneity are the greatest recipe for
happiness.

What is Restored?
Or Why Palestine Needs Restored
Restored is all about recycling and renovation. We restore
old furniture by taking each piece on its own; by taking the necessary steps to
improve its quality, hone its beauty and possibly even re-invent it into
something unexpected. Moreover, it is also our priority to retain the legacy
and history of every piece by focusing on the small handmade details,
birthmarks if you will, that bookend the uniqueness of each one.
It all began last summer while we were moving into a new
apartment. We were aware of how expensive new furniture is, and so the idea of
restoring old furniture made sense to us while furnishing a home on a budget. We
created a tiny workshop for us at the apartment, used whatever tools we could
get our hands on and started experimenting. We were instantly hooked on the
possibilities, and couldn’t wait to make more and more. Our friends were
impressed too and some even asked us to restore their old furniture for them
before it all accumulated into a friend suggesting to us that we participate in
the weekly flea market in the Old City of Ramallah, which in retrospect was
when Restored really came to be.






And so we got on a bus one day and headed to Nablus where
there is a big flea market for old furniture. We were nervous while choosing pieces to restore because we didn’t know how people would
view our work. Fortunately, however, our first flea market was quite the
success. People were intrigued by what they saw, and were also surprised by the
fact that recycling could be associated with items they perceived as beautiful
and reliable.
This strong reaction prompted us to work harder the
following weeks; we bought some new tools and challenged ourselves to work with
different, and in some cases more complex, types of furniture. Within a few
weeks, we had brought furniture from streets and flea markets all over
Palestine, including ones in faraway cities such as Nablus, Hebron and
Qalqilya, back to Ramallah to restore them and prove to people that there is an
abundance of potential in what we do, and that it CAN be a viable alternative
to buying new furniture. We had worked on chairs, stools, tables, desks,
closets, couches, candlesticks and so much more.





Once the flea markets had come to a halt, we made the
decision to carry on with Restored and turn it into its own entity. Restored
felt bigger than just a booth at the flea market because of the strong
reactions we’ve received from the community here; a lot of people started
donating their old furniture instead of throwing it away, so that other people
would enjoy it. Moreover, a lot of people who had seen pictures of our
furniture on the internet and approached us couldn’t tell that it was recycled;
they thought it was new, and were intrigued by the colors and designs that we’d
chosen. 
All of that showed us that people were opening up to
recycling and the other concepts that Restored entails. As a result, we decided
to leave our jobs and focus on fulfilling the full potential of Restored to
become a pioneer in the recycled furniture business in Palestine. Since then,
we’ve improved the quality of our tools, rented a small workshop on the
outskirts of the city and started displaying our products on the internet to
reach more people and strengthen the perception of recycling in Palestine.
And now at this point, we feel like we have given Restored
everything we can as individuals, and now we need to take a big step in order
to reap bigger results.




Why A Car Is The
Next Step For RestoredBecause the most essential part of our job is finding the
pieces. This process, at times, takes more time than restoring the pieces and
delivering them, combined. We either rely on finding furniture whose owners had
disposed of, or by going to old furniture flea markets in other cities, such as
Nablus, which is one hour away and Hebron, which is two hours away. Not only
does that take up a lot of valuable time, but it also poses a big financial
burden on Restored as transportation costs are quite high, particularly for
vehicles capable of carrying the amounts of furniture we need. Whether it were
for long distances, such as when we visit other cities, or even when we are in
Ramallah and we find old furniture around, we still have to pay for the full
service of the vehicle even if we were only moving one piece of furniture.
As a result, it has become vital for Restored to have a car
in order for us to move up. Not only would we reduce costs significantly, but
we’d also be able to pick up any piece of furniture lying around no matter where
or when, and we’d have much more time to work on them and perfect them.
Subsequently, Restored would become far more effective and productive in terms
of normalizing and popularizing recycling in the Palestinian community, by
reaching more people and leaving them all satisfied with the quality and
affordability of our work.
Our aim is that people would no longer associate recycling
with tin cans and plastic, but with the vibrant possibilities of restored furniture."This piece, for example, was used as a storage box for weapons by the Israeli army before its transformation into a jewelry box."
How A Car Would Help Restored Achieve Its Goals
A car would help Restored enter the next chapter and achieve
many of its short-term and long-term goals, such as the following:

Reduces
     transportation and delivery costs significantly, therefore keeping our
     prices affordable.
Reduces
     time and effort involved in transporting the pieces, and thus increasing productivity.
Helps
     advertise Restored as the logo is going to be imprinted on the car.
Helps
     us invest more money into upgrading our tools and opening up a gallery to
     display our products in within the next year.

The Car Restored Needs
The car Restored needs is the 2010 Peugeot Partner. It
offers enough cargo space (3.3 m3) to facilitate with the daily tasks of
Restored, not to mention that it is very efficient when it comes to fuel
consumption.
Car Specifications:
Year: 2010
Manufacturer: Peugeot
Price (After Tax): 15000$
Horsepower @ RPM: 75 @ 4000
Torque @ RPM: 185 @ 1500
Energy: Diesel
Top Speed: 93 mph
Cargo Area: 3.3 m3
Payload Capacity: 625-850kg

would be honored to receive your support, as we are already overwhelmed by the
support of our friends, peers and loyal customers, as well as the fact that
there are many people out there who might get to know Restored for the first
time through this campaign.
We hope that we are worth your time, and that our message
travels across.

story:
Short Summary

We are passionate about creating independent living aids to help people with reduced strength and/or people living with a physical disability. Our product is designed to help make life easier and we are absolutely committed to quality and safety.

It is simple to use, insert the pin into the hole on a fuel dispensing nozzle, push the latch back and the bowser will automatically fill your vehicles fuel tank - check out the video above!

Why did we invent this? My aunt was diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis (MS) and has been living with this terrible disease for many years. Her condition has deteriorated and she has lost the ability to undertake many simple daily tasks, such as holding a cup of tea.

A few years ago she was talking to me about the simple things that become more difficult, such as filling your car with petrol. It would be some months before I found a solution, too late for my aunt, but not too late for others.

Your contribution will help us reach out and ensure people, who need our product most, get it. That could be your mum, dad, grandparent, an aunt or relative, a teenager, a friend, a partner or a stranger.

Help us help others.

What We Need

We have already come a long way, but need your help to go the last mile. 

Achievements to date include:

  1. Launch of Fuel Mate Pty Ltd in 2013
  2. Product Design - Completed in 2013
  3. Product Trial - Completed in 2014
  4. Initial order of 10,000 units - Delivered in 2014
  5. Product launch - Completed in 2014
  6. Time to grow and reach those that need our help - this part is up to you!

All funds raised will go to growing our market and ensuring we are structured for success, we need to get our product out there to help people now.

We have personally put tens of thousands of dollars into this product and are now reaching out for help. We hate asking, but the cause is too great to sit back on our laurels and let years of work go to waste.

What You Get

You get to help others, your family, a friend or a complete stranger. It might be someone who today, is fit and well, but tomorrow could be diagnosed with a disease or illness that impacts their daily life.

But... we recognise that might not be enough... 

If you give more than $25 you can choose your colour and we will send it to you for free, we will also donate $1 to Multiple Sclerosis (MS) Research Australia (http://www.msra.org.au/).

If you give more than $50 we will send you one of each of our colours (4 in total - blue, gold, metallic and red) for free, we will also donate $2 to Multiple Sclerosis (MS) Research Australia (http://www.msra.org.au/).

Every $25 will be spent this way:

$9.75 - Marketing this product and working with independent living aid organisations for distribution

$10.95 - Working capital to establish a manufacturing base in Queensland - let's keep the jobs in Australia - #buckingthechinatrend)

$1.00 - Donation to Multiple Sclerosis (MS) Research Australia (http://www.msra.org.au/).

$2.30 - 5% fee to Indiegogo and credit card fees

$1.00 - Administration - We keep this as low as possible but we do need to get a team mobilised

If we don't reach our entire goal we will keep doing what we are doing, fighting hard to deliver this amazing product to our customers and we will prioritise the funds raised to ensure we make the most from your contribution.

The Impact

The impact that a Fuel Mate can have may sound trivial, but one of our elderly volunteers who helped trial the original product, told us that for many years she goes to the same petrol station and waits for the attendant to come out to her.

Unfortunately, most petrol stations have 1 staff member on these days, so the wait was often long and that feeling in her stomach unbearable - not to mention that frustration of other users who wondered why she would stand and wait next to the bowser.

Sometimes, but not often, someone else will help her. She never asks though, as she doesn't want to be a 'burden' on others. The Fuel Mate has given her the ability to fill her own car up again, a feeling of empowerement that most cannot appreciate and hopefully will never need to. That is just one example of many.

Simple tasks that many take for granted each and every day can become one of the biggest daily challenges for others. The Fuel Mate means people can fill their own car up and maintain a quality of life and independence that we all deserve.

Risks & Challenges

We have already travelled a road of many challenges and risks. We have worked hard with the Office of Workplace Health and Safety as there were concerns about our product. If used properly and following our instructions (as demonstrated on the video) this product is safe and will achieve it's purpose. The Fuel Mate is legal.

If you use it and walk away from the bowser the attendant will automatically shut off the fuel bowser and it will make for an awkward conversation! Our product is not for the lazy but for those in need. If you are lazy and want to use it, be extra lazy and stay next to the bowser with your hand on the nozzle :)

Working with our stakeholders, including government, industry, consumer and media is the best way to tackle any concerns or challenges we face.Our website is www.fuelm8.com.au and details many of these FAQ's that we receive.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to contribute, think again.

Share this product with your family and friends. Just one person in your network will help us get to our target. This is a great cause and we need you to take just a few minutes to help someone with a lifetime of challenges.

story:
INTRODUCTION

Hello, thank you so much for visiting my campaign. My name is Andrew and I am finishing up two degrees, both fire service related in hopes to be a wildland firefighter. I am a freelance graphic designer and wildlife enthusiast. It was my graphic design skills that won the Michigan Beekeepers' Association’s “new logo” contest in early 2011. I was awarded a $100 certificate at Dadant bee supplier, which was used to purchase my very first beekeeping equipment.

THE UNFORTUNATE LOSS OF MY HONEY BEES

What started as a hobby quickly became a small successful business, producing hundreds of pounds of honey. Two additional hives were established in 2012. However, at the end of that year while on vacation, my vehicle that was recently purchased specifically to haul bee colonies and to store equipment was stolen. The vehicle was never reclaimed and my insurance didn’t cover theft. This unfortunate loss put my business far behind, and to make matters worse some of my colonies came into contact with pesticide that was later traced to a local gardener. I slowly lost my bees and a decision was made to close the business until I could recover.

I NEED YOUR HELP

It’s now 2016, four long years after my loss and I have yet been able to replace my beehives and honey bee colonies due to financial hardship. With the help of YOU I am hoping to at least get one complete beehive with a colony of bees and the tools and equipment needed to manage them.

Any financial support you provide will go toward:

  • Complete beehive = $140
  • Frames and foundation = $170
  • Package of bees = $115
  • Bee suit with gloves, hat and veil = $110
  • Bee smoker = $45
  • Bee brush and hive tool = $20

The estimate for all of this is $600, which could produce almost 100 pounds of honey. If we reach our first goal, a second goal will be opened where additional funds will go towards honey extracting and bottling equipment, branding, and more beehives.

THE BENEFITS OF BEEKEEPING

Not only do your funds help me restore my business, you are also helping our environment as honey bees play an essential role in pollination and fertilization of many crops. According to the United States Department of Agriculture, Bee pollination is responsible for 15 billion dollars in added crop value.

PERKS

Below are your rewards:

  • $1 – You will receive a personalized email thanking you!
  • $5 – Receive one tube of my high quality, petroleum-free lip balm! My lip balm is made with only the highest quality ingredients, including beeswax produced from the honey bees themselves!
  • $10 – Receive 1 lb of 100% natural, unheated and unfiltered wildflower honey! Honey will be extracted, bottled, and shipped to you fresh soon after harvest.
  • $10 – Receive a pack of 4 beeswax votive candles! All of my candles are hand-poured, clean burning, smoke and drip free and naturally scented, and burn for about 12-15 hours.
  • $30 – Receive all of the rewards above, plus a shoutout on my Twitter profile!
  • $25 –Advertise your business, website or product on my website with a banner for one full year!
  • $50 – Because I am an award-winning graphic designer, I will create a logo for you or your business with up to two revisions!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Tamarind Nott and in April 2015 I launched Mbiri Natural Skincare. Mbiri aims at supporting community enterprises through direct sourcing of natural ingredients for its products. I am Namibian and I spent most of my school holidays in the Namibian desert and I have always had a passion for the desert, its plants and the people.

Image: Myself and Kaveuruamo Mupurua, one of the harvesters.

My mother, through the NGO (IRDNC) she works for, started a project with the Himba women in Kaokoland where she was responsible for the research into the traditional use of indigenous plants and also investigated ways in which these resources could be sustainably utilized. The focus of her work was on the Commiphora wildii plant which naturally exudes a resin. The Himba women have used this resin for centuries in their traditional perfume and now they commercially harvest the resin and earn an income. After harvesting, the resin is sent to the Opuwo Processing Facility, which is owned by the harvesters, to extract the Namibian Myrrh essential oil. You can have a look at their website: www.scentsofnamibia.com

Image: A Himba women harvesting Omumbiri resin.

Mbiri was launched to support this enterprise. Mbiri buys the essential oil directly from the factory and uses it in every product. This means Mbiri products create a demand for the oil and so more resin needs to be harvested, thereby supporting the viability of the community enterprise. The resource is abundant and the harvesting practices ensure its sustainability. My passion for this desert and its people motivated me to create a 100% natural skincare range that supports this enterprise. The resin is traditionally known as Omumbiri, hence the name Mbiri. 

Image: The Mbiri products.

Mbiri now needs to expand the range to further support the project. However there are costs attached to this - packaging, formulations, design, endorsements and of course purchasing the raw ingredients as well as manufacturing. A larger range of Mbiri products can have a bigger impact in this competitive industry and in turn generate more income.

Image: Namibian Myrrh resin.

The community enterprise is struggling to create a big enough demand for the essential oil. Without demand they cannot reach the maximum production capacity, this is why Mbiri needs to purchase more oil. With your contribution Mbiri will be able to do this and in turn you will be supporting these Namibian communities. 

Image: Kata Tjivinda holding one of the Mbiri products. She was one of the very first harvesters involved in the Omumbiri project.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Mbiri is hoping to raise USD10 000 to expand the range and support the community factory by giving them half of the contributions from this campaign. The expansion will introduce two new products, a body oil and a hair oil. This product development will include the costs of formulations, packaging design, purchasing packaging including labels, buying raw ingredients, paying for endorsements and of course manufacturing. The money will be used to buy Namibian Myrrh oil from the community factory. Of every dollar that is contributed to this campaign, USD0.50 will be given to the community owned facility. The community factory needs this money to pay harvesters and to cover their operational costs. This means that if all funds are raised Mbiri will give the facility USD5000.

Image: Staff members at the community owned processing facility with baskets of Omumbiri resin. (Left: Ngavekare Tjiraso  Right: Jeckey Kasaona)
  • Every person that contributes to this campaign will receive proof of the funds being given to the community facility and will also be given recognition on the Mbiri Facebook page and website. The real perk about this campaign is the opportunity to support a community owned factory, the harvesters and their incredible story.
  • Without the full funding Mbiri will not be able to expand the range which is imperative in generating a successful skincare range. 

The Impact

  • Your contribution will support a business that supports communities. The harvesters harvest during the driest time of the year as this is when the resin is naturally exuded. This means they earn an income during times when there is a shortage of food. Women use the money earned from harvesting to buy food and access healthcare. The portion of the money raised that will be donated to the community owned processing facility will be used to increase the intake of resin during the next harvest season. This means that income earned by households involved in harvesting activities will be greater and make a significant contribution to the food security of these communities who are currently affected by the extreme drought conditions. 

Image: Two Himba women cooking at a fire at their homestead in Puros
  • Mbiri was launched in April 2015 and has seen great interest in the products thus far, however with a small range Mbiri's reach is limited. By creating two more products Mbiri can have a larger impact on sales and therefore purchase more oil from the community factory.
  • Growing up with this community project has engrained a passion in me for Namibia and its people. With your support we can make this community enterprise viable and bring this story to the world.

Image: Myself and the staff members at the community owned factory in Opuwo. From left to right: Jeckey Kasaona, Capacity Tjivinda, Me, Ellie Kozohura

Risks & Challenges

  • The skincare industry is highly competitive and Mbiri faces the challenge of squeezing into this market. However with a great story and 100% natural ingredients there is a definitive gap for Mbiri. People want to buy a story not just a product, and with people becoming more conscious of what they use on their skin Mbiri provides them with a safe and natural product. Mbiri is also registered with The Vegan Society and endorsed by Beauty Without Cruelty, as well as being an accredited partner of Phytotrade Africa, which a fair-trade initiative. The story of Namibia will intrigue people and create curiosity. Mbiri only consists of 4 products and it is already on shelves in Namibia and South Africa. There is a definitive interest in the product, but now, with your help, Mbiri can make an even bigger impact. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot make a contribution please share this story with friends and family to get the word out there. Mbiri is about Africa and its communities so please assist me in telling their stories.

Also please follow Mbiri on Facebook and Instagram:

https://www.facebook.com/mbirinaturalskincare/

https://www.instagram.com/mbiri_natural_skincare/

Lets change the world one product at a time!

Image: Harvesters walking into the mountains to collect Omumbiri resin
story_txt:
Short Summary My name is Tamarind Nott and in April 2015 I launched Mbiri Natural Skincare. Mbiri aims at supporting community enterprises through direct sourcing of natural ingredients for its products. I am Namibian and I spent most of my school holidays in the Namibian desert and I have always had a passion for the desert, its plants and the people.

Image: Myself and Kaveuruamo Mupurua, one of the harvesters.
My mother, through the NGO (IRDNC) she works for, started a project with the Himba women in Kaokoland where she was responsible for the research into the traditional use of indigenous plants and also investigated ways in which these resources could be sustainably utilized. The focus of her work was on the Commiphora wildii plant which naturally exudes a resin. The Himba women have used this resin for centuries in their traditional perfume and now they commercially harvest the resin and earn an income. After harvesting, the resin is sent to the Opuwo Processing Facility, which is owned by the harvesters, to extract the Namibian Myrrh essential oil. You can have a look at their website: www.scentsofnamibia.com



Image: A Himba women harvesting Omumbiri resin.
Mbiri was launched to support this enterprise. Mbiri buys the essential oil directly from the factory and uses it in every product. This means Mbiri products create a demand for the oil and so more resin needs to be harvested, thereby supporting the viability of the community enterprise. The resource is abundant and the harvesting practices ensure its sustainability. My passion for this desert and its people motivated me to create a 100% natural skincare range that supports this enterprise. The resin is traditionally known as Omumbiri, hence the name Mbiri. 



Image: The Mbiri products.
Mbiri now needs to expand the range to further support the project. However there are costs attached to this - packaging, formulations, design, endorsements and of course purchasing the raw ingredients as well as manufacturing. A larger range of Mbiri products can have a bigger impact in this competitive industry and in turn generate more income.


Image: Namibian Myrrh resin.

The community enterprise is struggling to create a big enough demand for the essential oil. Without demand they cannot reach the maximum production capacity, this is why Mbiri needs to purchase more oil. With your contribution Mbiri will be able to do this and in turn you will be supporting these Namibian communities. 



Image: Kata Tjivinda holding one of the Mbiri products. She was one of the very first harvesters involved in the Omumbiri project.
  What We Need & What You Get 
Mbiri is hoping to raise USD10 000 to expand the range and support the community factory by giving them half of the contributions from this campaign. The expansion will introduce two new products, a body oil and a hair oil. This product development will include the costs of formulations, packaging design, purchasing packaging including labels, buying raw ingredients, paying for endorsements and of course manufacturing. The money will be used to buy Namibian Myrrh oil from the community factory. Of every dollar that is contributed to this campaign, USD0.50 will be given to the community owned facility. The community factory needs this money to pay harvesters and to cover their operational costs. This means that if all funds are raised Mbiri will give the facility USD5000.



Image: Staff members at the community owned processing facility with baskets of Omumbiri resin. (Left: Ngavekare Tjiraso  Right: Jeckey Kasaona)

 Every person that contributes to this campaign will receive proof of the funds being given to the community facility and will also be given recognition on the Mbiri Facebook page and website. The real perk about this campaign is the opportunity to support a community owned factory, the harvesters and their incredible story. Without the full funding Mbiri will not be able to expand the range which is imperative in generating a successful skincare range.     The Impact  Your contribution will support a business that supports communities. The harvesters harvest during the driest time of the year as this is when the resin is naturally exuded. This means they earn an income during times when there is a shortage of food. Women use the money earned from harvesting to buy food and access healthcare. The portion of the money raised that will be donated to the community owned processing facility will be used to increase the intake of resin during the next harvest season. This means that income earned by households involved in harvesting activities will be greater and make a significant contribution to the food security of these communities who are currently affected by the extreme drought conditions. 



Image: Two Himba women cooking at a fire at their homestead in Puros

 Mbiri was launched in April 2015 and has seen great interest in the products thus far, however with a small range Mbiri's reach is limited. By creating two more products Mbiri can have a larger impact on sales and therefore purchase more oil from the community factory. Growing up with this community project has engrained a passion in me for Namibia and its people. With your support we can make this community enterprise viable and bring this story to the world. 


Image: Myself and the staff members at the community owned factory in Opuwo. From left to right: Jeckey Kasaona, Capacity Tjivinda, Me, Ellie Kozohura
   Risks & Challenges  The skincare industry is highly competitive and Mbiri faces the challenge of squeezing into this market. However with a great story and 100% natural ingredients there is a definitive gap for Mbiri. People want to buy a story not just a product, and with people becoming more conscious of what they use on their skin Mbiri provides them with a safe and natural product. Mbiri is also registered with The Vegan Society and endorsed by Beauty Without Cruelty, as well as being an accredited partner of Phytotrade Africa, which a fair-trade initiative. The story of Namibia will intrigue people and create curiosity. Mbiri only consists of 4 products and it is already on shelves in Namibia and South Africa. There is a definitive interest in the product, but now, with your help, Mbiri can make an even bigger impact.     Other Ways You Can Help If you cannot make a contribution please share this story with friends and family to get the word out there. Mbiri is about Africa and its communities so please assist me in telling their stories.
Also please follow Mbiri on Facebook and Instagram:
https://www.facebook.com/mbirinaturalskincare/
https://www.instagram.com/mbiri_natural_skincare/  Lets change the world one product at a time!Image: Harvesters walking into the mountains to collect Omumbiri resin

story:
Short Summary

Miguel, the CEO, is a private pilot and has always loved flying. 

By time he was researching for the most economic way to fly, he realized that small aircraft owners and operators have their aircraft in the hangar most of the time, still having to pay expensive fixed costs of maintenance and parking every year.

FlyPilot consists in an online platform where you can request on-demand planes for you to fly wherever you want, with no need to book weeks in advance and with short waiting times, all in the privacy of a private plane.

If you are a pilot, you can also rent the planes in our platform, much easier than ever.

What We Need & What You Get

We are building our first working prototype and we already have a few aircraft listed to start making flights, all based in Lisbon, Portugal.

We are currently working with our personal funds, so in order for us to work at full-time and launch our business in full we need additional funding to invest in the website development and to operate for at least 2 years. We predict to have profit from the 3rd year (2018).

To do so, we need a 12 month runway (working capital) to pay for operating expenses and to hire employees until we get investors on board.

Funding needed for:

- programmer and designer;

- 2 operating staff;

- mobile app development (outsourced);

- online advertising (Google Ads, Facebook, Twitter, etc.);

- office space;

- founders full-time salary;

- telecomunications (phones, helpdesk);

- server and software tools;

- accounting and management support;

If we do not reach our funding goal, we will use the funding gathered to invest and operate as much as possible, and work to obtain funding from other sources until we get the remaining value.

Depending on how much is offered, backers can get credits to rent airplanes on our website, if it is available at the backer's location.

The Impact

We want to revolutionize the way people travel, by introducing small aircraft charters and become the first private airline in the world without airplanes.

Our project will introduce a new way of travelling, bringing awareness to an area of aviation that is not well know by the general public.

It also will make a big difference in the lives of private pilots and student pilots, working their way to their commercial license, being that it will give them a wide variety of aircraft and prices to choose from, offering an easy and simple solution to rent aircraft.

Risks & Challenges

We have identified the following challenges that we'll likely face:

- the existence of indirect competitors, offering different solutions to the same problem (skyuber.com, wingly.io, coavmi.com, openairplane.com)

We have the following solutions thought out:

- create a solid value proposition to customers, creating a brand awareness to make our customers trust in FlyPilot and use it for their private flights.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our startup on social networks!

Alchemy is about possibility, above all.  With a bit of fire and salt, some bottled secrets, and songs from the soil, we hope to conjure foods long forgotten but once revered, as well as those never dreamed of but quietly awaited.  Our inspiration lies in the alchemists of old, those kitchen conjurers that built their cultures from food and sought the transformative through eating. With our hearts planted firmly in this ancient space, our heads occupy the chaos of the experimental. We are pastoral anthropologists and culinary renegades, archaic revivalists and Epicurean expeditionaries. An awakening through elemental eating is our mission.

Alchemy is now ready to fully explore the future of possibility. Your donations will go toward funding more ambitious pop-up dinners, tools of the trade, kitchen space rental, permits and certifications needed to sell at Argus Farm Stop, and at some point in the next year, the Ann Arbor Farmers Market. Alchemy will continue with or without these additional pieces falling into place, but with them, we will be even better. Rather than offer a place where people merely sit and eat. We want people "to sit at that table and be sick with longing."

story:
Introducing FouA.

 

What the word FOUA stand for? 

Focus on your art.

What's the meaning of it? 

 

Craft greatness. Share with love. Empowered through perfections.

 

FouA is a prototype or minimum viable product?

We're already live www.FouA.co  and this release is a minimum viable product. Allowing you to do everything except the APP store and the pages.

 

 

 

So What is FouA?

 

FouA is a online social network that empowers your purpose in life. But it's a lot more than that. We have designed such a platform that provides great experience in a very beautiful way. In simple terms, FouA is the platform for every person that has a dream to achieve. We make dreams a reality through the technology we have built within FouA such as SIGNAS, WidFO, Filtering, Interest system, Advertising system and privacy.
A social media platform for people to achieve their full potential in life.

 

  • A community for people with purpose.
    People to be empowered and motivated. 
  • We make dreams a reality
  • Businesses to expand 
  • Startups to be funded
  • Artists to be sponsored
  • Supporting humanitarian causes
  • Advertisements to be engaged
  • Focused through interests
  • Privacy restored: No third-party access/No more monitoring.

 

 

What makes FouA unique?

FouA gives the possibilities to let you do things that were never possible before. A single interaction can filter all the noise from your timelines.

Let's you stay focused on the things that your interested in from filtering posts and timelines to achieving greatness. Bringing you closer to your loved ones and allowing you to connect with people according to your interest. Advanced security. And that’s just the beginning.

 

 

 

The story of Foua.

5 Years into 5 Minutes.

Sneak of FouA. Live

 

 

 

What I can do with it?

So many amazing things! Let me give you a few examples...

Beautiful Profiles

 

Your own profile
 

Visiting other people profiles
 

Signa pages.

Perfections

 

Building recognition and respect through perfections.
Perfections can be collected through posts you share. High quality posts earn a lot perfections than low quality ones. Your network empowers you with perfections.
It's almost like your online CV or recommendations to land your dream job or get hired for a gig. Perfections cannot be undone. For celebrities it's the true recognition in the digital world.

 

Discover

 

 

 

For the first time

We're letting people worldwide enjoy the best quality content based on their actions and interests. Only with FouA. Set your interests and get served. Purify as you go.

 

Walls + Adding contacts

You no longer have to mix your contacts. We have designed a beautiful way to keep you focused on the contact lists that you wish to stay in the loop with. Family, Friends, Professionals and Followings. Each wall is separated from one another to keep you focused. Yet they don't feel separated. 
 

Filtering your posts

 

You can now filter your posts. Instead of scrolling over dozens of posts to look for the type of content that you wish to see. We have designed a beautiful way of filtering your post through type of content that you wish to see. Updates, Quotes, Pictures, Sound, Videos and Promoted.
 

Private comments 

Not only you can post normal comments BUT you can also post private comments. It helps to get in touch with people more privately , even collaborate to create beautiful things or even get gigs.
 

Following + Followers

 

You can also follow people just like any other social media and you can favourite them so you can receive notifications once they publish something new. 

Promoting

You can now interact with your audience much faster and target new potential customers based on their interests. Everything will be related. Interest based advertisements. Again for the first time. No Cookies usage. 

Focus Points = FC

 

Earning Focus Points:
Through the interaction that you do within FouA. You'll be collecting Focus Points constantly. Sharing posts,reposting, sharing outside of FouA and much more. A great empowerment tool and can be used for marketing too.
Using Focus Points:
Focus points can be used to promote your posts, donated to SIGNA pages to make their dream a reality, can be used to purchase goods in the future and much more.

Best quality content matters to us.
That's why we have kept it exclusive. VIP Invitations only.  
  • No more spamming
  • No Hate speech
  • NO Political hatred 
  • No Racism
  • No Religion hatred
  • No Bullying
  • No Fake accounts
  • No Stalking
  • No Sexual harassments  
These are the simple rules of our community. Break them and you're banned forever from every project we're involved in or have created.
We want FouA. to be a safe home for the people that use it.
We do not allow any third-party access to our data. We do not collect cookies except at the login process because it is required. We're trying to figure out to get around it to avoid using cookies.



 
 

Introducing SIGNAS. 

Just like a page,site or a blog but it is much better.

You've got to focus on the most important thing in your life and we do the rest for you. Once you generate enough interest to your sign from your audience.(By donating focus points) That's where we come in to invest, sponsor, empower, expand, grow or any thing needed to keep you moving forward.
 
  • We're Investors
  • We're Risk Takers
  • We're Mentors
  • We're Leaders
  • We're Shifting the world to a better place
  • We're Teachers
  • We're Knowledge seekers
  • We're Inventors
  • We're Hardcore entrepreneurs
  • We're Designers
  • We're Artists

 

 

Introducing WIDFO APPS. 

WidFo APPS takes the third of our platform design. This is something you can fully customize. You can select the apps that you need based on your needs and than just add them. Something like plugin and widgets but this is the next thing.


 

    Perks

    Get early access to FouA. get your VIP invitation and 300 VIP invitations to give away.

     

    A side from Joining our Platform. We're also have added a live support, empowerment, motivation, marketing, advertising, collaborations, ideas, designers, developers and entrepreneurship on slack.

     

    You're  helping us make this project happen! Thank You!

    You can purchase FouA. T-Shirt and add a personalized short text to it. It can be anything awesome. You're also helping us make this project happen! Thank You!

     

    The FouA. Movement. *THE WAKE UP CALL* to the young youth. 

    We started interviewing people around the world to learn about their struggles and their experiences in life. From each interview, We will record a poetic video as inspiration from the person that we have interviewed and We add their inspirational story to The lives of FouA. You're also helping us make this project happen! Thank You!

     

    The Story of FouA. How Tarek Besbes made it this far after all the drama and shh** that went down. From people wanting to steal the project to not having a cent to buy food to realizing a new goals and achieving  greatness from within.

    You're about to get the story of 5 Years in your hands. Drama - Inspirational - Motivational - Even Romance included

    If you're a business owner this is just perfect for you. We create a personalized API system to fit your business needs to take it to the next level.

    If you're a developer or a designer this is the next level to go forward. Build great APP and start selling them in our FOUA STORE  WIDFO. You'll get a early verification to be in a early market.
    ONLY Web development languages are supported at the moment. We also can create private API's for your business. Check Above.

    Being part of something is what we all want. Being remembered. This is the right Perk of making something bigger than us happen and we all part of it. You get all the benefits of being a Founder except companies shares. In The future we will give you company shares when we go public.

    This my favourite one. Honestly. We have dreamed of such thing. Best thing about it is that. The time will only be counting once we release the official launch of FouA. Before that is free extra advertisements. 

    LEOSHH Limited design. High quality T-Shirts. Hand made. Worldwide only 150 T-Shirts.

    FouRSHH Limited design. High quality T-Shirts. Hand made. Worldwide only 150 T-Shirts.

    Risks and Challenges

    As entreprenuer and a artist, I found myself looking for cummunities to raise funds for my startup, build ideas, connect with like-minded people or land a sponsorship for my dancing video. It was so hard to find such thing that I can use to advance as entreprenuer and artist but there's a lot of communities out there and the problem is. 

    • They're not active or very slow at responding.
    • Way too much spamming.
    • No luck to raise funds.
    • No place for motivation except youtube videos.
    • Self-Centered communities.
    I wanted to build a place where I can connect with the people I love and at the same time focus on the most important things in my life. All at once. This time being inspired and motivated at all times. The idea of Signas is letting people build whatever they have in mind and once they collect enough interest from their audience. FouA will do everything possible to make it a reality.

    I have risked 5 years of my life building FouA. and I have reached this far. I will continue even I fail again but I will make it no matter what it takes.

    It's not easy market out there and top all of this; I am just a little solo kid against the big giant social media's but I guess the product is what sperates one another. 


    Other Ways You Can Help
    • Let's make some noise about FouA.
      Go to the top of this page and share it to your social media accounts! Thank you! <3
    • Don't forget to share the love! Means a lot!  <3

I will continue even I fail again but I will make it no matter what it takes.It's not easy market out there and top all of this; I am just a little solo kid against the big giant social media's but I guess the product is what sperates one another. Other Ways You Can Help



Let's make some noise about FouA.Go to the top of this page and share it to your social media accounts! Thank you! <3

Don't forget to share the love! Means a lot!  <3

story:
What is Trybo?

What if we told you that meeting new people no longer means waiting for the right time or occasion? What if you had the power to meet someone new–someone who has shared interests, hobbies and ideals, and someone who can be from anywhere around the world–at the tip of your fingers.

Trybo can make that possible.

Trybo is a social networking application that allows a user to meet new people from all around the world who have something in common. It uses location services and filters to put you in touch with new people from anywhere on the planet. Trybo will make it possible for you to explore the world, learn new languages, learn about new cultures, see the world through new perspectives, and do it all by meeting new people that have similar interests as you do. 

When opening Trybo for the first time, users will be prompted to sign in with Facebook accounts. Once signed in, the user will be prompted to give permission to use location services (please do keep in mind that this application will not work without location services). The application will take data such as your name, age, gender, and Facebook Page likes; However, their are some details that the user will have to fill in themselves.

The Explore Filter will be the next aspect of the application the user will set up:

In this tab, users will be allowed to set filters for the people they want to meet. For example, if a user wants to meet someone interested in business, economics, soccer, who resides in India and speaks English as well as French and Hindi, he would simply set the filters above and save the settings. Similar to our Explore Filters, we also have Request Filters, which are just slightly more basic and only involve filtering by the gender, age and the spoken language. These filters will control who you can see and who can see your profile, respectively. To expand, the explore function will then search for other users as per the filter settings and provide the user with a list of other people - on the Explore Page - who could potentially be added to the Tribe. 

If the user is interested in talking to the person described on the explore page, he can simply click the check mark on the image, or he can even double click on the page itself to accept. If not, the user can keep scrolling until he finds someone that he likes. Now, if the user sends a request and it gets accepted, then the user who accepted the request is automatically added to the “My Tribe” Page:

On this page, the user can keep track of all the friends he has made using Trybo. At any point in time, they can click on any of the user profile icons and text them via wifi. 

Our Vision

The advent of the internet has broken down the geographical barriers of our planet and has revolutionized communication. We hope to take the communication boom one step further by creating an experience where the user truly gets to connect to people of different cultures and backgrounds. Through the aim of providing an immersive experience in global communities around the world, we hope that people will inspire each other to change the world. 

Our Mission

We believe the best way to make a change in the world is to inspire people around us to join us towards the same goal. Our mission is to do everything we can to make the biggest possible change in the world and inspire the world to do the same. 

Our role

Don’t get us wrong, our users won’t be the only ones doing something for a better tomorrow. While our primary role is to provide the users with the best possible experience, we do have another main role: to use a portion of our revenue to help solve the multitude of problems we are faced with today. From our very first profit to every following profit stream, we are always going to put 50% of the cash into savings so that one day, we will be able to open up our own development fund. This fund will use Trybo resources to help humanity in the battles against poverty, hunger, preventable diseases, illiteracy and more. Today, many corporations sometimes deviate from their focus of feeding consumers and give up some portions of their profit to aid certain causes or to play a role in solving certain problems. Trybo is going to be a corporation that will be dedicated to making change across our planet. 

Why do we need more funds?

The seed money we received is just enough for us to create our application; however, we are going to need more funds to maintain servers and for an international trademark as Trybo is going global from day 1. As of right now, we have no funds left to advertise our application. 

We believe our idea is not only changing the way people connect themselves with one another, like Instagram did, but we are going to work towards the betterment of the world. We believe people will see the value in that, and therefore we can make it without the large funds that some start-ups receive. We will spend $1,000 for the international trademark, $2,000 for our servers and anything on top of that will be used in advertisement to start the fire we need to spread Trybo throughout the world. 

With all of that said, we’d like to ask you to help us inspire the world just like Victor inspired us to act. We are giving our blood, sweat and tears so Trybo can be a tool that gives people a unique and perhaps even an inspirational experience, and we believe that if you believe in what we believe, you could make a difference in the world by helping us do so. Also, please take note that we are college students trying to make a difference, so we do not have much to offer in our rewards, but if you want to see truly the best return on investment (a better, more unified and inspired tomorrow), then we would highly appreciate your funding. Thank you for your time and consideration. 

Risks and challenges

Currently, our application is in the development phase and will be coming out on the first of August. We are going to need crowd money for advertising our application. The goal of this application is to allow users to meet people from all over the world: so our main challenge is going to be getting a user database that is well spread around the world. Although, I feel that my partner and I are well suited to deal with that challenge as we are both from different continents and have lived abroad, attending international schools. We have our friends and family excited about this application.  We even have ambassadors from all over the world who are willing to help us out with marketing and spread the word. While getting a diverse user database is going to prove to be a challenge, it will be a challenge taken head on from the day one of launching the application, provided we secure the funds we need from Indiegogo.  Money raised will make it easier for us to overcome this challenge and turn Trybo into the next big social networking name.

Other Ways in Which you can help: We have just created our Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/pages/Trybo/3813836120...): If you really like the concept of Trybo, please like our page and spread the news of Trybo through your community to help us reach our fundraising goal!

story:
Short Summary

Hello my name is Roy Hadad and my brother Eliran's synagogue suffered a tragic and unfortunate fire. I am currently seeking help from all walks of life in order to help him rebuild his prized synagogue and re enable the citizens of Montreal the opportunity to visit an astounding community center.

What We Need

We are looking for monetary donations or in-kind. We are accepting whatever we can in order to continue operations at our center. If you would like to offer aid as a service, please contact us as soon as possible. We would also appreciate monetary donations in order for us to pay for the costs.

Risks & Challenges

Fortunately no major scripts or structural damage was reported. You can find a short excerpt on the Montreal Gazette in the following link: http://montrealgazette.com/news/local-news/fire-causes-minor-damages-at-st-laurent-synagogue

Our challenge at the moment is great. We are looking to clean out the damaged furniture and walls. We are also looking to clean, fix and pretty much restore the center to it's former state. 


Here's a quick look into the damages that occured: 



Please consider our request for aid wisely. We are different from other centers in that sense that membership is free and will always be. We are always looking to motivate and reinvigorate the spiritual lives of individuals. We offer informative sessions about Judaism. We hold weekly dinners for underprivileged individuals. We always invite anyone able to join us on holidays free of cost.


Help us today, G-D bless.

story:
Support our Families!

Behavior Pathways is an Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) service provider in Lexington, Kentucky.  Michael Liby (Owner)is graduating with a Master's degree in ABA in July and is working towards board certification.  Allie Zeller (Clinical Director, Practice Manager) is a licensed, Board Certified Behavior Analyst. Together, along with our staff, we have years of experience working with children with disabilities including autism spectrum disorder (ASD) and are excited to continue this journey. We need your help in making this start-up successful so we can continue to serve the families that are in need. 

                                                    

ABA services teach:

  • Communication skills (eye contact, speaking skills, listening skills)
  • Academic Skills (reading, writing, and math skills)
  • Functional Living Skills (washing hands, brushing teeth, and making food)
  • Motor Skills (imitation, gross and fine motor, and appropriate play skills) 

What We Need 

This funding will go toward the start-up costs of the business including a clinic, materials, and initial operating costs. 

                                                

  • Our staff are highly skilled behavior therapists who have outstanding rapport with our clients and their families.
  • A clinic will help us to keep these children in ABA services on a daily basis and continue to improve their daily lives. 
  • If our goal is not reached, what is donated will provide for services for these children in the month of July as the families transition to other service providers.

The Impact

Reaching our goal means that our entire day can be devoted to these exceptional children (ages 2 - 18).  Families will have the ability to bring their child into an environment that encourages learning and behavioral change.

  • Many children with ASD start out with little or no verbal behavior and learn in a very different way than typical children.
  • Children with ASD display many challenging behaviors, but they can learn to communicate appropriately and replace these behaviors.
  • We currently have a wonderful group of families who have put their trust in us.  It has been a real blessing to work with such devoted parents and amazing children.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to donate, but you can contribute immensely simply by sharing our story with your friends and families. 

  • Love Facebook? Post this campaign on your Facebook page, and share it with your email contacts.
  • Have school materials lying around? Let us know, we are constantly using pencils, paper, crayons, markers, puzzles, etc. that we supply ourselves.
  • Children's Furniture?  We are in need of children's tables and chairs as well.  If you have some that are no longer needed, we would be happy to accept them.

story:
What's this all about?

Kingfisher Journeys vision is to create employment in rural Africa by bringing sea kayaking to Lake Kivu and open canoeing to the rivers of Rwanda.

A completely new quality activity for visitors to this country, world-class sea kayaking on Lake Kivu will enable people to see and explore the tranquil waters of this jewel of a lake in a new and exciting way. Likewise, journeying gently along one of Rwanda’s meandering, gentle rivers amongst the thousand hills for which the country is famous, will provide a new perspective its lush interior.

In addition to creating new jobs, these activities will increase the time that tourists spend in rural locations and so they will significantly add to the revenue earned by many nearby communities.

It cannot be overstated how transformational this revenue will be for rural people, many of whom today earn less than a dollar a day.

By joining Kingfisher Journeys, tourists will also stay in Rwanda longer, creating new or additional demand for lodges, hotels and other businesses and thus contribute to the economic growth of this optimistic but still relatively poor country.

Perfectly aligning itself as an eco-tour operator, Kingfisher Journeys will be a socially and environmentally responsible company. As a social enterprise, it will make positive contributions to local communities, whilst its impact on the natural environment will be practically zero.  We have a detailed Business Plan that explains how we’re going to make it happen, but a summary is reproduced here.

Who's behind this?

Steve Venton, the entrepreneur who is setting up kingfisher Journeys is an experienced British Canoe Union level 2 coach and a 5-star sea kayak and white water leader - the highest level of leader qualification – as well as being a 3-star canoeist. He has 19 years experience of paddling on rivers and the sea all over the world and has been a leader on several canoe expeditions such as on the Amazon in Peru in 2012.

Having coached many people over the years he will train local guides in how apply modern paddle skills on the lakes and rivers of Rwanda. Combining their local knowledge with Steve's expertise, they will learn how to lead journeys and ensure that all are run enjoyably and safely.

However, Steve is also an experienced business analyst who also holds an MBA in sustainable business. Steve therefore has not only the practical skills to set up Kingfisher Journeys but also the business knowledge to ensure that it succeeds.

He's in Rwanda with his wife for around two years whilst she delivers a project for Meteo Rwanda, the local weather forecasting and meteorological organisation. When this time is up, he intends to leave the company to be run by a Rwandan management team with well‑trained local guides and leaders in place to carry on Kingfisher Journeys vision for sea kayaking and canoeing in their own country. 

All Kingfisher Journeys needs is:

  • A small injection of funding - just US$10,000 (GBP £6,500) - to pay for shipping a container to Rwanda and clearing it through customs;* and 
  • The donaton of some more equipment so we can be truly effective from day 1.
*If we raise more than our target we will buy the equipment that we need in the UK rather than relying on donations of used kit.

What will we achieve?

Then our legacy will be that in a few years time there could be many professional canoe and kayak guides leading journeys on the lakes and rivers of Rwanda. 

The fundamental purpose of Kingfisher Journeys is to create new opportunities for local Rwandan people, many millions of whom still live in poverty. By developing the sustainable, low impact use of Lake Kivu and some of Rwanda’s rivers, Kingfisher Journeys will provide a new source of income that will benefit numerous local communities.

Furthermore, by enabling tourists to travel slowly, Kingfisher Journeys will bring them – and their spending power – to new places and to people that would otherwise have little or no opportunity to engage with visitors to their country.

We will overcome huge challenges!

To get started, there is only a relatively small financial commitment needed, so the most significant risk is the loss that could be incurred if we thought it too hard to try.

However, there are many significant risks that could thwart this proposal. Creating any business from scratch is very hard whilst creating a successful business in Africa is harder still. Most of these will only become apparent once the company begins to test its ability to deliver.

However, the idea of sea kayaking and canoeing in Rwanda seems to generate an infectious enthusiasm amongst almost everyone who hears of this plan. As the suggestion is shared more widely, both supporting and detracting advice will be taken on board and acted upon. Therefore, rather than try to document a detailed risk analysis here, which is bound to be incomplete, Kingfisher Journeys will set off with the idea that it will succeed and do everything that it can to ensure that it does. It will engage with those who share this vision.


You can be part of this vision!

You can help if you are in the UK:

Please donate whatever equipment you have available. It will be going to a good home whether it is a small item like a whistle or a large one like a used sea kayak or canoe. Please see our Equipment page for a list of what we need.

You can help if you are in Rwanda:

We are seeking partners in Rwanda who can help provide logistical support, hotels from which to base our operations and investors to help develop the remarkable opportunity of kayaking and canoeing in Rwanda. If you are interested in partnering with us, please get in contact and we will arrange to come and see you.

You can help if you are anywhere in the world:

Whether you can help financially or not, please leave us a message on our Facebook page and then share this idea far and wide.

With your help can succeed and we will make a difference for the people of Rwanda!

Thank you!

We are seeking partners in Rwanda who can help provide logistical support, hotels from which to base our operations and investors to help develop the remarkable opportunity of kayaking and canoeing in Rwanda. If you are interested in partnering with us, please get in contact and we will arrange to come and see you.
You can help if you are anywhere in the world:
Whether you can help financially or not, please leave us a message on our Facebook page and then share this idea far and wide.
With your help can succeed and we will make a difference for the people of Rwanda!
Thank you!

story:
To Watch Our Other Video's Click On The Gallery Tab Above.


NEW BONUS:

5 x $1000.00 CASH PRIZES to be WON for first 10,000 people who DONATE $5/more to our CAMPAIGN Don't miss out!
 

Company Overview

Picture an online world where everyone contributes to help everyone including themselves, this is what we are creating. The first part of the platform will be designed so that individuals can request money that they need by posting an ad and asking for it. The best part about asking us for money is that users will never be asked to pay it back. (Think of this as an online lottery but instead of one person winning thousands well benefit each month) Users will pay small monthly fee (to buy their ticket so to speak) and ads will be paid out on a first come first serve basis.

The second part of the platform will be an online auction where users can start or run their existing business at a fraction of the cost of the leaders in the industry. The fees for this will be set up as a monthly subscription with NO final value or posting fees saving users tons of money. A percentage of the revenue raised from Auction users will also be allocated to pay to the users requesting money.
 
The payouts will be set up on a first come first serve basis. We will payout peoples request that are in the queue based on the date it was requested. Once we have distributed all the available funds for that month the payouts will carry over until the following month until we generate more funds.


Where is the money going to come from?

The money that will be paid to users will come from several sources such as monthly subscriptions, auction module revenue, advertising revenue, donations from corporations and sponsorship's, etc.

When users post an ad requesting money from us they will commit to a minimum monthly donation of $5.00 which at the end of the month will be distributed to the users.

We will also be selling advertising space on our site just like every other website and once our user base is large enough we will be generating a major portion of our revenue from this source. In addition to these sources we will be going after government funding and corporate sponsorship's, these funds will be pooled together with the donations we receive to pay you the money you need. 

How it works:

Money Request Platform:

•  You create a basic profile.

•  You make a request for the money you need.

•  You make a small monthly donation to the company for posting your ad on our website.

•  We collect the funds that are donated and all other money that we generate and pay it back to the users that make requests for it on a first come first serve basis. 

Auction Platform:

•  You create a basic profile.

•  You set up your account subscription based on the number of items you want to list for sale.

•  when selling your items you will never be charge a final value fee, the only fees you will pay will be your subscription amount.

•  we take these funds and added it to the money request donation funds and then we pay it back to the people who have requested it.

It’s that simple and you have no obligation to pay it back.

What We Need & What You Get:

We are looking for your help now so we can help you and millions of others in the days, weeks, months and years to come. We are looking to raise $75,000 for website design, development, website testing, to purchase some additional computer equipment, to hire a marketing campaign manager to create and implement an effective marketing strategy, and to pay for all the online setup expenses, business licenses and administration cost.

If we exceed our funding goal by enough we plan to expand our site to offer our services internationally and as we progress we will entertain the idea of adding new services to our platform.

By helping us now, you will have the opportunity to post your request before anyone else does and since the request payouts are on a first come first serve platform you will be among the first to receive the money you want. Depending on how much you can help you will also be able to have free posting privileges for a certain specified time. For more details on this please check out our perks to the right.

The Impact:

Every little bit of help will get us closer to the realization of our business which is helping you. With the help you can provide us now, we will be able to help millions of people in the years to come by reducing their debt load and getting them the assistance they need. If you have been looking for that one thing that will really make a difference in the world and will be a game changer, well you have found it, this is it!

Other Ways You Can Help:


We understand that not everyone is in the position to help us out financially, but if you would still like to help we have put together a list of things that would help us out a lot. Help us spread the word!

•  Share our campaign with all your social network contacts.

•  Make post and tag your friends on Facebook, Twitter, Hi5, MySpace, LinkedIn, and any other social networks you are part of.

•  Blog about us.

•  Post some ads on classified ad sites such as Kijiji, Craigslist, Used Everywhere etc.

  Talk about us in groups and forums.

•  Let everyone you come in contact with know about us.

•  Send a quick note to your friends by email or text.

•  Like and comment on our social network pages. 

•  Copy this list, send to all your friends and ask them to do the same.

The faster that we get the word out the faster you and your friends get the money you need!!

Automate Facebook, Google+, Twitter, Pinterest, LinkedIn and Instagram:

Complete automation for your social media accounts, pages, groups and communities. Automate Facebook, Google+, Twitter, Pinterest, LinkedIn and Instagram  The Best and The Cheapest all in one tool for your marketing campaigns.

http://www.massplanner.com/?ap_id=lynked21

story:
The Birth of Huckstart.com

"At Huckstart, we don't think it's ok to rely on the general public as a sales base, and then behind closed doors laugh about, or mock who most of those people are." - Keith

Keith is a computer genius who was denied a job as an iOS engineer at Godaddy because he is a Christian, and because of his physique. Godaddy forwarded Keith an email that was meant for HR staff which read:

"about keith he's great for the job in skills but he looks worse for wear do we really want an obeese christian? is that what our new image requires of us" 

After receiving this email, Keith spent several months humiliated and depressed. He was too embarrassed to talk to anyone about what happened to him. 

After about 11 months of depression, willing to forgive, forget and to wipe the slate clean, Keith reached out to Godaddy and asked for an apology. Godaddy refused to apologize. Adding insult to injury, Godaddy insisted that they did not send the email to Keith, and that either Godaddy was "hacked" or that Keith had fabricated the email.

Turning a negative into a positive, Keith started Huckstart.com to offer a higher quality general web solutions company to the public, and one that truly understands its customers.

"I want to make a better product than what's out there, and I want to do it in a company with principals where what happened to me, never happens to anyone ever again" Keith said.

At Huckstart, we don't think its ok to claim to be the "go to" web solutions company for the general public as well as small business owners, and then make an average product. 

At Huckstart, our goal is to replace the old regime and become the new world leader in domain registrar, web hosting, and general web solutions.

We will do this by giving you a higher quality product, from a company who understands who those products are for. Our success will force other companies to look at Huckstart as an example.

Please help us give you a better product, and help change a darkening trend in the tech world!

Please support this new company and its cause! Our goal is $500,000 but let's not stop there!


Sincerely,

The Huckstart team
