story:
Hello, 

My name is Chef Robert and my company is called Noel's Kitchen Inc. I am a Chef, raised in East Harlem, graduated from college in the Bronx, and did my culinary training in Louisiana (New Orleans, Baton Rouge, Shreveport). 

I started Noel's Kitchen several years ago just as a catering company. I fought through the many ups & downs. The company has now grown and I along with my wife and team are scaling this company to open up our own full service restaurant.

We started this crowd funding campaign to help bring my dream to life - a full service Restaurant serving Authentic Louisiana Style (Cajun, Creole, Southern, BBQ) Cuisine to the New York City Metro Area! My wife & I have pulled together about $30,000. This amount covers down payment, architect fee, some kitchen equipment, permits, and a portion of the construction cost. I have about an additional $10,000 in kitchen equipment that I've been using from my catering company and I plan to move it to the new site. At this point we REALLY need your help!!! 

We need to raise $25,000 to cover the additional expenses. We have already signed the lease and purchased multiple items. We have had some unexpected costs which is impacting our opening. I never want to stop serving Addictively Delicious Foods. 

We Need : $25,000

  • An additional $10,000 towards Construction
  • Additional equipment
  • A Starting Inventory
  • Rebuild our website
  • Uniforms
This restaurant will offer you not just great food & service, but a unique experience like you're right in the heart of New Orleans during the festive months. Complete with beads & hats, and periodically offer live JAZZ music. We are located right in the heart of the Bedford-Stuyvesant area in Brooklyn, NY.
I am determined to open Noel's Kitchen and I promised myself that it will be a success.

The Impact

You, as the donor, Helping us Build, will be helping our communities as well.

  • Noel's Kitchen strives to be a totally GREEN organization. 
  • We will offer steady internship & employment opportunities to rising culinary & hospitality professionals.  
  • We will give ex-offenders an opportunity to be employed at Noel's Kitchen.
  • You will help us fight Cancer, I currently make an annual in kind donation to the American Cancer Society and will increase this gift.

Risks & Challenges

Since I started this company there have been many pitfalls I have had to overcome. I'm doing this crowd-funding campaign because I cannot go the traditional routes of raising capital, like banks or other financial institutions. 

I served 9 years in a Federal Prison for a crime I didn't even know about. I can't change that and I'm tired of being angry about it. I'm a trained Chef and a college graduate. I applied to numerous food service establishments and not one company or organization hired me. I was told on many occasions that, "We don't help people like you". I just couldn't find a job. So I did the only thing I could think of doing- I created one. 

Since 2011 I have been consistently building the business. It has been a tremendous challenge but I haven't given up. It took a while but finally I broke down that wall. I just kept going and going. Never succumbing to failure.

Other Ways You Can Help

Now we know everyone can't contribute financially but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Spread the word about Noel's Kitchen
  • Share this campaign on Social Media
  • Sign up for our newsletters and blogs
  • Follow Us on facebook and twitter 
  • Donate your services
  • Make an In Kind donation

Thank you for taking the time out and listening. Thank you all from Chef Robert Crawford and the entire Staff here at Noel's Kitchen.

story:
I hope to open Cincinnati’s first eco-friendly hair salon. Beyond that, I hope to inspire change in today’s wasteful beauty industry all while providing an exceptional hair service and experience for each client.

Your contribution will be met with an exclusive offer to experience hair services inside the salon.

I am raising money to purchase a certified green “tiny home,” hire local builders and artists, and transform it into Vagabond Salon.

I have been a hairstylist for ten years and am incredibly passionate about what I do.

The day I went to tour my cosmetology school, I fell in love with the idea of doing hair. They had huge banners hung from the ceiling that grazed the floor and showcased students who had participated in the North American Hair-styling Awards. I looked at mother and said, “I’m going to do that and I’m going to have my own banner.” I did just that. In 2010 I was nominated for Student Hairstylist of the Year. That experience showed me with hard work and determination, anything is possible. I put forth that attitude in everything that I do.

Why do I need this money?

The money raised will go towards purchasing the shell of the salon, bringing it home and hiring builders and artists to transform it into my innovative dream. I need $25,000 to do this.

Every dollar you donate will help towards opening the city’s first portable, green salon.

Beyond money- I need your help spreading the word

On top of offering exceptional hair care, Vagabond Salon is a one-of-a-kind experience in a unique atmosphere. Share it with a friend.

story:
Our Story

--- · ---

I’m Tatevik Aghababyan, the founder of the Debed Co-living and Workation House, designer, perpetual traveler and enterpreneur born in Armenia. After living 15 years in Germany, I traveled around-the-world almost 75.000km in 6 months to came back to Armenia in June 2016 and discover my homeland with brand new eyes.

--- · ---

Not only I realised how unique and special Armenia is, but I started identifying amazing potentials around me.

 

  • Armenia is still very much undiscovered by traveler around the world
  • Its very compact and easy to explore - scenic nature, ancient cultural heritage, modern urban life, authentic rural experience - Armenia is a small country of wide choices!
  • Armenia is cheap to travel, safe and traveler friendly. 
  • It has great connectivity and mobile coverage (both good and cheap - great news for digital nomads!).

I also realised, that I've collected a lot of experience and knowledge during my years in Germany and around the world, that might be of vital importance for local economy. I didn't know how to make a better use of my global know-how and fresh perspectives, until I accidentally found myself in a little Village Debed, in the northern Lori Province.

--- · ---

The breathtaking scenery and the "frozen-in -time" life there were so authentic and enchanting, that inspired me to found a this project and share this hidden gem with the traveler around the world.

 

 

Luckily I found a tiny house for sale right in the heart of the villages. Without hesitating I made the downpayment right the same week and marked the June 2016 as the beginning of my passion project.

Short after that I started working with local architect from Yerevan on the concept of the house.The initial plan to create a little hideaway evolved to a much bigger idea of shared living concept, where I could host like minded people to live and work together, and inspire each other. In summer 2017 we started the construction of the guesthouse by engaging local workforce only.

 

The Concept

--- · ---

Shared living is not a novelty, however, sharing space and being productive can be challenging!

 

The guests of our house should have cost effective and comfortable living, suitable for remote working in a healthy and vitalising surrounding, closely connected with nature & midst local life. With the help of local architect Lucine Mkhoyan we crafted this concept reflecting the traditional architecture of the village with modern touch, keeping our main focus on the needs of modern (digital) nomads and location independent professionals.

 

Our co-living & workation house is located in Debed Village of Lori Province in Armenia. It merges seamlessly with the scenic landscape, facing south the soft green hills, which inspired us for the massive glass facade framed in traditional symmetrical shape. The local materials and the original remains of the old house define look of the new Debed House. With modern materials and construction techniques we aim to create high level of comfort meeting the needs of modern living, while being connected with nature and local life. 

--- · ---

Debed Co-Living & Workation House is designed to provide balanced mix of comfort, privacy and social experience - as much of each as desired.

 

THE GROUND FLOOR

The lofty ground floor is all about socializing, with the living and dining areas, the cozy library and the large kitchen merging with another outdoor kitchen with a stone oven remained from the old house. 

 

THE 1ST FLOOR

Here we have four comfortable bedrooms with private bathrooms. The rooms are spacious and include a work corner, for the times when privacy is preferred. 

 

THE ATTIC

The lofty co-working space is located in the panoramic attic. The views from here are the best. This is the spot for inspiring brainstorms and productive work sessions. Hi-Speed Wifi is available an all areas of the house.

 

The location

--- · ---

While Armenia is "off-the-beaten-path" for most of the traveler, the northern region of it is even less explored.

 

Lori Province is, undoubtedly, one of the most beautiful regions in Armenia. Canyons, mountains, lush forest, ancient churches, absolutely beautiful! Lori is rich of cultural treasures. Haghpat and Sanahin Monasteries, both UNESCO World Heritage Sites are located here. Odzun Church (5th Century) is one of the oldest Christian churches in the world, counts to Loris historical gems.

Debed Village has a star shape, spread over soft hills in a hidden gorge.

It is located next to the Debed River Canyon, providing milder local climate with long green summers and picturesque colourful falls. It is just 1,5-2 hours away from Yerevan, the capital city of Armenia. The Georgian border is just an hour away, thus the location is great for the ones, who want to explore both Armenia and Georgia. 

 

 

Lori will please the nature lovers with the wide choice of outdoor activities: whitewater rafting, hiking, trekking, horse riding, biking, you name it! Dilijan and Sevan Lake are really close and can be reached in less than an hour. 

The video reveals Armenias beauty.

 
 

Construction 

--- · ---

We started the construction of the house in summer 2017 by engaging local workforce only.

 

We prepared the construction ground and finished the foundation of the house by the winter 2017. In early spring 2018 we continued with the concrete structure and proceeded the roof. Simultaneously we restored the old stone oven, which was a part of the old house and is going to be the centrepiece of the outdoor kitchen.

 

The Social Impact

Why you should support us?

--- · ---

It is not about building another guesthouse…

 Our project has already social & economical impact and we hope to increase it.
 

  • Our house will create new jobs in the village.

     Since the very beginning we engaged the local workforce only, 5-10 people were continuously working at the construction, thus this project became an important economical factor in the village of just 250 households. The functioning guesthouse will offer permanent work places.

  • We aim to boost the local potential and help the community to merchandise their goods and services.

    Our guests will enjoy fantastic local organic food produced by the villagers. With some training and education we will help the locals to offer tours and other services to our guests. 

  • We would love to become a role modelfor others.

    We hope to inspire and encourage others to invest in rural communities and evolve the local potential, thus develop the vital small business in Armenia. 


Risks

Although we work hard to meet our deadlines, the construction is complex and has risks.  We hope to have warm winter and early spring, which would enable us continuous progress. One thing is true - this house is real, the non return point has been reached long ago.

 

How Can You Help?

--- · ---

We work hard to launch the guesthouse by the fall 2019. Please support us in raising $30,000 to finish the construction of the house and meet our deadline . All funds will go towards construction, interior design and furniture.

We are happy to reward your contributions. If you are interested in exploring Armenia and Lori Region, please be our guests! You are very welcome to stay at Debed House and use all facilities with significant discounts. Check out the various options listed in our Perks.

--- · ---

Other Ways to Help Us

If you are not in a position to make a financial contribution, you still can support us sharing  this with your family and friends to get the word out about our project in wonderful Armenia. Please help us to make the Debed co-living and workation house happen!!

--- · ---

With the help of local architect Lucine Mkhoyan we crafted this concept reflecting the traditional architecture of the village with modern touch, keeping our main focus on the needs of modern (digital) nomads and location independent professionals.
 

Our co-living & workation house is located in Debed Village of Lori Province in Armenia. It merges seamlessly with the scenic landscape, facing south the soft green hills, which inspired us for the massive glass facade framed in traditional symmetrical shape. The local materials and the original remains of the old house define look of the new Debed House. With modern materials and construction techniques we aim to create high level of comfort meeting the needs of modern living, while being connected with nature and local life. 
--- · ---
Debed Co-Living & Workation House is designed to provide balanced mix of comfort, privacy and social experience - as much of each as desired.

 
THE GROUND FLOOR
The lofty ground floor is all about socializing, with the living and dining areas, the cozy library and the large kitchen merging with another outdoor kitchen with a stone oven remained from the old house. 

 
THE 1ST FLOOR
Here we have four comfortable bedrooms with private bathrooms. The rooms are spacious and include a work corner, for the times when privacy is preferred. 

 
THE ATTIC
The lofty co-working space is located in the panoramic attic. The views from here are the best. This is the spot for inspiring brainstorms and productive work sessions. Hi-Speed Wifi is available an all areas of the house.

 
The location
--- · ---
While Armenia is "off-the-beaten-path" for most of the traveler, the northern region of it is even less explored.
 

Lori Province is, undoubtedly, one of the most beautiful regions in Armenia. Canyons, mountains, lush forest, ancient churches, absolutely beautiful! Lori is rich of cultural treasures. Haghpat and Sanahin Monasteries, both UNESCO World Heritage Sites are located here. Odzun Church (5th Century) is one of the oldest Christian churches in the world, counts to Loris historical gems.

Debed Village has a star shape, spread over soft hills in a hidden gorge.
It is located next to the Debed River Canyon, providing milder local climate with long green summers and picturesque colourful falls. It is just 1,5-2 hours away from Yerevan, the capital city of Armenia. The Georgian border is just an hour away, thus the location is great for the ones, who want to explore both Armenia and Georgia. 
 

 
Lori will please the nature lovers with the wide choice of outdoor activities: whitewater rafting, hiking, trekking, horse riding, biking, you name it! Dilijan and Sevan Lake are really close and can be reached in less than an hour. 

The video reveals Armenias beauty.

 
 
Construction 
--- · ---
We started the construction of the house in summer 2017 by engaging local workforce only.
 
We prepared the construction ground and finished the foundation of the house by the winter 2017. In early spring 2018 we continued with the concrete structure and proceeded the roof. Simultaneously we restored the old stone oven, which was a part of the old house and is going to be the centrepiece of the outdoor kitchen.

 
The Social Impact
Why you should support us?
--- · ---
It is not about building another guesthouse…
 Our project has already social & economical impact and we hope to increase it. 


Our house will create new jobs in the village.
 Since the very beginning we engaged the local workforce only, 5-10 people were continuously working at the construction, thus this project became an important economical factor in the village of just 250 households. The functioning guesthouse will offer permanent work places.


We aim to boost the local potential and help the community to merchandise their goods and services.
Our guests will enjoy fantastic local organic food produced by the villagers. With some training and education we will help the locals to offer tours and other services to our guests. 


We would love to become a role modelfor others.
We hope to inspire and encourage others to invest in rural communities and evolve the local potential, thus develop the vital small business in Armenia. 



Risks
Although we work hard to meet our deadlines, the construction is complex and has risks.  We hope to have warm winter and early spring, which would enable us continuous progress. One thing is true - this house is real, the non return point has been reached long ago.


 
How Can You Help?
--- · ---
We work hard to launch the guesthouse by the fall 2019. Please support us in raising $30,000 to finish the construction of the house and meet our deadline . All funds will go towards construction, interior design and furniture.
We are happy to reward your contributions. If you are interested in exploring Armenia and Lori Region, please be our guests! You are very welcome to stay at Debed House and use all facilities with significant discounts. Check out the various options listed in our Perks.

--- · ---
Other Ways to Help Us
If you are not in a position to make a financial contribution, you still can support us sharing  this with your family and friends to get the word out about our project in wonderful Armenia. Please help us to make the Debed co-living and workation house happen!!
--- · ---

story:
Who we are

Aloha! My name is January, and I've spent the last 10 years teaching yoga, fitness, and nutrition here in San Diego. Within that time my dream has become to create a beautiful community gathering place for ALL things health and wellness.

Inspired by my childhood days in Hawaii, the wellness retreats we've led to the Fiji Islands, and our love of the outdoors, I want to bring a little of the wildness of nature, and that slow easy pace of island time, to our city. 

The Wild Island Experience

Imagine walking into a lush, urban jungle and rolling out your mat for a morning class; you'll move, sweat, and get a little high on oxygen with a breath-work session to close your class. Afterwards you might pop into the Finnish Sauna for more relaxation time, taking a dip into the chill plunge after to wake up your senses. Or roll up your mat and browse the greenery looking for a new plant baby to adopt. Maybe you'll pick up a brand new, totally clean-ingredient product - from natural deodorant to my favorite lunar-infused face serum. 

You can also book a treatment with our in-house esthetician and sugaring specialist, to really treat yourself to a full self-care day. 

Adding to your healthy routine of fitness and food, I want to offer a sanctuary space where you can come to breathe, unwind, and connect to nature in our urban jungle. All while shopping for household and body care items that are completely clean, that you can trust to truly nourish your body from the inside out. 

We are on our way to creating this oasis, but we need your help! 

Your Contribution

With your support, the funds raised will pay for essential costs of building out our space. We've got a great start, but I want to bring in better flooring (so you can sprawl out and really relax in sweet sweet savasana), upgraded lighting (let's get a skylight in this baby for the plants!), and upgrades to our Sauna & chill plunge patio.  

I've also been working diligently on connecting with all the makers of products that I love, have vetted, and 100% trust to use on my body and around the house, and your support will help me stock the shop with an amazing assortment of everything you might need to clean up your beauty, body care, and nourishment routine. 

What You'll Get

We're excited about the perks we'e put together for you in gratitude for your contributions, from some sweet swag to discounted classes, early membership pricing, and special event & workshop invites!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge so far has been in completely jumping into this project with all I've got! This is now my job and my passion rolled into one, and it's always a little scary to become totally self employed! But I know that this space is what you - my community - want and deserve! A true sanctuary space for all things health and wellness, and a place to connect to like-minded, eco conscious, kombucha loving people like us!

Other Ways You Can Help

- Follow us on Instagram @wildisland.collective

- Like us on Facebook

- Share our Indie Go Go Page to your Facebook

- Stop by the shop and say hello! We are at 35th and Adams Ave in Normal Heights, and we hope to see you there soon!

THANK YOU! We are very grateful for your support!

 

Contact us with questions: hello@wildisland-collective.com

story:
We feel that it is essential to be able to provide our community with a local bookstore, and we are grateful for the 47 years we have served you in that role.

Breakwater Books also believes in the importance of having a place for the community to gather, share ideas, and explore books in a warm and people-centered environment. Our well-read and friendly booksellers are always available to help you find a book. Often, customers will discuss with each other what they are reading, leading to new and exciting finds. Other times, we are a place to just stop in and chat. This experience cannot be replicated by purchasing books online.

OUR HISTORY

In 1972, Marion Young and Marion Harold opened a small, independent bookstore in Guilford, Connecticut. The original mission of Breakwater Books was to provide a general selection of books for children and adults and to always provide the highest level of customer service. The store has remained true to this philosophy, and continues to serve the Shoreline Community as well as greater New Haven.

In 2007, Maureen Corcoran took the helm, and the store flourished under her leadership. Forty seven years later, Breakwater Books remains an anchor on the Guilford Green with Liza Fixx at the helm.

In 2017 we developed a Three Phase Plan to move Breakwater Books into a refreshed space, expand our social media presence, and increase our inventory through upgraded systems. We have succeeded with the first two phases and are now ready to tackle Phase III.

Phase I of the plan was to renovate the interior of the store to allow for more space to host events, provide comfortable seating for customers browsing through books, and to create a dedicated room just for children’s books. This was completed in April 2017.

Phase II was to increase our marketing efforts, through Facebook, Instagram and weekly emails. We continue to hone this effort and have enjoyed hearing you mention seeing our posts about books or events!

OUR CAMPAIGN GOALS

That brings us to today and Phase III of our long range plan, where supporting your independent bookstore is an act in believing in your community. While some independent bookstores have closed over the past few years, many more continue to open and statistics show that they are on the rise.

Our community continues to tell us that you ENJOY shopping local, and you ENJOY having a bookstore in a nearby town. That will not continue to happen without the ability to move our systems into the present day where the competition is tremendous, and small bookstores are struggling to remain open.

Will you help sail Breakwater Books into these next, exciting waters?

Through this fundraising effort, we hope you can help us fulfill these two goals:

1) Upgrade our computers and network. We need to have the most current technology available to process book orders effectively and maintain our inventory.

2) Increase and diversify our inventory. With the use of newer technology and software, we can subscribe to the analytics other bookstores use to provide you with the most current and requested titles available.

HOW WILL WE DO THIS?

Over the course of 47 days – one day for each year we’ve been in business – Breakwater Books hopes to raise enough money to make these goals a reality.

HOW YOU CAN HELP

We’ve come up with a number of donation incentives that offer the community a chance to support your local bookstore and also receive something fun in return!

Browse the perks listed at the various giving levels (there really is something for everyone) and in choosing one, you will be actively investing in your community. Help us continue to navigate Breakwater Books into tomorrow.

story:
We're just two friends with a passion for dogs and a dream to bring dog lovers together.

Downtown Pups will be located in the City of Hopewell, right in the middle of new shops on E Broadway. We're introducing a new grooming salon, doggy daycare, dog bakery and boutique to the community. The Hopewell Downtown Partnership is helping to revamp the City of Hopewell and we're extremely excited to be apart of it!

We plan to become very involved with the community by working with the local humane society, featuring local pet-related business in the boutique, and setting up fundraiser events. 

We need help purchasing the equipment for the grooming salon and the daycare area, and renovating costs. Your donations will go towards building a privacy fence for the yard, indoor fencing, retail shelving, grooming tub and dryer. As well as getting the permits to put up walls, fencing, and separating the kitchen from the daycare. 

This is a dream that Kayla and myself have had for a very long time. It would mean the world to us if you donated to help bring this to life. We have already gotten the zoning permits, business license, and will be placing a deposit on the building. We are so so excited to see where this amazing adventure will take us, and how many awesome dogs and dog lovers we will meet!

story:
Short Summary

We plan on opening Renegade Kitchen April 15th, 2019. Renegade Kitchen will be a food truck that will provide craft breakfast fare for locals, as well as an expanded menu designed for catering events at local wineries. we will provide five breakfast sandwiches, three different kinds of grits and gravy, three salads, some smaller side options. We will also provide teas, coffee, seasonal smoothies, acai bowls, and soft drinks. With the lack of breakfast options in the surrounding area the goal is to provide quick, healthy, thoughtful food to local consumers on the go.

 

 It is Renegade Kitchens’ goal to use sustainable, local ingredients as a template for menu creation. The Willamette Valley has an abundance of agriculture that offers a wide selection of fresh, seasonal produce, as well as many farms that provide sustainable practices in the farming of livestock. With us being a few hours from the coast, it also offers a large array of seasonal wild-caught and farmed seafood. The Pacific Northwest is a mecca for agriculture and sustainable food culture.

 

The Willamette Valley has seen a steady rise in local tourism in the last decade. The wine industry in Yamhill County has seen an exponential growth in traffic with no expected decline in sight and has become a premier destination in the world of wine tourism. Yamhill County has a disproportionate number of tourists to restaurants and places to eat, especially between the months of March and October. With a largely untapped market, we believe Renegade Kitchen will have an uninhibited entrance into the dining space and with the combined experience and energy of the team, will be wildly successful.

Who Are We?

Nicholas Bell, Co-Owner

     Nick Bell has worked in the food and service industry for a total of nine years and has worked in a variety of restaurants. In 2012 Nick attended Le Cordon Blue and then finished his culinary degree at Oregon Coast Culinary Institute. At these schools he learned classic French cooking techniques, and the base knowledge of French cuisine. He’s held a management position in different capacities for six years and one of his strongest skill sets is managing a team and training cooks on how to efficiently work a line during a busy service.

 

     In 2014, Nick helped start a breakfast, bread, and coffee company called Silver Stallion Coffee and Bread in Gallup NM, where he designed, prepped, and served a brunch, breakfast, and sandwich menu. The next chapter of Nick’s career led him back to Portland Oregon, where he Accepted a line position at Ned Ludd under chef Jason French. In this position he trained new line cooks and took part in menu development. In 2017 he accepted a position at Ruddick/Wood, under chef Paul Losch as a sous chef wherein he managed a large team, as well as ordered from local/regional purveyors, managed inventory, oversaw menu development, catering, large animal butchery, and much line/prep training.

 

     Nick has a strong understanding of how to utilize local and seasonal ingredients in the Pacific Northwest and has developed a strong love for live fire cooking which we hope to utilize through Renegade Kitchen. He has maintained many strong connections with local food purveyors in the Willamette valley and they will be his preferred source of food. In the culinary world there is never a ceiling for knowledge, but he is confident that he has the experience and drive to make Renegade Catering a success

 

Wesley Jones, Co-Owner

     Wesley is currently the owner of Tour Cascadia LLC, a wine and adventure tourism company. Tour Cascadia has grown from being run solely by Wesley to employing three people through the tour season and turned a profit by Q2 of the first fiscal year. The company is currently in the process of doubling its workforce in fiscal year two. The company has exceeded his expectations, and Wesley credits the number of word of mouth referrals for the unforeseen growth.

 

    Wesley has a degree in business management and was the Student Body President of George Fox University in 2012/2013. His area of expertise is personnel management and is an expert networker. The majority of his work history has been in food, drink and hospitality. He has a combined eight years of barista experience, and three of those years were spent in a position of management. While completing his time as George Fox University, he accepted a valet position and moved into a front desk, guest services role at The Allison Inn and Spa. That experience was the introduction to the attention to detail and hospitality that he would base, and exceed, his treatment of guests in all business spaces.

 

    Wesley has a deep belief that the treatment of employees and community are the most important way a person can effect change. The combination of transitioning from low man on the ladder, in the hospitality world, to owning a thriving company has given him the perspective and experience needed to provide the highest of customer service, as well as creating a working environment that is empowering and focused on meeting the needs of those that come alongside us to make this dream a reality.

What We Need & What You Get

     We need a total of $20,000 to completely fund the project. We have already self funded several thousand of it ourselves and are working to secure some private funding. We are asking you to partner with us for a total of $10,000.

     Down below you will see all of the perks of participating in our funding campaign. We cant wait to feed you and get to know you on a personal level.

     If we don't get all of the funding needed to secure the truck, we will rent space in a commercial kitchen and continue to cater events and provide food options to wineries that don't want to, or are unable to start their own food program.

The Impact

     Your contribution will enable us to secure our truck. We are going to purchase the truck that was previously used by prominent local restaurant after they had to relocate due to a kitchen fire. It is perfectly set up to allow us to not only serve high quality food out of the truck, but to be able to cook on site for catering events.

     We have already catered events for groups ranging from 20 people, to 200 people.

     Our downtown location will provide high quality breakfast and lunch sandwiches and sides for an accessible price four days a week.

Risks & Challenges

      We don't have the capital to start this project on our own. We have already trimmed all of our expenses, nearly $15,000, to be able to launch. We have decided to both maintain employment to self fund as much of the project as we can. We are confident that within six months we will be able to allow nick to scale back from his other work to pursue cooking from the truck exclusively.

Other Ways You Can Help

     We know that not all of our neighbors have the means to contribute monetarily, but we would be so grateful if you could all help us spread the word about our project!

     Ways you can contribute

  • Give Monetarily
  • Like and share our social platforms

We have decided to both maintain employment to self fund as much of the project as we can. We are confident that within six months we will be able to allow nick to scale back from his other work to pursue cooking from the truck exclusively.

Other Ways You Can Help
     We know that not all of our neighbors have the means to contribute monetarily, but we would be so grateful if you could all help us spread the word about our project!
     Ways you can contribute

Give Monetarily
Like and share our social platforms

story:
ABOUT LOYALTY:

We aim to be the Mid-Atlantic’s neighborhood spot for a wonderful variety of books, unique home goods, gifts, and event programming. Our staff and selection highlight the diverse voices and creative minds that characterize our communities. We are currently located on Upshur Street in the Petworth neighborhood of Washington, DC and recently completed a successful pop-up in Downtown Silver Spring, Maryland. Loyalty’s goal is to create bookstores and programming spaces based on the needs and involvement of our community. We're a black, queer, woman owned space staffed by experienced booksellers and those looking to grow their neighborhood. 

We are seeking your assistance to help fund a new pop-up store in Downtown Silver Spring this fall and to secure a lease for a permanent location in 2020. Additionally, funds will be used for our DC location’s event space, the Reading Room, which exists in partnership with the Petworth Citizen bar. In order to provide more robust and diverse programming for the Reading Room, we are planning a light renovation to allow for better flow behind the bar and more flexible seating in the space itself. 

Washington, DC and Silver Spring, MD are in the midst of a small business boom which offers Loyalty Bookstores a unique opportunity to not only serve our immediate neighborhood but to expand our brand by means of access to larger social groups, both physical and virtual. Increased brand visibility and media access will provide Loyalty the opportunity to meet the needs of consumers far beyond the immediate blocks surrounding our brick and mortar stores. We will extend our reach into our own neighborhoods and beyond with e-commerce, subscription boxes, community programming based on small, paid gatherings, and happy hours for adults. Our Silver Spring location will also include a simple cafe offering coffee, tea and light snacks. Weekends at Loyalty Bookstores will feature children’s storytimes, geared toward parents looking for an intellectually stimulating community gathering spot for people of all ages.

With your help, Loyalty Bookstores will serve the communities of two distinct, evolving areas for a long time to come. Whether you already love Loyalty or you are just meeting us for the first time, we hope you will consider supporting us through this Indiegogo campaign.

WHAT WE OFFER:

We’ll be offering a space where you can not only find the best in books by major publishers, but hidden gems from independent presses and local authors that you wouldn’t see anywhere else. 

During our previous pop-up in Silver Spring we partnered with local gift vendors for special markets where a diverse group of creators could feature their work. We consider this an integral part of our mission as it not only provides an outlet for our local artists and creatives, but creates a much needed retail space for communities looking to find the right gifts and home goods. Downtown Silver Spring and Petworth, DC are vibrant communities, so our retail space and selection should reflect that. We cannot promise that Loyalty will always have everything, but what we have will never be bland!

Our programming will be similarly driven by the flavors of Petworth and Silver Spring. Our store serves up queer, diverse and intersectional events for every age! Whether it is an Agatha Christie & Sherry book club, a drag queen storytime, a panel of poets discussing protest, or a bestselling author discussing their new novel, we keep our community at the center of our minds when booking events. 

WHO IS BEHIND LOYALTY?

At the center of Loyalty Bookstores is Hannah Oliver Depp, a long-time bookseller who has been working nationally to expand the mission of local bookstores and ensure a competitive future in independent retail. At the heart of Hannah’s mission is a desire to bring diverse and local offerings to communities who do not see themselves equally represented. Black, queer owned and operated businesses have a unique chance to offer representation and engender excitement.

Joining Hannah is Gene Taft, who has over 25 years in the publishing and promotion end of the book business, including nine years as a small business owner. Gene is excited to continue working to put books for all ages into reader’s hands and delving deeper into the retail end of the industry.

Our bar partner is Chantal Tseng, a sommelier, mixologist, US Sherry Ambassador and creator of the well known Literary Cocktail program here in DC. In addition to working tirelessly to program the Reading Room shared by Petworth Citizen and Loyalty Bookstore, Chantal hosts natural wine nights, and educates the DC area on Sherry and cocktail history and technique. Chantal will be creating our bar menu at the Reading Room in Petworth and the Loyalty Cafe and Bar as well as continuing her work each weekend as the mixologist for her Literary Cocktails program. 

We are committed to having a diverse staff of booksellers in the full sense of the word that brings together the communities of Petworth, Silver Spring, and book lovers everywhere. 

OKAY COOL... WHEN CAN WE ACTUALLY SHOP AT LOYALTY?

Right now we’re open in our Petworth location and will be expanding our programming and Reading Room Bar offerings throughout the 2019-2020 year with the goal of renovations being finished in February 2020, on the one year anniversary of opening on Upshur St. We’re proud to be on Georgia Avenue and part of the small business, female owned and minority powered core of DC’s community. Can’t make it to Petworth? Check out our website where you can order books, download audio, or stay updated on our goings on 24/7. 

But the realization of Loyalty Bookstore doesn’t stop there. We’re ready to reopen our successful Silver Spring, MD pop-up from the 2018 Holiday season with an expanded programming and refreshment selection by October of this year! For the coming seasons and into the new year, we have a packed lineup of community based events for adults and children.

 

HERE'S WHAT WE NEED TO MAKE THIS A REALITY:

We are looking to raise $60,000 to help pay for inventory, staff, and operational expenses.

Hiring additional staff members and moving some part time staff to full time will allow both stores to quickly reach their full potential while continuing to provide quality service as we build strong, intellectual gathering places in the communities.

A significant portion of the funds we raise will go towards opening a pop-up in Silver Spring, MD by fall 2019. We are looking to sign a lease immediately and start work on the space in the hopes of an October opening. We will be purchasing a vehicle for the store that will increase our ability to partake in events and host programs outside of the store such as book fairs and festivals. 

We will also use some of the money on renovations for The Reading Room (an event space we share with Petworth Citizen) to cover the costs of essential improvements that will allow us to increase the frequency and variety of event offerings! We will also finish work on the exterior of the store and update our entrance and lighting for improved safety. 

PERKS!

  • $10 A Loyalty Sticker
  • $20 Collection of 4 buttons
  • $50 Loyalty Koozie
  • $75 A Loyalty Tshirt
  • $100 A Signed book from one of our fav authors + Sticker
  • $200 Two Signed Books + Buttons
  • $300 VIP Invite to grand opening party in Silver Spring + Tote Bag
  • $500 Special one time Shopping Spree for 30% off
  • $800 you get a bundle of all the perks
  • $1000 Reserved Table in Silver Spring Cafe or Petworth Reading Room for 3 months
  • $3000 A year of subscription box and Inscription on the Wall of Fealty

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

We know everyone is not flush with extra cash right now. There is a still a lot that can be done to make this bookstore a-go-go.

Share the word! You can use the Indiegogo share tools to get the message out about Loyalty. We deeply appreciate it.

Share our membership options with folks or save one for yourself in the future. Ditto with a gift card. Gift cards bring folks into the store and help with our cashflow. We love meeting new customers who come in to redeem their gift card or use it online to meet us digitally. 

Partner with us on an event! Submit an idea here.

story:
Become a part of the Organic foods revolution by backing up our Greenery Juice Bar project. We are looking for foodies with a charitable heart who can help us introduce our nutritious organic super food juices, nut milks, snacks, smoothie bowls, wellness shots and more to our community.

Wellness Shot pictured Below:


Who We Are

Believe it or not you are what you eat. Even though the influence of our diets may not always be so obvious when we are young, after time goes by it becomes more and more apparent that what we put into your bodies determines how well our bodies function. Our Tagline is "Relax. Rebalance. Reboot." Sometimes we all need to recharge not only our minds but our bodies as well. Juicing has had a long reputation for lowering blood pressure, strengthening the immune system, reducing cancer, clearing skin, weight loss, and more. Unfortunately, in today's world, it really is hard and time consuming to find the time to consistently juice on a daily basis. Not only is it hard to find the time to juice,  but it is also hard to make good choices when we are bombarded with unhealthy food ads, and have to drive past unhealthy fast food restaurants on every corner.  That’s why we came up with the idea to promote 100% natural organic, fresh juices, snacks, organic chia puddings, gourmet overnight oats, juice cleanses, and more for all ages. Greenery Juice is based in Orlando, FL. The Company was founded by Dwayne R and Audrey A. Dwayne and Audrey came up with the idea to implement a proper system to deliver freshly made, 100% organic juice to members of their community because of their own experiences with juicing. Check out our stories below.


Audrey's Story:
My mother suffered from several health complications, and her doctor advised that we needed to incorporate more fruits and vegetable into her diet. My mother could only eat so many salads before she got sick of eating the recommended fruits and vegetables. We later purchased a juicer and found that we could incorporate pounds of produce into a single glass of juice. Within six months, my mother went to her checkup and her doctor was amazed to find that her symptoms had dramatically reduced. Within one year, my mom was able to reverse her complications and had a renewed sense of well-being. 


Dwayne's Story:

My juicing experience started because I was always lacking energy. Between taking on a full college course load, and having a full- time job, I always felt burned out, and tired. I wasn't a huge fan of eating fruits and vegetables,  but really wanted a natural way to get vitamins and minerals to increase my energy. I started to research the effects of juicing after hearing about the benefits that juicing had on my friend, Audrey and her mom. I decided to give it a try and was amazed at how delicious juices could actually be. I later began juicing and would often pack a juice to take with me throughout the day. I was no longer feeling tired, an had a great sense of clarity due to juicing. To this day, i still no longer need any caffeine or sugar to get through my day.

Through our Experiences, we found that foods can be healing. This compelled us to create a juice delivering company that would conveniently incorporate juicing into other peoples' lives to naturally enhance their health.



Our Process & Services

Our juices are made only after the customer has selected their option. We create the juices in our local licensed co-op kitchen, and we plan to deliver juices and other products to our customers’ doorstep. We plan to build our website, which will contain recommended juices for customers with  particular needs. For example: we will list juices that can aid with weight loss, energy, promote healthy skin, and more. We also will have different recommendations depending on what flavors our customers like. Customers will even have the option of creating their own juice. We are in the process of developing an app where our customers will be able to select their delivery date and times, and also get notifications when we are on our way. That means nothing is sitting on the shelf, all the vitamins will still be intact and the juices will be less than 24 hours old upon delivery. Our organic juices are not diluted with water, and other additives that other juice making companies manufacture. This means that all the powerful nutrients are kept intact and ready to be consumed once the juices are delivered. Our juices contain anywhere from 3 to 15 different fruits and vegetables.

Below is a guide to one of our most beloved juice recipes, try it out for yourself!


We plan to launch at the beginning of January 2016 (Our plan is to be ready after the Christmas season when people are going to be more apt to make a change for the coming year). By September 2016, Greenery Juice plans on growing out of the kitchen and into our own store, The Greenery Juice Bar, where our customers can come, sit, and enjoy our products. At this time, we plan to incorporate many flavorful vegan dishes to our menu, which will allow us to cater events that our customers may have. We plan to obtain a highly visible retail location that can be easily seen by pedestrians and will lead to a rapid growth of the business. Having our very own place of operation will also allow us to obtain our own food truck, to spread the Greenery movement, message and products to many communities. 


Pictured below are Longevity, Junior bugs bunny, and Morning greens juice:


The Impact On Our Community


Greenery Kid Campaign

Apart from selling quality food, our aim is to educate our communities about the benefits of organic produce, wellness shots, and foods.The Greenery kids campaign is one of our future prospects to promote organic food consumption among our local school children. We plan to partner with local schools and libraries where we will educate kids on farming, demonstrate and have kids assist in making a batch of juice, provide samples of nutritious, healthy raw snacks and send them home with brochures and recipes for parents.  

We Are More than a Juice Bar

  • We plan to support local organic farms by providing a spotlight on our website. 
  • We plan to partner with local schools through our Greenery Kids Campaign.
  • We plan to partner with local libraries to provide samples and educate our community on the benefits of juicing and organic, sustainable farming
  • We plan to highlight a Local Charity Once A month on our website, as well as our monthly newsletter.

Bumper sticker pictured below:

(****PLEASE BE AWARE OUR WEBSITE IS NOT YET BUILT****)

Our Juice Making Process
We have spent countless hours testing and tasting our juices and have come up with the most delicious and nutrient dense combinations. We selected a range of leafy green, root, and citrus based juices for customers to enjoy. Once an order is placed before the cut-off time, the produce is washed, cut, and ready to be juiced. Our cold-pressed method is a heat-less system allows our juices to retain all vitamins and minerals and enzymes for a longer period of time and also prevents oxidization. The juices are bottled immediately and are refrigerated. The very next day, the juices are delivered between early, to mid morning . We will also offer Greenery Juice exclusives, such as our Greenery Milk, our vanilla Chai milk, and our Honey fig milks.   
E-Book included in perks pictured below:

 

What We Need & What You Get

Like any other business, there are many costs to get started. Here is where we need your help.  The following expenses, ( highlighted in the graph) will be fulfilled through your funds. Each and every one of your donations will bring us one step closer to our goal, and we couldn't be more grateful. 


We have a range of perks depending on your contribution.

  • Greenery Love: Thanking shout out on our newsletter, instagram, Twitter, and Facebook
  • Mini Gift basket with our tasty snacks and homemade, handcrafted greenery products
  • E-Book on recipes and introduction to juicing.
  • Official Greenery juice promotional t-shirt 
  • Green glass straw
  • Greenery Juice Wristband
  • Greenery juice bumper sticker

E-book included in the perks:


Other Ways You Can Help

Choose not to make a financial contribution? It’s totally OK. If you feel compelled, there are other ways to support the campaign.

  • Spread the word. Share this campaign on social media, or by word of mouth.
  • Like us on Facebook and Instagram
  • Just take care of yourself. Whether you use our juice to do that or not, get healthy, and don't forget to take time out to relax, rebalance, and reboot. You deserve it.

story:
We have an amazing dream and together we can make it come true. We want to create a utopian city-state that will be named Chloropolis. It will be modeled on ancient Greek cities such as Athens, Delphi, or Olympia.
We're not sure yet whether this will be on its own island, or just a large parcel of land somewhere, but it will be a beautiful and peaceful place where people can come for a brief vacation, or somewhere to live permanently. It will even have an opportunity for people to become a virtual citizen of Chloropolis and enjoy some of the benefits remotely – terrific for people who are unable to travel often due to family or work commitments.


How it began:
Ever since reading the books, works and thoughts of the great Greek philosophers I was fascinated by the ancient Greek culture and way of life. The philosophy, the politics, the army, the wars and everything else. Reading Homer only added to that fascination.
I often thought about what it would be like to live in that time. To live in that time AND have acces to modern technology had to be even better I thought!
That's how the idea of Chloropolis was born.

What We Need & What You Get
The first phase:
This crowdfunding is part of the first phase in the building of Chloropolis.
This means that we will use whatever we collect to start building a community (virtually and in real life), buy a piece of land or an island, and maybe build the first few buildings if possible. This way we can create a sort of base. From there we can work further towards our goals and start the second phase.
The second phase:

First of all, we want to create a vibrant city center that will house a Greek-style Senate, temples, a marketplace, a theatre, an arena for Olympic-style games, and then have smaller buildings surrounding the city center – temples, schools, houses, stables, farms, and many other buildings as well. If we can find someplace with levels, I’d like to build an Acropolis or high city up on a cliff overlooking the main city. The best part is that every building will be built with environmentally friendly materials and will be run on renewable and green energy.

                                 


Chloropolis will be a cross between a tourist attraction and a real, working city. We are going to create some replicas of actual Greek villas or traditional hotels for our guests. All guests and permanent citizens will be given an opportunity to select a Greek name they would like, and can choose to wear a Chiton or Greek tunic when going around the city. They are actually extremely comfortable in the hot and humid Mediterranean climate.


Another great feature is that Chloropolis will be run in a true Greek tradition of Democracy. The citizens will be allowed to vote on a flag, a method of currency, the Patron Gods of the City, as well as the members of the Senate that will decide the laws, rules and customs of our little community.

                       

One of the most important areas of the city will be “Temple Square”. We will create at least two big temples there and maybe a few smaller ones. One will be for the Patron God of the city, and one will be to honor our financial contributors. Each contributor over a certain level will be given the chance for a statue of their very own to remain permanently in the temple of the backers.

We are also planning a city-wide “Olympic” games every two years. Our citizens will compete against each other until we have the top representatives in every category. Then we will compete against other invited nations for the International Championship and Gold, Silver, and Bronze medals. The games will be based not on traditional, modern Olympics, but will be modeled on the historic Greek games – (although we will not follow the original tradition of competing entirely in the buff!) We will design some type of appropriate sports outfits, and will  pursue a traditional training program. 

Since education was a very important principle in Ancient Greece, our city will have an academy for all ages. This building will be very important because in the academy people will be able to receive wisdom. There will be guest speakers in Science, Physics, Astronomy, Philosophy, Theology (Atheism), as well as courses in traditional Greek Philosophy. There will also be a lot of research on green practices and renewable energy, so we will help to keep the Earth and its people healthy.

The Impact

We want to give the citizens and funders of Chloropolis a chance to make a change in the world by helping to create a utopian base of knowledge, beauty, splendour and nature. If they want to live or take vacation in a society where they can get away from the grimness, the stress and the speed of the modern world. This is a big goal and it will take big money to accomplish. Our initial goal is 2 million dollars. We know that is a tremendous amount – quite possibly the one of the larger campaigns in IndieGoGo history, but if we work together, we can accomplish this. 
Just imagine what it would be to live in such an idyllic city such as this, and get away from the modern toil and stress. We would love to create a team of committed individuals to make this dream a reality. Please contact us if you are interested in being one of the founding members to help get this project off the ground.

Risks & Challenges

No project comes without risk, but the best way to mitigate that risk is to surround the project with knowledgeable people who will collaborate and work together to succeed. This is exactly what we’re going to do, leveraging the success of this campaign to acquire the best and brightest minds to move forward, be it partnerships with the likes of Google or Apple, or staffing with a global cadre of subject matter experts.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some of you might not be able to contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help us and be a part of the creation. Getting the word out about the project is crucial to our success, so share us on your social networks, Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, and Youtube.  Email friends and family about our project, and if you have that favorite blog that you think will love our story, let them know!

You can easily share us by using the share tools on the left side of our video!

Just a few clicks make a BIG difference!

And that's all there is to it! 

Let's create Chloropolis and change the world!!

story:
The ultimate mix and heat appliance that works without using wisks or paddles. White removable food canister rotates while heating to the perfect temperature! View the contents at all times as they stir and add ingredients at any time during the process. 


Does anyone else out there hate being tied to the stove for 20 minutes constantly stirring while making gravy or pasta sauce? Imagine, a new kitchen appliance that does away with that tedious task. MixieMate™ is a new invention that works by heating and rotating a food canister at a slight angle. The canister has a non-stick interior and is removable for easy serving and storage. It also goes right into the dishwasher for easy cleaning. There are no interior moving parts in the canister, such as paddles or a wisk. Just fill with the ingredients, push a button and a few minutes later, it is ready to serve! Use it to make any variety of gravies, soups or sauces. Make a hot fruit topping for your eggos in the morning or ice cream sundae at night. Whatever you make, no more being tied to the stove! Free at last!

story:
Hello, my name is Felix Tipper, founder of Tipper’s Gourmet Marketplace and I’d like to cook for you!

Tipper's Gourmet Marketplace is poised to be the number one destination when it comes to quality grab and go prepared foods in Palm Springs. The store will be an International market and deli that will feature a signature rotisserie chicken. In addition to the chicken the store will offer prepared breakfast, lunch and dinner items as well as specialty food items and gifts from around the world. 

Your contribution will help us with the permit and kitchen build-out portion of this journey.

The Mission of Tipper's Gourmet Marketplace is to provide the visitors and residents of Palm Springs with a place where they can discover delicious quality prepared food items, in addition to an assortment of beverages, desserts and gifts that personify and reflect the Palm Springs lifestyle and experience. 

 I've had the pleasure of cooking for and with many of you over the years, but for those of you who I haven't had the pleasure of cooking for, this store will provide me the opportunity to do that on a grander scale. 

Food and Home Entertainment are my passion and I would love the opportunity to share that passion with you. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • The 20k goal we are trying to reach will help us build our kitchen. Due to the incredible growth in Palm Springs, existing spaces with kitchens are rare, so we need to start from scratch.
  • Our perks are geared to provide a small sampling of the quality items that Tipper's Gourmet Marketplace will carry and represent. Even if you are not in the Palm Springs area, your "taste" of Tipper's Gourmet Perk will be delivered to your door as thanks for supporting this dream.
  • While I fully intend to reach our goal, all funds raised will be applied towards any start-up costs.

The Impact

  • Tipper's Gourmet Marketplace will fill a need that is universal to most of us at one time or another, "What should we have for...breakfast, lunch or dinner?"
  • This is not a new concept. The prepared food and gourmet market industry is growing in popularity every day. More and more people are turning away from "fast" food and looking for "quality" food that can be picked up and enjoyed quickly and easily at home or on-the-go. 

Risks & Challenges

I'm well aware of the many challenges that a new business faces and don't take that lightly. It has taken me the better part of 18 months to research and develop this Business Plan. I have have been enormously blessed to have acquired some of the best Mentors and Advisors who are equally committed to helping us become successful. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Every little bit helps and that includes YOUR word of mouth. 
  • If you've ever had the opportunity to enjoy something that I've prepared...PLEASE TELL A FRIEND!!
  • Check out the Indiegogo share tools!

*** For anyone interested in an Investment opportunity on a larger scale, you are free to contact me at felix.tippersgm@gmail.com***
